mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Funky Phantom Game
description:
This game is based on the 70's TV cartoon. "Funky Phantom" and his pet cat "Boo", who lived during the American Revolutionary War, appear as ghosts to three teenagers and their dog when they stumble upon Funky's haunted abode. The time was twelve midnight. In the play of the game, the players collect units of hours.

On your turn, you roll the dice and move along the track the number of spaces indicated. If you land on a Black Ghost space, you draw a card. Number cards (from 1 to 4) represent hours. A Boo The Cat card allows you to travel backwards for a turn. If you land on another player who does not occupy a Safe space, you may steal one of the player's cards. The first player who has a number of cards that total exactly 12 hours wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Square Miles
description: This is a simple trick-taking game that lets players become acquainted with the comparative size of the various countries. The cards are dealt equally among the players, cards left over are not used. Players do not look at the cards in their hand, and must hold them face down. All play the top card face up into the center of the table saying "France 213,000 square miles," or "United States 3,027,000 square miles" as the case may be. The player having the most square miles wins the trick. The player having the most tricks at the end of the game wins.

name: Frantic Ants
description: This game features a moving, battery operated track that marches the player's ants uphill and downhill towards the finish line. Each player has 5 plastic ants. On your turn, you spin the spinner and follow its instructions. If you spin a 1, 2 or 3, you place an ant on the first step of the first, second or third anthill respectively. The ant will begin "climbing" to the top of the hill and slide down the other side (where it starts climbing the next hill). If you spin a Short Cut, move an ant ahead to the Short Cut space. If you spin an Anteater, remove an opponents ant from the track and return it to that player. If you spin ZZZZZZZZ, you're asleep and skip your turn. Since all the ants are moving at once, it's best to make your move quickly. The first player to get all 5 ants to slide down the third hill and enter the Finish area wins.

name: Whitetailopoly
description:
A property-trading game. You buy ranches, build cabins and lodges, and charge to hunt.

From the news release By Art Lander Jr.HERALD-LEADER OUTDOORS WRITER:

At the start of the game, players get a bankroll of cash and roll dice to determine the order of play. Players roll the dice to move their pewter pieces around the board, and draw cards that tell them to pay or collect cash. As players move around the board, they pay for taxidermy work, bows and arrows, and firearms, and collect money from winning big-buck contests. If players land on a piece of property they don't own, they must pay to hunt.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company, The D. O. Collaborative

name: Fight Dice
description:
Fight Dice is a freely downloadable PDF-based dice based combat system adapted for action figure battles. Players allocate (six-sided) dice from a pool for each action figure to allow for movement and/or combat. Combat consists of sets of dice rolled for attack and defense (as allocated,) defense dice that are equal or higher cancel attack dice, the number of remaining attack dice are removed from the defender's dice pool. Movement is one inch for each die allocated to movement. Advanced rules allow for enhanced movement/range mechanics, foreign objects, grappling, etc.

The game guidelines state that a standard human gets 8 dice, a martial artist 20 and a Gundam Fighter gets 36. Players are encouraged to use their imagination to assign values to action figures.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Decoy: A Game of Chance
description:
A children's game that imitates duck hunting-
Retrieve ducks for high score!
Object of the Game is to close blind by placing 8 ducks on the lake. To place two decoys on the lake and to refill 'the blind' with 8 ducks to end the game.

Game contents includes the following:
1 red and 1 green die
8 each white, green, black, yellow Ducks
8 Red Decoy Ducks
1 playing board
Instructions

name: Coober Pedy
description:
This gemstone collectible game was manufactured in 1974 by Opal Syndicates LTD. in Adelaide South Australia.
A mining game that consists of 4 genuine opal counters, playing board with story and glossary, rules for playing the game, 20 opal strike cards, bank notes, 20 machinery tiles, 34 good luck cards, 20 bad luck cards, card and money holder.

name: Le Tour de France
description:
This is the predecessor of "Homas Tour", aka "Um Reifenbreite".

Each team managers receives at the start of the game 3x frs. 10,- and 2x frs. 5,-.
At the start you move the racers normally as indicated by the dice. At the next turns however you must pay great attention. On the track are places with a special sign (green star, red circle, etc). Some of these places give an advantage, others a disadvantage to the racer who is placed on it. It is your job as a team manager to try and place your racers as much as possible on the advantage places and to try and avoid the disadvantage places.

Each team manager should have a list as shown on the backside of the Table for time trial. This list is called the Yellow Jersey Standings.The racers who had the most points in the Yellow Jersey standings, is allowed to wear the yellow jersey (the yellow plastic cap is put over this racer) and he receives an additional fee of frs. 40,-.

End of the Tour
The end of the sixth stage is exactly the same as the end of the other stages, but only the racer who now wins (or keeps) the yellow jersey is the winner of the Tour and he receives now a fee of frs. 100,- instead of the usual frs. 40,-.
There are three ways to win the game:

New divison
This is the fastest and most simple way, also suitable for children. In this variant one only plays for the Yellow jersey standings. No money is used and the Green jersey score is not kept. The normally quite long playing time is now considerably shorter. At the end of each stage only the points for the Yellow jersey standings are written down and the corresponding racers receives the yellow jersey.
The winner of the tour is the one, who has the yellow jersey at the end of the Tour.

Amateurs
In this variant money isn’t used either (so no fines and/or fees). For both standings are the points written down, so the yellow and green jersey come into play. In both standings will be a winner at the end of the Tour.

Professionals
This is the Tour de France game in its most beautiful and most complete form. In this variant you use: the Yellow jersey standings, the Green jersey standings and the Banks handles all money affairs such as starting fees, race fees fines, etc. This way of playing costs more time then the two previous ways and it will take about 2 or 3 hours.

name: Um El Bagara
description:
Also known as "The Cow Game".

This is an ancient game similar to Mancala, and it originated in Africa, in the area now known as the Sudan.

The board is similar to a Mancala board, and 5 stones are placed in each of the 10 playing wells. Players take turns moving stones by picking up all the stones in a well (except for one!) then dropping a stone in each well until they run out, moving either clockwise or counter-clockwise. You skip the scoring wells and must put a stone in the well you started in (in addition to leaving one there to begin the move). A well with only a single stone cannot be moved.

After your move, starting with the well you last placed a stone into, any wells that have exactly two or four stones may be placed in your scoring well. If there is a well that you cannot score (it has a number of stone other than 2 or 4), then any that come after it in sequence may not be scored either.

The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. Any stones left on a players side of the board are added to those in his scoring well. However has the most stones is the winner.

Um el Tuweisat is considered a children's version of this game

name: Heads Up
description: Heads Up is a "Bop It" type game for young children. The game itself is a silver, robotic looking head with moving facial features. To play, you press the Start button and as one or more buttons pop out of place (the ears, jaw, hat, nose etc.) quickly press or turn them back into their proper position. If you do it fast enough you'll earn points. If your too slow a buzzer sounds and the game ends. The game announces your score at the end of each round. The game can also be played with other players. This is done the same as solo play but the game will announce, "Next Player," and is then passed to an opponent. If you get buzzed, you are eliminated. The last player in wins.

name: Soluret
description:
Theme
As a captain on your own vessel, you sail your ship to the Mediterranean following actual routes, namely those of the Swedish Orient Line. Circumstances sometimes force you to change your course. It may be expensive, but it may also be profitable. Whatever the cost, you have to return to and complete your route: that is something neccessitated by the service. In the Mediterranean and Black Sea ports you also act as business man and buyer. You may have successful business – and you may meet with difficulties – while buying the goods you will carry to Sweden or some other Northern European country. With a little concentration and some good luck – here as in reality the risks may be reduced and possibilitis of profit increased.

Gameplay
Players engage as a ship's master and take turns to roll two dices to move their ship along different paths in the mediterranean. Each player must aquire 5000 tons of cargo divided into five different goods (1000 tons each) from the harbours around the mediterranean. Players also sail during different seasons of the year and the goods requirement will differ (e.g. one player needs raisins, oranges, nuts, cotton, and tobaco while others need other goods). The types of goods are spread out at different ports and as only half of the requirement for each product can be loaded at the same port, the players will need to visit more than five ports to fulfill their requirements (with some exceptions). The game becomes a task of route optimization to visit the neccessary ports with the least number of dice rolls. Along the way sailors run the risk of encountering storms, price changes on the goods exchange, and random events received via telegram. When all goods have been aquired the players must sail back to Sweden and sell the cargo in Gothenburg and Stockholm (half in each) according to current prices on the goods exchange. The first player to finished selling all their goods ends the game.

Goal
The player with the biggest fortune in cash and goods at game end wins the game. Goods still on the ship will be worth according to current prices on the goods exchange, however, players that have not returned to Sweden will lose money for each product missing from their required goods.

Background
Soluret was released by Alga in 1958 during a jubilee for Broströms shipping company.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gioco dell'Oste
description: Rare game from International Team, it was published for an Italian liqueur (grappa) producer. The name means "The Innkeeper game". It's an abstract game where players remove from the board continuous lines of pawns, the loser is who remains with the last pawn to take away.

name: Venezia
description:
This adventure game for lovers proposes an exciting and humorous escapade in the City of Love. Players have three days to charm their partner with their artistic flair (souvenir gifts from Venice) and lovers’ skills (caresses and kisses).

The aim of the trip is to accumulate as many lovers’ points as possible through artistic endeavors and visits to monuments in Venice. The escapade culminates in a languorous night of love at the Hotel Venezia, the most romantic hotel in Venice.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Metal Armor: The Game of Space Dogfight in Dragonar
description:
This is a wargame set in the anime world of Dragonar.

Mech to mech combat, very rare and hard to find. Companion to D-Weapon: The Game of Space Combat in Dragonar

Model # HG-065

name: Jem Concert Clash
description:
From the Rulebook:

"Those nasty misfits are challenging Jem and the Holograms to a Battle of the Bands. The Holograms are trying to collect all their records and bring them to the battle. But the Misfits are blocking them at every turn. The only way to outwit the Misfits is for the Holograms to split up and each try to get as many records as possible. Which hologram will make it to the battle of the Bands first with the records she needs to win?"

This simple track game is based on the 80's TV show. Using a spinner for movement, the players travel along the paths trying to collect records by landing on record spaces. When you reach the Battle of the Bands space, you spin the spinner and add the number you spun to the number of records collected. If the total is 12 or greater you win. The game also comes with an audio cassette of Jem and the Holograms music. This tape can be used in the game by playing random song clips on Side A that sends players to the matching record space if instructed to by a card.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music

name: Barnfinans
description: The childrens edition of the game Finans. The setting is in a circus where you buy different circus acts and pay to see the other players acts.

name: Dreadnought: Return to the Dreadnoughts Age!
description:
SGB-18 Dreadnaught (1986) (JPY 3800)

Subtitled “Return to the Dreadnoughts Age!”

Two half-sized maps of all-blue, large hex water terrain. Two countersheets (308) with Panzerblitz-sized counters. Two identical single-sided PAC with 8 small charts each. A rulebook (28 pgs) with 8 scenarios ranging from 1917 to 1924 (with a SF one in 3325 (not kidding!). The rules only look to be about 5-6 pages long.

From what I have been told, this is an extremely popular game I Japan. The auction prices are all rather high, even for punched games. This might have something to do with the easy rules and only a few charts. Each counter has 6 numbers and they are back printed. The back side has two numbers reduced by one vs. the unit’s front side. There is unit facing and maybe a line movement rule. No record keeping or markers.

name: For the Record: 50's, 60's, & 70's Edition
description:
For the Record is a trivia game for those who like to Rock 'n Roll. This version (there is also a 80-90's version) is geared towards the classic era of music History: the 50's to the 70's.

As featured on Dick Barley's "American Gold" radio program, players perform the standard trivia objectives: roll the dice, move your piece, answer the question. Nothing original in the game play, but the depth of questions make this game solid gold (sorry, bad music pun...)

name: Why Knot?
description: Here's a game for Boy Scouts, Girl Scouts, and anyone else who might want to tie a knot and play a game. Teaches basic and complex knots, and develops quickness of mind and hand. The knot cards range in difficulty from 1 to 5 points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Real-time

name: The Way of Peace
description:
The Way of Peace game is a well designed Bible trivia game where players attempt to collect all six pieces of the armor of God and return to the square called "Love". Players move around a board and attempt to gain pieces of spiritual armor by correctly answering questions based on the Bible.

The game rules stress to attempt to make game play not a competition, but rather a mutual journey of learning. Nearly all of the elements of the game are symbolic (an explanation sheet is given for these symbolisms), so there are a lot of opportunities to learn as you play, not only from the 3000 question cards.

The game is pretty simple to learn, and can be played by various ages, but knowledge of the Bible and its contents will prove to be helpful unless you are playing with teams.

name: Jorden runt med SAS
description:
Jorden runt med SAS ("Around the Globe with SAS") was a company game from the pan-scandinavian air line company Scandinavian Airlines System AB. The game's idea is to travel the world with Scandinavian Airlines based on their destinations in the 1950' and 60's.

The game was sold to the public, but may also have been used as a give away by SAS. Trans-continental flights in the old days were often surrounded by exquisite food and beverages, first class service, and various "freebies", for instance a game.

There seems to be various suppliers for this game, now credited under the publisher heading. Strictly speaking, the publisher of these game versions are actually SAS AB.

name: Abracadaver!
description:
A PDF print-and-play game set in the world of Abracadabra.
In this new daVinci game you play the role of a wizard trying to collect the elements to cast the ultimate magic: Abracadaver!

The game materials are:
- a board
- 4 player boards
- 20 cards
- 4 wizards
- 16 elemental tokens
- 4 wizard hats
- rules (in Italian)

you can download the game from www.arima.it

name: Helix
description:
Be the first one to win this race. Place a bet.
Graphics: Friedhelm Krahwinkel
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Treibjagd
description: The goal of the game is to hunt 3 of the opponent pawns off the board. Roll the dice move your pawns.

name: Johnny Unitas' Football
description: A two player game driven entirely by card draws and die rolls, with the offensive player responsible for both drawing cards and rolling the dice. No charts are used; the ball advances either on an odd die roll or the play result comes from the card deck on an even roll. The first player to score 25 or more points (as per NFL scoring rules) wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Damon Hill Motorsport Board Game
description: Players race around the monopoly style track around the edge of the board collecting sponsorship money and car bits. This also qualifies them on the grid. When all players have their cars on the grid players race around the track in the center of the board. Race stewards and hazards may send you to the pits. Team managers mark of the laps on a score card provided. Simple game with nice cartoon style artwork.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Panther
description:
This is Japanese tactical tank combat wargame in the Eastern Front published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

Using the same system as Tiger I this game has several scenarios all of tank warfare in the Eastern front from 1941-1945 German vs. Soviet.

name: Tank Battles
description:
This is a tactical Japanese tank wargame set during the eastern front battles of World War 2 during 1944-1945. Unlike Pacific Fleet, Hobby Japan has not included a supplemental English text for rules. Too bad.

Several scenarios.

name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Gundam history
description:
This is a Japanese wargame published by Tsukuda Hobbies on the wars in the Gundam universe starting from the original Gundam to ZZ Gundam. Includes various scenarios with an emphasis on one player per mobile suit.

The system is the final evolution of the six-action/pilot-point mechanics, debuting in Close Fight and especially Last Fight, through several other Tsukuda releases on Z and ZZ Gundam in the mid-80s, using detailed data charts with precise hit locations and weapon properties.

This is based off the Mobile Suit Gundam anime series and is part of the Mobile Suit Gundam family of games.

name: Simon Says
description:
Simulates the two major battles of the 13th century revolt of Simon de Montfort against the rule of Henry III.

Outnumbered two to one, and with his left wing of Londoners routed by an opening royalist cavalry charge, Simon still managed to smash Henry's tired army and capture the king and Prince Edward at the Battle of Lewes on 14 May 1264. However a year later, dissension among the revolting barons and Prince Edward's great escape led to the death of Simon and the revolt at the Battle of Eveshame on 4 August 1265.

Two 22x17 inch maps, 200 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

name: Fūrinkazan
description:
Fūrinkazan (Japanese: 風林火山, "Wind, Forest, Fire, Mountain") a Japanese wargame on the climatic 4th Kawanakajima battle, between Shingen Takeda and Kenshin Uesugi.
It was well accepted by reviewers.
Basically, it was a variety of "Napoleon at Waterloo" with supply consumption and hidden movement.


Note: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F%C5%ABrinkazan

name: McDonaldland Match-Up Game
description: This game, based on McDonalds restaurant characters, is actually 3 games-in-one. In the first game, 5 cards depicting shadows of the characters are placed in the center of the table. The regular cards are then dealt out evenly among the players. On your turn, you turn over your top card so that all players may see it. The first player to slap the matching shadow card wins the character card. The winner is the first player to collect one each of all 5 McDonaldland characters. In the second game, players try to match cards in their hands to the top card on the center stack by using colors or numbers (shadow cards are wild). The third game is played solitaire. You draw a card and try to match it to the face up card on the table. If you can, you play it on top; if you can't, you start a new pile. If the top card of a pile matches another pile card, the 2 piles may be merged. You win if you have 2 piles or less after you've gone through the deck.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tolle Tomaten
description:
Every player owns 12 counters. Place these counters on the board. The player with the largest area gets the most points.
No. 49 Spielbox edition.

name: Rodeo Rama
description:
Ever dream of saddling up and being a Pro Rodeo Cowboy?

Now you can bring the rodeo home with the Rodeo Rama board game. Players have their choice of competing in one of six exciting rodeo events.

• Saddle Bronc Riding
• Bull Riding
• Bareback Riding
• Barrel Racing
• Steer Wrestling
• Calf Roping

Feel the adrenaline rushing excitement as you try to ride your way to victory at one of four rodeo locations on the game board. Draw event cards at each rodeo to determine your fate. Will you make the eight second ride or get bucked off as soon as you leave the gate? Better hope for a good draw!

But remember, as a Rodeo Rama cowboy, your winnings and a meager monthly salary are your only sources of income. You must make the best of each rodeo because to win the game you must have earned at least $30,000 and purchased a truck, horse, trailer, and saddle!

Do you have what it takes to compete and survive in one of the toughest sports in the world? Play Rodeo Rama and find out!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rick's Reef
description:
From Publisher-
You and your crew have been invited to participate in a three day competition to photograph as many Caribbean fish and wildlife as possible. But you are not the only team! Rick has also invited some of the best divers to compete against you so you will need to efficiently use all of your resources including your crew if divers and their equipment to confuse and delay the other competitors.

Rick’s Reef, a collectible card game designed by divers for divers. There are 12 different types of divers, 7 kinds of equipment available to them and over 65 different types of fish and coral you can discover. And just to make it interesting there are 9 types of “problems” you can create for your opponent to throw his divers off balance.

name: Zahlenzwerge
description: A learning game about the first numbers. Whoever lands on a treasure space by using luck, imagination and the right numbers receives a prize. Who will have the most prizes at the end of the game?

name: Operation MI
description:
This is a Japanese wargame on the battle of Midway.

Published by Tsukuda Hobbies.

name: Social Circles
description:
A get-to-know you game, a catalyst, an outstanding mixer and a great ice breaker for your next event. Great for family gatherings, neighborhood get-togethers, bible study, and Sunday school social events.

Over 1000 witty questions prompt players to talk about interests, occupations, hobbies, education, and more... in an enjoyable, light heartened setting. Guess how players will answer questions such as:

How many know someone that is always late for church?
How many love to ride roller coasters?
How many have read the entire Bible?
How many have earned an athletic letter in high school?

You win by collecting the most social circle rings while learning fun things about each other.

Includes game board, 224 question cards, eight colored pawns, 75 social circles, and original instructions

name: Ben-Hur Chariot Race Game
description: Racing game where the players bet on which chariot will be the first to make 4 laps on the Ben-Hur-the-movie-like-race-track.

name: The Spanish Civil War
description:
A small wargame that covers the Spanish Civil War, 1936-1939. It comes with an 8 page rulebook, map and counters. It includes 7 different scenarios to reflect different combination of foreign intervention.

Revised as

Viva España: A Game of the Spanish Civil War – 1936-1939

name: Sun Tzu
description: Sun Zi, Japanese multi players game of Chinese Chunjiu Zhanguo era. Published by Epoch.

name: Iga versus Koga
description:
This is a tactical ninja wargame based on the struggles between Iga and Koga clans in Japan.

Published by Bandai.

This game is an area type game.
However, "Storm Over Arnhem" is different systems.


Setup
Decide Ninja's ability
Ninja's ability (eight abilities) is decided(Movement,Detection,Magic ability,Combat Rating,Quickness,Physical strength,recovery power,Ninjyutu).
It gives a name at the end.

Appearance unit
Ninja and Samirai;Casket;
The ninja turns inside out at the time of initial arrangement and arranges it.
The back is disguised as the samurai.





System
Sequence of Play



1.First Player:First movement Phase
2.First Player:Combat Phase
3.First Player:Second movement Phase
4.Second Player:First movement Phase
5.Second Player:Combat Phase
6.Recovery Pahse:Both Player

Basis of movement
It is not possible to move diagonally though a length movement or a horizontal movement can be done because it is an area type movement.
The movement can be moved the below the floor level and back of the ceiling.

name: Stockbroker
description:
Rare board game set around buying and selling stocks and shares determined by advantage and dis-advantage squares on the playing board, the game is for 3 to 7 players.

Each player takes the part of a broker and is dealt stock cards and money to start the game. Play moves around the board on the throw of the dice.

Do you sell shares or buy shares? You could go for oil, gold, rubber etc.. Wheel and deal is the order of the day.

If a broker is unable to pay a debt in full, he is said to be hammered - Therefore out of the game. The objective is to be the last remaining broker left standing when all the others have been hammered.

The Brokers in the game Are called:
Knight and Day
Spenlow and Jorkins
Dunn and Haddit
Dimple and Curve
Catchem and Bending
Hookem and Havem
Dodgson and Fogg

name: Tipi
description: Place Native Americans around their Tipi. Earn points by placing them on the good spots.

name: Napoleonique
description:
This is a set of rules for Minatures in the Napoleonic era. Originally published in 1971 as Napoleonique, it was revised and reissued in 1992 as Napoleonique Encore.

Here is the description from the back of the Encore edition:
"Napoleonique /Encore covers the wars of the French Revolution through the many campaigns of Napoleon and to the final battle of Waterloo in 1815. You select the battalion or regimental game from scales set up to accommodate your current mounting scheme. The focus on simplicity will have you finishing a turn in twenty minutes with armies of a thousand or more.
The original rules called Napoleonique, set battalion level games at a scale of thirty men per casting, a ten minute time scale and twenty yards per inch. Napoleonique/Encore offers 5 game scales with casting representing 30 men in some scales up to 90 men in the regimental version. These rule shave a history of being the beginners friend and the veteran's "first car" in wargamming.
Napoleonique/Encore is a product of the team of Jim Getz and Glenn Davis. Over 20,000 copies of the original Napoleonique were sold since its release in the early 70's. Some of you may buy Napoleonique/Encore for nostalgic reasons while others will find the simplicity to be a pleasant change. Either way we know you'll enjoy these rules."

name: Catholic Family Bible Game
description:
The first player to move along the pathway through biblical scenes from Creation to Christ wins the game. The object of the game is to bring families together to share and learn their biblical faith in a friendly atmosphere of fun and competitive play.

Players chose in advance which color group or groups of Question and Answer cards they want to play. Players also decide which level of difficulty each one will play. A player remains at that level of difficulty (Elementary, Intermediate or Advanced) throughout the game.

name: Wer sagt's denn?
description: Players roll dice to determine two letters. The player who first finds a word with one of the letters as first letter and the other letter as last letter gets points.

name: The Game of Big Rig 18 Wheeler
description:
This is a relatively sophisticated roll-and-move trucking game. Players each choose one of 12 major cities as their home terminal and draw a dispatch card with two possible destinations. They choose one, get paid and pay expenses, then set off. When they reach their chosen destination, they draw a new dispatch card from that terminal. If their destination is not a terminal, then they first must deadhead to the nearest terminal before drawing a card. There are 11 dispatch cards for each of the terminal cities.

As the game progresses, players can buy more trucks, up to four of them, at $60,000 each. They can borrow up to $50,000 but must make minimum payments on every die roll until it is paid back with interest. The winner is the player to that makes the most money (including truck values) by the end of 3 hours or whatever other time limit may be agreed at the outset.

The roads contain a variety of hazards, from minor annoyances like D.o.T. inspections and flat tires ($100) to a blown engine ($6,500) or a wreck and hospital stay ($8,000). Dispatch cards may be for regular loads (which use a 1 ,2 ,4, 8, 9, 10 green die), or wide loads that move on a slower 1, 3, 4, 5, 5, 7 red die. Players may buy insurance against cargo damage (or not) and occasionally get asked to take an illegal Hot Load, which pays well if delivered on time but nothing if late or stopped at a scale or inspection point.

Players passing through Atlantic City, Reno or Las Vegas have the option of gambling, drawing from a deck of Chance cards.

name: Predict-a-Ball
description:
"The exciting new board game you play while watching or listening to a live baseball game on TV or radio. Just watch or listen and predict what will happen after each pitch and batter. Will the next pitch be hit foul? Will this batter strike out or hit a home run? Did you make the correct prediction? Then move the spaces awarded. Make the wrong call? You're out! Yell at the umpire more that the manager! Players are on the edge of their seats from pitch to pitch!
It's a whole new way to enjoy baseball!
First player around the board wins. A Winner is usually determined after three innings, but could be over after just one batter, depending on the predictions.
Predict-a-Ball scores big with baseball fans of all ages. Don't just watch the game. Get into the Game!" -from the back of the box

name: DX Demoniac Tarot
description:
A Japanese Children's magic game.

Published by Bandai.

name: Valley of Death
description:
This is a DTP wargame on the invasion of Laos by South Vietnamese forces in 1971 which ended in disaster.

An earlier version of the game is known as II Corps.

name: Chronicles of the Three Kingdoms
description:
[Not to be confused with the Wargames Club game Chronicle of the Three Kingdoms ]

This is a Japanese area movement wargame set during Romance of The Three kingdoms period of China. This wargame uses cards to supplement its area movement system.

Very rare even in Japan.

This game is re-development of Seikiheikuu.

name: The Royles "My Arse" Game
description:
"My Arse" is a Cheatwell Games trivia game based on Granada Television Ltd's "Royle Family" situation comedy show.

Its a variation of the card based trivia theme in which players pit their wits against Jim, the Royle Family's fountain of all knowledge and have to decide if "facts" on the trivia cards are "Sound" (true) or "My Arse" (false.)

Here's how the marketing material describes it:

A classic game of truth or bluff, you have to choose the facts from the guff...decide whether Jim really knows his onions or is simply full of hot air.

Do you agree with Jim and head for a pint at the Feathers or grumble your way to the kitchen to brew another cuppa?

Of one thing you can be certain...you're in for a right Royle battle in this off-beat trivia board game.

name: Only Fools and Horses
description:
"Only Fools and Horses" is a Monopoly style game based on the BBC TV comedy series of the same name.

You move around a monopoly style board encountering spaces or drawing "goods","chance", of "location" cards depending on where you land and gaining (or losing) money as you go.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: La Forteresse
description:
From the box:
- Gain Territory
- Organise your troups for attack
- Assault the fortress of your opponent.

Contents:
- Game board
- 12 yellow pieces
- 12 red pieces

name: Monster Squash
description: Tactical combat between clay monsters you create.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Player Elimination, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Star Hooks
description: Players score points by adding stars to their solar systems and hooking stars with star hooks.

name: The Full Monty
description:
"The Full Monty" is a boardgame based on the award winning film of the same name.

The winner of the game is the first player to get a job - but you may have to go the full monty before you finish the game!

First, ensure all the players have the same number of clothing items. Gather together a selection of clothing, the more bizarre, the better and place them in a pile on the floor, this pile will be known as the kitty. Before you begin the game, decide your group's criteria for The Full Monty. Is it as it should be, totally naked, in the buff, or will you chicken out and go down to underwear only? The choice is yours!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Strategy Rummy
description:
Strategy Rummy is described as "a bet and bluff game." This game was published as a follow-up to another MB game: Strategy Poker.

Strategy Rummy is played using a vinyl table cloth, mini poker chips, and a special deck of cards (which includes six wild cards). Each player is dealt seven cards and everyone antes one chip into the pot. The sequence of play is as follows:

A. Draw a card
B. Discard a card
C. Place a meld or lay off cards onto the vinyl table cloth
D. Ask for bets from opponents.

Players go out by playing all seven cards from the hand onto the vinyl cloth. The player with the most chips wins the game.

name: Futbowel
description:
From the publisher:

Written by Matthew Hartley and Steve Blease, Futbowel is the game of fantasy football ie. based on the proper game, not some variant with body armour, a big egg and using your hands!

Futbowel is a light hearted, fun and simple game to recreate the games between 22 orcs and a pigs bladder that occur on muddy fileds across The Land. The rulebook includes a brief history of Futbowel, details of thirteen famous Futtie teams from the Bladez to the Wightz, famous Futtie sayings as well as rules for the tabletop recreation of the noble game of Futbowel.

Futbowel is a complete game comprising of rulebook, twenty-two orc 28mm futbowlers, one orc referee (with fowl) and a scale model pigs bladder for them to kick around.

name: Gangland
description:
From the publisher:

Written by Matthew Hartley and Steve Blease, Gangland is a set of wargames rules from Wessex Games, allowing you to recreate the gang battles that raged in the inner cities of the western world throughout the nineteenth century, as well as the fights against the forces of the establishment that occurred in cities like London, Paris and New York.

As well as providing a comprehensive set of rules to recreate the battles of the period, Gangland also contains five introductory scenarios, illustrating the depth of the background in which these rules are set:

New York 1834 - join the Bowery Boys as they attempt to smash their way past the Dead Rabbits .

Chicago 1897 - meet the Irishers and Bohemians, two gangs of school kids who fought a lethal twenty-five year long gang war.

New York 1857 - the most bizarre gang war of all with two New York police forces fighting each other and attempting to free each others prisoners.

San Francisco 1875 - defend the honor of the Suey Sing Tong against the insults of the Kwong Dock Tong.

London 1887 - strike a blow for social freedom against the repression of the British government by marching on Trafalgar Square.

name: Ranke & Vyle
description:
From the publisher:

Valon is at war... the Usurper Emperor Morded leads his musket weidling columns of Elven infantry and squadrons of noble cavalry against the rest of Valon. Orc fights alongside Dwarf in a desperate bid to hold back the Elven armies, the battlefields are shrouded in smoke as flintloques and artillerie smash the ranks and files of disciplined warriors. It is a time of war - it is a time of desperation.

Ranke & Vyle is a set of Company level Black Powder Fantasy Rules set in the world of Flintloque - the Skirmish. Written by Flintloque's author Steve Blease, Ranke & Vyle takes you the next step up the rung of command, tasking you with maintaining your troops in cohesive units and recognisable formations, balancing situations and getting maximum usage out of your troops.

Ranke & Vyle contains full rules for Company level actions including mass uni firing, formations and unit movement as well as introducing Wyld Magick users onto the battlefield with all the unpredictability that comes with them. Racial statistics are also included for thirteen races ranging from Orcs to Halflings, and one hundred and twenty-seven different troop types. Ranke & Vyle also includes six challenging scenarios set in the Mordredian Wars to start you off with.

This edition of Ranke & Vyle is a limited edition product and only 300 numbered and signed copies will be made available worldwide.

name: Movie Mystery: Never Die Forever Again
description:
Components:

Screenplay Award Statue, 10 sided 'Decider', Directors Audio CD, 10 Cue Cards, 10 Contracts / Invitations, 1 Hosts' Party Planner, 10 Character Profile Cards, 10 Identity Badges, 10 Screenplay Nominations Cards, 10 Envelopes, 10 Pencils, Instructions

Publisher's Description:

"The mad, evil Doctor Bloefaert is up to his tricks again, trying to take over the world -this time by controlling the weather. As an experienced CI5 agent with special skills, you have been commanded to join a crack team who will infiltrate the evil organization, de-activate the "weathertron" and blow up the private volcanic island base in the pacific. But things don’t run so smoothly and the excitement and danger builds up to a climax as you interact with your comrades in arms in frightening situations. You are exposed to temptations in exotic locations -this may be your last mission, you may..
.......NEVER DIE FOREVER AGAIN

The players are the Agents.They will act out SEVEN SCENES, working from instructions given by the DIRECTOR (on the audio CD). They arrive on set "in character", each with their own secret identity (sealed instructions sent out by the host(s) with the invitations). The evening culminates in THE SCREEN PLAY AWARD CEREMONY a magnificent affair where players are judged in three categories; On their abilities to ACT, to IDENTIFY CHARACTER TRAITS IN OTHERS and to DISCOVER THE SECRET.

The winner will keep the prestigious SCREEN PLAY AWARD STATUE."

Brief Notes:

This is one of a series of "Movie Mystery" games, that can be a great party game among people who like mysteries and a little play-acting. Role-playing gamers can easily enjoy this as well.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: The Maple Leaf Forever
description:
From the Rules Introduction:

The Maple Leaf Forever is an expansion set to Brain Train's War Plan: Crimson. The Maple Leaf Forever tries to integrate the Canadian plans to counter the American invasion of Canada as outlined in Sutherland "Buster" Brown's (I'm not making this up) Defense Scheme No. 1. All the rules of War Plan Crimson are used except where noted below. Gamers will note that The Maple Leaf Forever does not interfere with War Plan Crimson, but rather adds a section to the beginning of the game (usually four or five extra turns) which represents the days before the American invasion. It was this period that "Buster" Brown calculated would be critical, if Canada was to resist an American invasion.

Expands:

War Plan: Crimson

name: Best Sellers
description:
The 52 cards each feature a picture of a book cover on one side and a letter on the reverse side. The book covers have titles and illustrations the relate to specific themes. Each letter of the alphabet appears twice within the deck and five of those letters (J,Q,X,Y,Z) are yellow, indicating a higher value for those letters.

Each game of Best Sellers consists of ten rounds. During each round, one player is designated as EDITOR. The editor shuffles the deck and presents them to the player on his left. The player draws three cards, flipping over two of them to reveal the letters on the backs. The book title on the third card is the theme to be used for the round.

Once the book title and the two letters have been chosen, the editor starts the two minute timer and all players, including the editor, begin writing a story inspired by the title/theme of the book cover. Players earn points by including as many words as possible which begin with either of the two letters chosen for the round. Each word that begins with one of these letters is worth one point.

- Words only count the first time they are used.
- Words must be in complete sentences to count.
- Words beginning with yellow letters are worth 2 points.

When the two minutes are up, each player stops writing. Beginning with the player immediately to the editor's left, each participant reads his/her story and announces the number of points earned. The editor adds the totals to the score sheet for the round and awards the book card to the player with the most points. At the end of ten rounds, players total their scores from each round, add 3 points for every book card held to reach a grand total. The player with the most points at the end of ten rounds is the winner of the game.

name: My First Brain Quest Preschool Animal Matching
description: Memory game with sturdy animal tiles. Little kids (1-2) like just looking at and playing with the tiles. Bigger kids (2-4) learn the matching concept, and bigger still (4-5) can play it as Memory. Comes in cubic box with nice production values.

name: Airborne!
description:
Player 1: Colonel, we got trouble. The nation of Hyrax has been invaded and overrun by forces from the neighboring nation of Koni. The United Nations has condemned the invasion and authorized the use of force, and your 82nd-Airborne ready battalion will be that force. You must make an immediate drop before the invaders can dig in, and reinforce yourself as needed later. Your goals are to free the capital of Hyrax and at least one other city from the invaders, and to capture at least one airfield so other UN forces can land there and finish what you've started. Those forces will start arriving in three days, which is also the amount of time your men can fight without resupply. Take 'em down! Airborne all the way!

Player 2: A dog's curse be on the United Nations and their resolutions! This territory belonged to our ancestors before the colonial imperialists divided it up, and it is ours again, and we will never leave it. The initial attacks were successful beyond our wildest dreams, and the whole country fell like dominoes. Now we must prepare for the counterattack that the UN and their lackeys will certainly launch. Most of our navy is at sea, searching for enemy ships that might bring invaders, and all the land approaches to our nation are well-guarded. But an attack could come from anywhere at any time, so you must be vigilant. Long live Koni!

Airborne! is a 2-player Expansion for Gators! depicting a modern US airborne operation. It uses the same basic rules as Gators!, and the same opposing force.

Expands:

Gators!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Presidential Fever
description:
"Presidential Fever" allows players to face off against each other in a two Party contest. Two to four players may compete, though the three player game essentially calls for one player on one side to fill both the Presidential and Vice-Presidential roles. Players move around the board, capturing states with campaign funds. Players must also watch to maintain their credibility rating and to build either a liberal or conservative rating when appropriate. A lack of credibility keeps your party from winning a state; high credibility allows your party to overcome a liberal or conservative bias; liberal or conservative leanings provide financial rewards in many states.

Unlike most games based on the Electoral College system, Presidential Fever combines a number of contiguous low value states into a single region (e.g., Farm Belt, Border States, Mid-Atlantic, Deep South, etc.).
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gundam Zeta A.E.U.G.
description: This is a Japanese wargame on ground combat in the anime world of Gundam Zeta, this game focuses on the battles of the AEUG faction (the good guys).

name: Tokugawa Ieyasu
description: This is a Japanese wargame on the famous battles of Tokugawa Ieyasu, the Shogun who founded the Tokugawa shogunate when he won the battle of Sekigahara.

name: BrickMech
description:
(From the BrickMech site:)

BrickMech is a d6-based game where Mechs built of LEGO® bricks vie for ultimate control of the battlefield. Constructed in a unique modular system, Mechs can scavenge parts blown off other Mechs to improve their stats. The game is designed to be a rich gaming experience that's simple to play.

name: Lucky Town
description: 1946 game from Milton Bradley. A simple roll and move game. Also known as the Build a Happy Home Game.

name: The Nags Head Board Game (Only Fools and Horses)
description:
Mange Tout Rodney, get down the apple & pears, get your cocktail umbrella & jellied eels ready 'cos you won't believe your mince pies when you see what's going down in the Nag's Head pub.

Yes, it's time for a knees up in the Nag's head. Meet the gang at the bar, choose a character & be the first to collect all the drinks. On the way, avoid being barred & take a chance on the quiz night or, if you're feeling lucky, try one of Del's Dares.....he who dares...wins!

Your amazing Nag's Head Game Collector's Tin contains:
x1 playing board, x1 dice, x1 bag, x6 character playing tokens, x6 character game cards, x20 happy hour cards, x36 drink tokens, x20 Del's dares cards

name: Cammy
description:
Cammy is a Yahtzee variant that tries to evoke a "Southern feel" by stating in the rules that it was played on southern plantations and later by New Orleans gamblers. It also has a steamboat scene on the cover. It is different from Yahtzee mainly by the fact that 10 dice are used, and the low score wins.
Players roll 10 dice on the first roll. On the second roll they choose which of the dice to re-roll. Same on the third roll. After 3 rolls the 10 dice are divvied up into two groups of 5 dice. Each player has a sheet of paper with 10 categories. Players choose a category to score with each of the 2 groups. Each category must be finished after the player's fifth turn.

name: Mission Impossible
description: Dating from the original 1970's Mission Impossible TV series, the aim of this board game is to try and discover the identity of your 'target', and blow his cover, and eliminate him - before one of your opponents does the same to you. The sole surviving agent at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der ehrliche Charly
description:
Three to Five players compete in making the most money bartering about used cars.
Everyone sells and buys some and you *try* to make the most out of it. This is not easy since every player has several cards depicting upgrades (few) and defects (PLENTY) that are played face down on the cars that are currently traded.
The "lucky" winner of a bid collects the depicted worth of the new car from the bank plus any present upgrades, pays the agreed price to the car dealer and then he needs to pay for all the defect cards played upon this card. More often then not he has less money then before the deal. So now he's eager to sell one of his cars to someone else, the only way of getting "save" money.

name: 5 Score
description: In 5 Score, players try to create combinations of numbers and colors from cards. There may be multiple ways of scoring; the players must try to set up their own scoring opportunities while depriving their opponents.

name: Rangers!
description:
Player 1: We've got a situation here, Colonel. Our embassy personnel in the Hyraxian capital city have been kidnapped by a rebel faction and are being held hostage. The local government can't do anything about it; the rebel influence on their ruling council is strong enough to veto any action. So you and your Rangers are going to take some action. You've got four C-130's and your ready-response battalion, and we can get you some flying air support if you think you need it. Load 'em up, move fast, rescue the hostages, and bring 'em home. If you can't fly them out, we'll set up a rendezvous in-country to get you out by choppers. Rangers, lead the way!

Player 2: Success! The American ambassador and his assistants will make excellent bargaining chips in our struggle. And the existing government can do nothing; our political operatives have seen to that. You, Major, must see to the safety of our "guests." You can expect a rescue operation from the Americans -- they have a long history of meddling in our nation's affairs. Colonel LeMeow of our Intelligence section will take command of the prisoners tomorrow. Until then, guard them well.

Rangers! is a 2-player Expansion for the free wargame Gators! depicting a modern US Army Ranger airborne operation.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Dogfaces in Space
description: Dogfaces in Space is an individual-soldier-level space combat game for 2 players. Choose the size of your battle, then fight it out. This game can be seen as an extension of my space/land battle game, Orbital Battle.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Words! Words!
description:
Words! Words! is a challenging and exciting word game for family and friends. The erasable game board makes for quick clean up and unlimited hours of repeat play.

Players select a card from the pile which provides one of a variety of categories; people, geography, sports, music, places, and things. Points are scored by printing words which identify with the category on the card selected. The player with the highest score wins the game!

Words! Words! It's challenging, yet easy to learn. It's fun and educational too!

name: Stratastar
description:
From the publisher:

Space Empire building, Interstellar conquest.
Build, maneuver, trade, and fight your way to Galactic supremacy.
Minimal units and card mechanics make for quick turns.

Rules are available free for download at http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/SStar.html

Components must be printed & cut out prior to play.
categories: Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: London Rules Wargames Section American Civil War 1863c
description: Based upon an article submission within the pages of "Miniature Warfare" Magazine Vol. 1 #-7, and part of a series for miniatures wargaming. This booklet has a yellow front & back plasticized-looking outside covers, with black print on the front and plastic spiral binding for the pages. It contains 20 pages of rules in a half-page-sized format, and covers the basics of minis gaming within this. It details the use of "bounds" written orders and simultaneously revealing them, for its mechanism of play. You will need to provide special 6-sided-dice numbered as follows: 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5 ("average" dice), as well as some regular D6s, various other sundry items associated with this genre as required, and some markers of the same size as the units that they will represent in the game. These markers can even be used for decoy units where applicable, and you would have to obtain additional data on specifics for individual battles, troops, & leaders prior to commencing play for this. Calculations for creating casualties are based upon a percentages and die rolls method being employed for resolving conflicts. These seem to be the easiest and quickest rules devised at the time, for recreating the many epic confrontations that were to define the "American War for Reunification" in the period covered by this rules set.
categories: American Civil War, Dice, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pharaoh's Phonics
description:
From the Publisher:

Spin your way to building better phonics skills with our Pharaoh’s Phonics game. Multiple skill levels teach long and short vowels, explore beginning blends and practice consonant sounds. Players challenge each other to build 3, 4, 5 and 6-letter words. The student with the first completed pyramid wins.

name: Vierzig Vagabunden
description:
Each player draws a card to determine their playing colour, which remains secret during the game. The players try to distribute 40 pawns in four colours in such a way that each field on the board (8x5) will be occupied only by one single pawn. The eight rows will be scored at the end of the game. Players reveal the colour and receive victory points for having the most pawns in their colour per row. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

Edition Spielbox No. 57
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scooby-Doo! Where Are You?
description:
From the Publisher:

If you can count to ten you can count on Scooby-Doo to show up when least expected! Play your cards to add, subtract, multiply and divide. Be the first to use all of your cards, you win!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number

name: Fattoria
description:
From the Kidult website:

Gasp! What’s up? A group of pretty animals have lost their colours, will you help them come back out? And why don’t you invite your friends and play all together to see who is the fast colourer of the world?

Each kid chooses an animal to colour up and lays it on the table in front of himself. At his turn each kid throws a dice and colours up that part of the animal which is marked by the number on the dice. If that number corresponds to a coloured portion he waits for his next turn and it’s up to the child next. The winner is the one who colours up all of his animal first.

name: FotoCaccia
description:
From the Kidult website:

Fotocaccia is a visual memory game. In a few seconds you have to memorize the opponents’ pets and here starts the Fotocaccia. Enrich your treasure as much as you can.
The winner is the one who manages to click more animals (that is to catch them with photo clicks). An easy and quick game for Kidults and kids. But be careful, children are terrific at this game!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Operation Husky
description:
"It's June 11, 1943 and the Allies are ashore on Sicily...the race to Messina has begun. As the Allied player, you have 12 division of Americans, Canadians and British. In all, 467,000 troops commanded by two of the Allies's best....Your objectives are to sweep the Axis off the island."

The game was published in Combat! #9.

name: 信長風雲録 (Nobunaga Fuun-roku)
description:
Nobunaga Fuun-roku (Records of Nobunaga) is an operational wargame on the battles of Nobunaga.
It covers battles in the Yamato region.

The Game Journal edition includes the short scenarios "Nobunaga in the Capital", "Tensho Blitzkrieg", "Battle of Shiga" and "Battle of Anegawa", each 4 or 5 turns long. The campaign scenario "Genkame Disturbance" lasts 14 turns.

Game Journal version

Number of counters: 252 pieces
Map: 1
Game Period: September, 11th year of Eiroku era (1568) / June to December, 1st year of Genki era (1570)


Game Designer:

Makoto Fukuda (Tsukuda version)
Tomoki Kondoh (Game Journal version)


Original System Designer: Hideaki Uehara


Note: 信長 is Nobunaga.
風雲録 (Fūun-roku) means "brave records". See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brave_Records_of_the_Sanada_Cl....

name: Mobile Suit Gundam ZZ: Dakar
description: This is a Japanese wargame set on the anime world of Gundam ZZ.

name: Eddie Cantor's Game: Tell It to the Judge
description: This game features a caricature of entertainer Eddie Cantor on the box and a photo of him on the board, though the singer/comic's persona has little do with the game. Players move their pawns (representing automobiles) around the board by playing cards that represent traffic signals. A twist to the game involves the "To See the Judge" spaces on the board. Land on one and and you must draw a summons card, and then the player designated as the judge (he wears a badge that is included) gives the player a fine. The winner is the player who reaches "The Club" and has the most amount of money left once all players are finished.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Moon Race
description:
"A game for young astronauts of all ages"
"Computers Decide Progress"

The board (18" x 14" approx) is a cardboard sandwich containing a rotating wheel. Each player uses a pencil or matchstick (not supplied) to rotate the wheel, which changes the what is shown in the various pre-cut windows. This includes the distance the player's rocket must move, and good or bad events resulting from landing on certain spaces. There is no interaction: it is purely a race.

name: 5mm Wargame Rules: For Land Battles, Seiges and Naval Engagements
description:
The 78 page rulebook covers ancient warfare on land and sea, as well as sieges, and focuses on the 5mm (1:300) scale. The rulebook is divided into four sections, namely (1) the rules for land warfare; (2) army compositions and lists; (3) Naval rules and (4) Sieges.

The focus of the rules are on the period from 300 BC to 600 AD, with an opinion by the designers that one can play with armies up to widespread use of gunpowder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation
publishers: Heroics & Ros Figures, NavWar Production, Ltd.

name: Never Mind the Buzzcocks
description:
"Never Mind the Buzzcocks" is a board game based on the pop music/comedy/trivia themed BBC T.V. game show of the same name.

It's a team game for two or more teams.

You get your chance to sing songs like "twinkle, twinkle little star" in the style of pop celebrities like Mick Jagger, play the "intro round", songs in one sentence, and many other of the classic games from the series.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: BBC Enterprises, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Where in the Wild?
description:
WHERE IN THE WILD? combines fun, quick observation and learning. The game introduces players to over 400 different animals and plants, details of which are provided within the accompanying booklet.

Components:
4 game boards - each comprising a picture with about 100 animals on it. Each board is divided into a 3x3 grid.
36 Riddle questions each containing two questions, one easy and one slightly more difficult (i.e.- I slide along and I slide along with a shell on my back).

A riddle card is turned over and one of the questions read out. All the players then look at their gameboard to try an find an animal or plant that fits the description in the riddle. The first player to find an answer can either say the name of the animal/plant or point to it on his/her gameboard.

If the answer is correct the successful player takes the riddle card and uses it to cover then square on his or her gameboard where the answer was found. Another riddle is then read out, and so on...

The first player to completely cover their gameboard is the winner.

name: Honey Bee
description: A simple dice rolling version of the old hive game. A color dice roll determines which adjacent colored flower space one of your four counters can jump to on the way to collect "pollen" counters. The first player to get all pollen-laden bees home is the winner
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Diabolical Doomsday Designers
description:
From the KenMGames website:

Owe money on your taxes?
Long lines in the supermarket?
No good movies left at the video store?
Someone in your parking space again?
Do the neighbors still Point and Stare?

Don't just complain -- Do something about it! Why not TAKE OVER THE WORLD and have things your way for a change?

Download the game at: http://kenmgames.wordpress.com

name: Katt and Mowz: The Cartoon Catastrophes
description:
From the KenMGames website:

Katt and Mowz have been in the cartoon business for more years than you can shake a stick at (and they know ... they've shaken a lot of sticks!) They remain the Best of Friends and the Worst of Rivals! Nothing is too Good or too Bad to come between them ... except maybe a chance at FINALLY becoming famous! (Not to mention Clubs, Anvils, and a Steam Roller or two!)

Download the game at: http://kenmgames.wordpress.com
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Print & Play

name: Dish Pan Hands
description:
From the KenMGames website:

Wars are won or lost at the negotiating table ... so they say. The dirtiest war in any home? Who has to do the dishes tonight ... (Not me, I did them last time) It's a frantically fast paced, and cut-throat battle to say or do ANYTHING, if only it keeps you from having to scrub those pots and pans! (We just HAD to have lasagna again ...)

Download the game at: http://kenmgames.wordpress.com

name: Vamanos
description:
From the New World Games website:

A speedy game for 2 or more players.

There's not really any strategy involved in this quick game. I was just trying to make up something fun and simple that required fast thinking.

Players will race to make scoring sets of five cards by combining pictures and colors in different ways.

Each player takes a deck and shuffles it thoroughly. Decks are then passed to the left, so that each player uses a different deck than he shuffled. One player calls Vamanos and the game begins.

Players draw one card at a time and place each in one of three rows on the table in front of themselves. There are no turns and each player only plays in his own three rows as fast as he can.

When a player has five cards in one of his rows, he quickly gathers them in a small stack and pushes them to the side for later scoring. New cards may placed in the now empty row.

When a player finishes, the game stops. Rows that don’t score and unused cards will penalize players. The first player to 500 points wins.

Download here:
http://www.geocities.com/mapetty/vamanos.html

name: Nuklear
description:
In this two player game one player is 'pro' nuclear energy, the other player is an environmentalist.

At the start of the game, each player places 'neutral' nuclear power plants on a central zone of the board.

Each player has two pawns he puts on the edges of the board.
They each try to reach the 'neutral' power plants (by roll and move mechanism). The environmental player replaces the neutral power plants with trees, the 'pro-nuclear' player replaces it with a nuclear plant in his color.

Both players have the ability to put obstacles on the board in order to slow down the other player.

The game ends when all neutral plants have been replaced.
The winner is the player who made the most replacements (and thus has the most neutral tokens in his possession).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Silent Dark
description:
Silent Dark is a tabletop miniatures wargame, set in the relatively near future of the 26th Century. The game is designed for the 25mm figure scale, but because it has been designed with the revolutionary G.U.T.S. Core Rules©, it could easily be adapted to 6mm, 15mm, or the 35mm figure scales... or anything else for that matter.

Before we describe the game's features, and offer the traditional list, let us take a brief moment to describe the G.U.T.S. Core Rules©. G.U.T.S. stands for “Generic Universal Tactical System”. It is a revolutionary new game design, because it uses new models to create accuracy of simulation without adding dreary layers of useless rules. G.U.T.S. can be used for all sorts of miniatures-based games, such as WWI, the Civil War, and other conflicts, past and present. It has some other advantages, though, that are specific to Silent Dark:

Design your armies from the ground up. Every Creature, Vehicle and Weapon can be designed to your exact specifications, down to the last rifle in the last man’s hands. Freedom rules!

Availability:
Originally a commercial product, Wolfe Games has released Silent Dark as a free download in PDF format. The entire Silent Dark package is available from the publisher's website.
categories: Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Gå da helt Bananas
description: The banana tree has been invaded by monkeys. In the memory game the competitors are trying to fill their own tree with monkeys, which you steal from your opponents trees. The trick is to figure where your opponent has hidden their monkeys. At the same time you should take care not to choose a leaf with bananas, as that will make you loose your turn.

name: Albany in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Albany, New York. It has spaces such as Tulip Festival, Nipper, Great Escape Fun Park, Lark Street, Pepsi Arena, Empire State Plaza, and Cranberry Bog. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, trolley, sailboat, ski, and wooden shoe. Cards include local events and staples of life in Albany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Covered With Glory
description:
From the Designer:

Covered With Glory is designed to reflect the tactics of the Napoleonic period at the level where those tactics had the most impact - the company and battalion. The unique movement and morale systems make the obstacles faced by officers of the period all too evident as players try to coordinate the movements of the units within their brigade or division. This is a fast paced, easy to learn, easy to play games system in which exciting and challenging battles can be played with as few as three or four battalions on each side or as much as a division.

This is not a game of high strategy. It is a game of tactics at a level too long ignored or simply not understood. It is a game about the common soldier and how he was led, maneuvered and deployed as he covered himself with glory.

name: The Game of Space
description:
From the rules:

"A perfect formula: The Game of SPACE + family, friends, or classmates = fun and excitement! The toss of a die determines whether you'll be quizzed about Stars, Planets, Astronomy, Constellations, or Exploration. Four challenging levels permit players of like and different ages and abilities to join together in unraveling many puzzling mysteries of the universe. Be first to correctly answer one question in each of the five categories, and win!"

The rules also contain well-considered instructions for "Game Show" and "Spelling Bee" variants. Excellent questions, nicely sorted by ability, and lots of them. This would be a good classroom distraction.

name: Abet
description: A friendly but challenging word rummy game. When you add to another player's word, you both score points for it.

name: Pic Charades
description:
Pic Charades - From the box ....
The game of quick draw and fast turns that combines the fun of sketching and mime.
Throw the dice and test your talents. Sketch or act out a clue for your team. But you've got to be quick. There's less than a minute on the timer for them to guess the word or phrase on your card. If they fail, the other team gets a chance for bonus points. A lively and often hilarious game for young and old alike.

name: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
description:
All-Fair game by E. E. Fairchild Corp. (Rochester, N.Y.)

Game features 16x16" playing board w/colorful game route beginning in Kansas and ending in Emerald City.

Includes instruction booklet and 32 "Magic Cards" which feature The Wishing Hat, Wizard of Oz, Silver Slippers, The Bad Witch, etc.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spellcycles
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Create mysteeeerious patterns to cast mysteeeerious spells on two to five mysteeeerious players.

Object: To accumulate Prestige by casting complex spells.

You Need:

* Spell Components: 6 Icehouse sets: Red, yellow, green, blue, white, and black.
* A Knucklebone: A six-sided die.
* Prestige Certificates: A standard deck of playing cards.
* A Casting Field: A checker board.
* Moon Crescents: Chess pieces or checkers equal to the number of players.
* An Essence Pool: lots of pennies, stones, or other generic markers.
* A Spell Deck: lots of index cards and a pencil for each player

Players attempt to cast spells by using components and essence. In most cases, casting spells will gain the players Prestige Certificates. The player with the most Prestige Certificates at the end of the game wins.

name: Alpha Nature
description:
From the box: The object of the game is to move through the letters of the alphabet from A to Z. The winner is the first person to reach Z. You have two levels of challenge to choose from. Level one Ages 8 and up, level two Ages 12 and up.

Basically you move round the board from A to Z and answer questions about nature. You advance one space at a time, when you land on a square has a letter or letters on it you roll the 8 sided dice to decide which of the categories you have to name a nature item on. The six categories are Trees, Edible Plants, Space, Animals, Water, Flowers, Land or any category. You have to name something from the appropriate category beginning with the letter on the square you have landed on. You are not allowed to repeat something that has been used before. In between the letter spaces are alpha nature card spaces, when you land on these you have to answer a question of one of the cards to see if you can advance onto the next letter space. Whenever you answer correctly you move onto the next space, as soon as you are unable to answer a question or name something correctly your turn ends. The winner is the first person to reach the end of the alphabet and name something in the appropriate category.

This is an educational game and there are some variants depending on the players ability.

name: Country Music Triviologies
description: Aleken Games’ COUNTRY MUSIC TRIVIOLOGIES™is a party game for Country music fans ages 10 and up and can be played by two or more players or in teams. If you know the nickname of Willie Nelson’s famous guitar (Trigger), what Country star played Bo Duke on the hit T.V. show The Dukes of Hazzard (John Schneider) or if you have ‘no problem’ remembering the name of Kenny Chesney’s 2002 hit record (No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problem), you’ll have a blast with this game. The game comes complete with over 750 questions, including a mix of ‘softballs’ for the casual Country fan and more challenging Country Star questions for Country music fanatics.

name: Sudden Score
description:
According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games":
The pieces have "O" for offensive on one side and "X" for defensive on the other. On a turn a player may flip and then move. O pieces move further and can capture in a novel manner. X pieces are safe. Win by moving seven pieces into opponent's goal.

name: Starfleet Command
description:
Released at the 1973 Star Trek convention, only 100 copies were produced.

Included (26) round counters to be cut out; (12) orange Federation ships, and (16) blue Klingon/Romulan. A pink fire template is included, (8) sheets of various ship logs and a hex map of the area around the "Neutral Zone".

name: Cats, Dogs & Hogs
description: The quick witted word game for 2 or more players Ages 12 and up. From 3 key letters you invent a word for your friend to guess. Each letter picked earns a cat, a dog or a penalty porker as everyone frantically races to solve the mystery word. The more cats and fewer dogs and hogs you earn the better you will do.

name: Round Europe
description: By playing travel and destination cards, players start compete to be the first to “visit” four, five or seven, according to the number of players, European cities, starting from London. The deck comprises two cards for each of twenty-two destinations and twenty travel cards indicating various distances in miles. For example the “Vickers Viscount” card will take you the five hundred miles from Berlin to Stockholm by itself, whereas to travel from Berlin to Paris you will need the five hundred miles of the Vickers Viscount card plus the fifty miles of the “Vauxhall Cresta” card! Cards totaling the exact mileage between cities must be played, by reference to the maps provided on the rear of the rules sheets. The winner is the first player to play the target number of destination cards.

name: Stellar Speller
description:
From the box:
"Quick! Unscramble the letters and form a word. Play it alone or with a friend. This word challenge is so much fun that excellent spelling just might become a habit! Pocket-sized, it travels well, and helps to develop thinking skills like reasoning and memory. A good esteem-booster too!"

This game is similar to Boggle. It consists of seven dice with letters which are contained in a plastic holder. Players try to make as many words as possible. Words must be three or more letters long. More points are scored for longer words.

Stellar Speller is a word dice game.

Similar to:

Play on Wordz (which uses nine dice to this game's seven)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Word Game
publishers: Discovery Toys, Orda Industries Ltd., Small World Toys

name: Q.U.L.E.
description:
Q.U.L.E. is a game of exploration and development on a harsh planet for exactly four players.

There are three versions of Q.U.L.E.: Beginner's, Standard and Tournament. Each version has slightly different rules.

The player who has the most total value at the end of the last round game is the winner. He or she earns the title of “First Founder.”

Q.U.L.E. is based on the old computer game M.U.L.E., designed by Dan/Dani Bunten.
categories: Economic, Print & Play, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Comana
description: Two players/teams compete to make anagrams. A phrase is drawn and a minute timer set for the recommended length. Tiles are used to spell the phrase on each console. Players/teams then try to rearrange the letters into successful anagrams of the phrase. 2 points are scored for every "self explanatory" anagram, with 1 point for anything demanding explanation from the opposition. Depending on the difficulty, a number of cards are played until the final scores are tallied and one team is declared winner.

name: The Gillette Cup
description:
Cricket game, based on the cricket competition of the same name. Game contents include a board showing the cricket ground; miniatures - 9 fielders, 1 bowler, 1 wicket keeper and 2 batsmen; two packs of cards - batting team and bowling team; and scoring sheets

Innings are played, based on the combinations of bowler and batting cards played, and placement of the fielders on the board.

name: Reed's Game
description: The patent for this game was filed in 1982 by Charles F. Reed, and granted in 1984 (US patent number 4,470,602). Two players each have six cubes with the sides colored in three different colors (opposite sides matching). One color is "vulnerable," a second color is "blocking," and a third color is "aggressive." Each player's six cubes are alike, but some pattern distinguishes one player's cubes from the other. On a three by six horizontal rectangular grid, each player's cubes start with "vulnerable" on top all along the nearest side and "aggressive" on the left and right sides of each cube. In turn, each player rolls or tips one of his/her cubes up to two spaces, possibly including an orthogonal turn in the middle. If a piece started the turn as "aggressive" it can capture by landing upon an opposing "vulnerable" or "aggressive" piece as any part of this move. No piece may move through a "blocking" piece. Adjacent captures are mandatory. The first player to capture or immobilize all six opposing pieces wins. A necessary house rule to avoid fortress defense stalemates is to only allow vulnerable pieces to move two spaces.

name: Squaresville, The Strategy Game
description:
1968 Squaresville strategy game from Cadaco.

Components:

- 200 wood markers,
- 200 wood playing pieces called sticks (to form the edges of the boxes)
- 1 Game board with a grid of 10x10 boxes

Object
The object of the game is to score the most points. There are 14 squares with gold centers that score double points. so the whole 10x10 board is worth 114 points.

Play
