In addition to the rules, you will need figures to represent each side, at least two six sided dice (D6) and a ruler or tape measure.

name: Epic: Warlords
description:
Epic: Warlords is a strategy wargame of a vast scope, dealing with the rise and fall of civilizations over hundreds of years, and the terrible battles and wars between the races of Elves, Goblins, Dwarves, and Man.

Epic: Warlords depicts an epic war between the ancient races of Man, Elves, Goblins and others for the domination of the world. The game takes place over the course of centuries or even millennia. But it is at the scale where even within this lengthy time frame, individual heroes and individual actions can leave an impact certain to give birth to legends.

This game involves many campaigns, all of indefinite length, within a larger round that involves the growth of populations and cities. And although armies may be large, individuals stand out due to leadership, artifacts, and miracles. At points in the game, you may wonder, 'just how did one hero defeat 3 units of my armies?' But use as reference - rather than the real world - the myths of Hercules, Odysseus, and King Arthur, or the fantasy stories 'The Lord of the Rings' and 'Conan the Barbarian' (at the end of which Conan and a friend kill about 50 mounted enemy knights).

http://www.darkshadowgames.com/Epic_Registration/register.ht...
(Click "Download EPIC.ZIP" for rules and bits)

name: Eugene en Italie
description:
Eugene en Italie (Eugene in Italy) is a DTP game, portraying the 1809 campaign of Prince Eugene (Napoleon's stepson) in Venetia.
Units are brigades for infantry and regiments for cavalry. Three scenarios are provided, one on the battle of Sacile (15 turns), one of 9 turns on the clash on the banks of the Piave river, and a full campaign scenario of 45 turns.

name: Eyewitness News Game
description:
A Buffalo, NY Game. Made to commemorate an award winning news team for channel 7 WKBW-TV. On Front of Box:

Your chance to become a junior reporter for Eyewitness News! Be the first back to the station with all the facts and get your story on the air.

WKBW-TV Net proceeds donated to the Buffalo Variety club for Children's Hospital.

(This uses a one sided board, which is a redo of the Blizzard of '77 Travel game)
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sliders
description: Based on curling, players move their two Sliders across the table or another smooth surface. Score 1 point for being closest to the edge, 2 points for a 'cliffhanger'. First player to score 10 points wins. Variant: use a target instead of the edge of the table.

name: Pick A Pair!
description:
Book of thirty new two player games:
Co-ords
Tetral
Trios
Man-trap
Towers
Guess Race
Harlequin
Owteno
Maze
Serpents
Tripod
Countdown
Squeeze
Pathway
Mosaic
Crocogator
Steeplechase
Leapfrog
Necklace
Tug o'war
Walkover
Rhombic
Spiders
Summit
Star Shoot
Cross-fire
Nemesis
Triads
Roundabouts
Tandems

name: Un Po d'acqua a Torino
description:
One of few limited "Single card games" made from GiocaTorino for the first "Ludo Day" done the 18th of December 2005.

Very few copies of this game were made. The game itself was printed on regular paper and was a gift for people who were participating in the Ludo Day.

name: Alibi
description:
The game consists of 51 cards divided into 4 sets of 12 - Crime, Prosecution, Defense, and Alibi. There are three additional cards - the Prisoner and 2 Surprise Witness cards.

The game is essentially a trick-taking game with 3 of the sets. The Alibi set is not shuffled in, but acts as a scoring mechanism as players receive these cards for winning tricks. Witness cards act as trump cards.

name: Earth Gone Mad
description:
From the web page-

Overview:
The Mayan calendar is one of the oldest and most accurate calendar systems in human history. Using no more than their knowledge of the Earth, Sun, and stars, the Mayans were able to tabulate days, weeks, months, and years from 3113 BC until December 21, 2012 AD. No one knew why the Mayan calendar ended on that date..

On December 22, 2012, a small asteroid swung in from the outer solar system and clipped the moon.

For over a year astronomers had been tracking the asteroid, but due to its small size had not thought it a serious threat. It proved, however, to have a much higher density than expected. Its impact with the moon imparted a distinct 'wobble' to the lunar orbit and ejected megatons of lunar material into Earth orbit.

Scientists estimate the moon's orbit will return to normal in a few years. But, its erratic orbit will have catastrophic effects on Earth's biosphere during the first year. By the end of 2013, all life on the six northern continents will be extinct.

Welcome to mankind's last year…

Two versions of this game are available: A PDF (Print and Play) version and a Vassal version.

name: Jonny Quest Card Game
description:
Players try to win each round by being the first to discard all the cards in their hand, at which time one point is scored for each card held by the other players. You win the game by accumulating 11 points (with two players), 21 points (three players), or 31 points (four players).

Contents include 42 cards (numbered from 1-40 plus two wild cards), rules booklet, and scoring booklet.

"Ages 10 and up."
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Bokstavsspel ABC sa lilla t
description:
The purpose of this game is to learn the alphabet.

A pair is a match if you turn over both the small letter and the capitol letter.

Players take turns drawing two cards. If the cards are a match they can continue to find more pairs.

If they are not a pair then the cards are returned to the same place on the table.

The winner is the one with most pairs when all tiles have been taken.

name: Totalisator Greyhound Racing Game
description:
From the rules:
"This is a most exciting game, full of thrills from start to finish. A wonderfully entertaining game for family and friends.
It differs from other race games in that the players do not assume ownership of the greyhounds, but participate only in betting on the results of the races".

Four players operate the "win", "place",tote-double" and "forecast" pools and issue tickets to the bettors.
A dice is rolled to decide which of six greyhounds move.
The player with most money after a series of races is the winner.

The box of components is separate from the board. Components consist of betting tickets, money, six cardboard greyhounds on metal bases, and a die.
The board consists of a greyhound race track in the middle of the board and various betting areas around the track.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks: Battle for the Ancient Robot
description:
A one-on-one book game with a sci-fi/adventure theme. Each player is a champion of their star-faring race, trying to find pieces of the Ancient Robot, a powerful and dangerous artifact of a lost civilization. The pieces of the Ancient Robot are scattered throughout the galaxy, and the players move from system to system to find them by choosing which page to turn to. In their quest, they will encounter all sorts of harrowing adventures, battling or befriending strange monsters, collecting strange new items to improve their abilities, and may even run across each other....

The premise, as described by the books:

A million years before mankind invented fire or the Cybrtrons first oiled their gears, the Ancient Ones ruled the universe. For reasons lost in the mysteries of time, the Ancient Ones channeled all of their galaxy-spanning efforts into the building of one huge robot. There were twenty star systems in the realm of the Ancient Ones, and each one of the twenty was given the task of building one part of the massive robot.

The project was soon completed, the twenty parts constructed. The Ancient Ones had to bring the twenty parts to one central location and assemble the robot. But something went wrong -- perhaps a war between the systems, perhaps attack by some alien race. The Ancient Ones vanished. All that remained were the scattered parts of their robot.

One million years later, two parts of the Ancient Robot were recovered in different areas of the Milky Way galaxy. A team of humans discovered one part of the Ancient Robot in the year 2289 A.D., while exploring the planet Pluto. The Robot provided mankind with the secret of interstellar travel and a star chart marked with the location of the other nineteen parts.

At the same time, a civilization of robots also discovered a part of the Ancient Robot. Called Cybrtrons, they had overthrown their soft-skinned creators centuries before. They are now determined to rule the galaxy! The Ancient Robot part also gave the Cybrtrons the secret of interstellar travel and a star chart revealing the location of the other nineteen parts.

Both civilizations immediately decide to go in search of the Ancient Robot. Records of the Ancient Ones reveal that the Ancient Robot has the capability to design and build technological devices that will advance mankind a thousand years. The Ancient Robot is also capable of destroying anything in its path! With this device, the Cybrtrons know they can conquer the galaxy!

Both civilizations are sending their best pilots into space to search for the Ancient Robot. The Cybrtrons and the humans have become aware of each other. The search for the Ancient Robot has turned into a deadly race.

YOU are the leader of one of the two groups assigned to find the Ancient Robot!

Part of the series of 1 on 1 Adventure Gamebooks.
categories: Adventure, Book, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Abs-Trac-Toe
description:
Object: To earn territory points by claiming adjacent territories on a semi-randomly created board.

Play: One player draws an irregularly-shaped figure on the paper. That player must divide it into nine sections by drawing two horizontal and two vertical lines. The other player gets to draw one line. This line must start and end at an outside edge. Starting with the player who did not draw the bending line, take turns marking vacant spaces, one at a time. The game ends when there are no vacant spaces left to fill.

Winning: Score one point for every interior border shared by spaces that you have claimed. Shared corners (vertices) do not count as shared borders.

name: Hijacked
description: Features gun playing pieces - there are 5 present, money pack, game board, rules. As the Hijacker you negotiate for the highest dollar award for your hostages. The winner escapes with the cash.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Create-a-picture
description:
"Build a cottage, barn or schoolhouse, plant a garden and make it grow.

Create-a-picture is a unique noncompetitive game that develops creative expression in school-age children.

Players create pictures using interchangeable mosaic cards. with 126 cards to choose from, the possibilities are as limitless as a child's imagination."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Biogenics: The Game of a Lifetime
description:
The object is to stay alive and make enough BIO-ENERGY(in the form of chemical ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate) to meet the various challenges of life. Without energy, life ends. A great amount of energy is required to produce the next generation.

The player who gets the BABY first is the WINNER and is awarded a winning card. To win requires skill, strategy and luck-the ingredients that make life more enjoyable.

On the other hand, avoid accumulating too many harmful WASTE PRODUCTS (W.P.). Of you accumulate 10,000 or more waste products, you will be disqualified from the game.

name: Goal!
description:
There are 44 Soccer cards with attractive artwork depicting different English football club kits from the 1950s. Most cards have a number on them from 2-11, which corresponds to each position on the soccer pitch - for example, 9 is a center forward.

You have to place the cards you get to make attacks on your opponents goal. 3 cards are needed to make up a defensive or attacking formation. Goalkeeper cards and free kick cards can help to upset the balance of your opponent's plays.

The possible formations are set out on player aid cards - for instance:
4,2,3 or 5,2,3 make saving(defensive moves)

and 5,7,9 or 6,10,11 make attacking moves.

The game is played over two halves and the player with the most goals wins.

There are separate rules for play with 3 or 4 players.

All the English teams in the First Edition set were in the First or Second Divisions at the end of the 1958/59 season, and never after that (Grimsby and Barnsley being relegated from the Second Division in that year).

name: Ishi
description:
A Nim-like abstract game played in two parts. In the first part, players place stones on the board, and the player placing the last stone loses. In the second part, players proceed to remove the stones, and the player removing the last stone loses. In order to win the game it is necessary to win both parts.

A key feature of the game is that the number of stones you can place or remove depends on how many stones your opponent placed or removed on the previous turn.

The game was published by Ravensburger as part of their Präsent Series. Each item in this series contained two games; Ishi was paired with Go (the Ishi board is on the back of the Go board, and it uses Go stones as pieces).

name: Radio Collector: Frontier Gentleman Series Log
description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Frontier Gentleman, starring John Dehner. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Radio Collector: Fort Laramie Series Log
description:
This eBook contains information on the popular adult western, Fort Laramie, starring Raymond Burr. The log contains air dates and episode titles, along with brief plot descriptions. Also included is a list of cast members and writers, where known.

Besides the log, you will also receive a CD label in .jpg format that you can import into your favorite label printing program. And a set of 6 collector cards that can be used to play with the Radio Collector Card Game, or just printed out and collect them for the fun filled facts listed on each card.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battle for Stalingrad Micro Game
description:
The Battle for Stalingrad WWII Micro Strategy Board Game is a fast paced mini game for two players. It covers Stalingrad and the surrounding area, and begins with the German 1942 offensive on the Russian Front.

It was published in Empires of History Magazine issue #1, and includes:
-11" x 14.75" full color game board
-2 zone maps for Upper and Lower Stalingrad
-108 plastic playing tokens
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: ZIN
description:
This game is played on a 7x7 square board.The board shows several "win-fields", each depicting two symbols (male and female).

The players take turns drawing a tile from his own stack of tiles. They then place the tile on the board. The tile shows one of three symbols: male, female and mountain. The tile must be played next to a win-field, in such a way that the symbols match (a mountain can be played next to a side that shows both male and female, or neither).

When a win-field is completely surrounded, it is scored. Both players count the tiles they have next to the win-field (tiles are worth one or two points). The player who has the most points scores as many points as his opponents has present.

The game ends when all tiles have been played. At that point, some extra points are distributed and the total score is determined. The player with the most points wins.

name: The Black Heritage Trivia Game
description: The Black Heritage Trivia Game is a fun and challenging way to show what you know about black history and culture. The game contains over 1200 questions and answers. Get the answers right and make your way to the inner circle. But be careful, your opponent is trying to send you back to the start! Be ready for hours of enlightening entertainment.
publishers: Geebee Marketing, Inc., Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Family Derby
description: Family Derby is a horse racing simulation game. Players bet on horses each race to Win Place and/or Show. The game ends after a series of races with the winner determined by which player has totaled the most winnings.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Pitwits
description:
The quick-witted game for for quick-witted people!

Pitwits challenges you to think fast, but think straight. You all take a turn to read a set of five clues to the others, the clues get easier as more are read. You simply shout out the answer when you think you know it; if correct all the others move down the board towards the pit and out of the game, if wrong then you move towards the pit.

Movement is related to the number of clues which have been read before the answer is given - the more clues, the less movement - e.g. 1 clue = 5 spaces, 5 clues = 1 space.

The last player left in the game wins.

name: Pentagon: The Marble Game of the 70's
description:
Players set their marbles up on the interior or exterior pentagon. From there, you attempt to move one at a time taking turns to get to the person's other pentagon (e.g. interior tries to get to the exterior). You can jump when you are next to another's marble and capture it. First one to get all their remaining marbles to the inside wins as long as he has as many marbles the other person.

Nice wooden board and marbles for bits...

name: Math Magic
description:
Math Magic
A strategic board game which echoes a domino style format.
Each tile is sectioned into quarter, colored triangles, with each color representing a math operation. Red for division, green for multiplication, blue for subtraction and yellow for addition. Players, in turn, match a tile to an existing one, trying to outsource their opponent. While
division and subtraction earn fewer points, any remaining tiles will be subtracted at the end of the game.
Players: 1 - 4
Ages 10+
Contents:
Gameboard, 4 tile holders, reproducible score sheets, 84 tiles, tile pouch, instructions

Available for sale at:
http://www.educatorsoutlet.com/2005/webcatalog.php?showpage=...;showletter=P

name: Memory Lane
description:
Do you remember Wiley Post, the Pierce Arrow, or the Zoot Suit? How about Xavier Cugat or Fay Wray? You will find all of these and more! The object is to get your teammates to identify as many "memorable" bits of history as possible in less than a minute.

Includes gameboard, playing pieces, 400 game cards, timer, and instructions

name: Muovaile ja arvaa!
description: A team game in which players make figures out of plasticine and teammates try to guess, what the figures represent.

name: Wall Street Trader
description:
From the back of the box:

Up to 4 Players!
Ages 12 And Up!

Think the Stock Market is a tough & risky game of high finance?

It is!!

Can you beat the odds?

WALL STREET TRADER will give you a grasp on the ways of The Market!

Make ultimate decisions, thrill to the enrichment of success...

challenging...
fun...
educational!!

- - - - -

The rules are printed on the back of the box top and seem to indicate a cross between a roll-and-move stock game (like The Stock Market Game from way back) and Stocks & Bonds (because you have to track holdings and value on paper). There are even special spaces like Federal Holiday, Quote Machine Down, and Telephone out of Service.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Picture+ This
description: Players form teams and try to score points for their teams by guessing the meanings of rebus picture-puzzles, representing items from the categories people, places, clichés, or TV/movies. One teammate is a clue giver and the others try to solve the puzzles within 45 seconds.

name: Catch Zoboo If You Can!
description:
Find the most matching pairs of Zoboo and his friends to win!

It's a basic memory game with a few twists. The game includes 48 game cards and a 2 1/2" painted, plastic Zoboo figure. In addition to the 16 pairs of animals, there are 16 extra tiles with the following special rules:
- 10 Take Zoboo Cards: When you get a pair of these, you get to take the Zoboo figure from the table or from the player who has it.
- 4 Lose a Pair Cards: When you get a pair of these, you lose ONE of the pairs you have. Return that pair and the "Lose a Pair" cards to the box.
- 2 Wild Cards: ANY other card you pick with this card (including Lose a Pair and Take Zoboo) becomes and instant pair!

After there are no more matches to be made, players count up all the cards they have. The player who has the Zoboo figure at this time adds an extra 4 points to their score. The player with the most points wins.

name: Meer, Minder, Gelijk
description: This game teaches children the meaning of the terms 'more, less, equal' and is derived from Domino. Special dice determine which pieces may be added. Through the easy to grasp symbols, colors and rules, children learn effortlessly while playing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Tri-Checkers
description:
This game has the same object as traditional checkers: either capture all your opponents' men or trap them from moving. The difference in this case is that there are two opponents rather than one, and the last player standing wins.

The gameboard is adapted from an American board; that is, eight red-and-black squares along the home or back row with the dark square to the player's left. This board consists of three 24-square grids connected in a Y-shape. The fourth row of each grid is elongated and stylized to allow the board to connect.

The gameboard reverse is a typical, 8x8 American-style chess board. The game includes rules of play both for traditional checkers and Tri-checkers.

name: Bienen-Spiel
description: Easy children's game - up to 4 players (ages 6+) move over a flower field in order to reach their home - only problem are occurring clouds.....

name: Come Play With Me
description:
From the box :

"It's a great time for you to come play with me!

Let's go through the house and see what fun stuff we can find! Toys are everywhere! Balls in the living room, trains in the kitchen, bears in the bedroom. Look, I found the blocks! Can you be the first to collect all of the toys you need for your toy box? So many toys to find. Good thing it was so easy to find this great game!"

As usual - great quality components from Ravensburger. The box itself becomes the gameboard, as the floor and wall components insert nicely into the base. Wonderful colors will keep kids interested in this fun little memory/set collecting game. Roll the die...move from room to room...turn over a tile...only keep that toy if you do not already have that toy. The first player to have a complete set of all 6 distinct toys wins!

Sweet and simple. Just as we've come to expect from Ravensburgers' wonderful line of kid's games.

Designed for ages 3-6.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: I-SPY
description: A game with unusual equipment. One player is the "detective", he holds a special magnifying glass in which a tile is inserted. The magnifying glass only lets him or her see a tiny piece of the tile; so it has to be moved back and forth to find out what the tile shows. In the meantime, however, the other player are trying to roll a little metal ball into a hole on their special clocks, the hole having been determined by the detective first. As soon as a player has gotten the ball in the right hole, the detective has to show the picture from the tile on the game board, if successful, he or she can keep it. The magnifying glass is passed on to the next player. The player who wins most tiles wins the game.
publishers: MB Giochi, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Curious George Finds the Bunnies Game
description:
Curious George Finds the Bunnies Board Game starring everyone's favorite classic monkey!

Curious George let the bunnies out of their cage!
Help George look under tree stumps, rocks and bunches of flowers to find the bunnies... and remember where they are hiding until it's time to round them all up!

name: Tangled Tales: Edgar & Ellen – The Eerie Wax Museum Adventure Deck
description:
Edgar & Ellen are troublesome twins who live with their unusual pet, Pet, in a towering, bleak house on the outskirts of the impossibly pleasant town of Nod's Limbs. Pale-faced and clad in tattered footie pajamas, this crafty duo loves to make mischief wherever they go.

Tangled Tales Edgar and Ellen Adventure Deck - The Eerie Wax Mystery
The abandoned Waxworks on the edge of Nod's Limbs holds more than crusty vats and old machinery - strange new plants have taken root in the waxy ruins. When Edgar & Ellen and Pet sneak inside to find a giant snapping plant for Ellen's greenhouse, they stumble upon hideous oozy creatures who've started up the factory again. Mischief is afoot!

You decide what Edgar & Ellen do! Follow the clues to seek out the rare snapping plant... before the wax monsters - or something worse - can get them!

Expands:

Tangled Tales Starter Set: The Gatekeeper Chronicles 1 – Nightmare Unleashed Adventure Deck

name: Bonnie Prince Charlie
description:
A game of the Jacobite Rebellion, 1745.

Bonnie Prince Charlie is a game of movement, recruitment and battle. It is playable in two versions, a two player game and a multi-player game. The basic rules for the two player game are used with additions for the multi-player game.

Play occurs on a mapboard which depicts the British Isles. Forces are represented by card pieces, the color of which indicates the Jacobites (blue) or Hanoverians (red). Forts and artillery are also represented.

The game has a mounted board and large colorful counters - graphically well ahead of it's time when published.

name: Puppy Lake
description:
A game of saving adorable puppies for 1-3 players.

The basic Puppy Lake game is a solitaire game involving puppies, a lake, Mean Old Man Hubbard, a truck, a canoe and still more puppies. Players must attempt to maneuver their canoe to save as many puppies as possible before they drown.

Mean Old Man Hubbard drives his truck back and forth across a bridge, tossing puppies into the lake. Puppies float downstream towards certain death. The player has limited control over how far he or she can paddle the canoe each turn.

Rules for 2-3 players include multiple canoes and even a Mean Old Player option.

Puppy Lake is a quick playing humorous game about a sad and serious subject. Not intended for impressionable youth.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Dice, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Krazy Bee Bowling
description:
Each player is dealt 10 cards. Each frame a player will draw one card from the deck and play one or two cards. A player can draw cards to complete the 10th frame. A player may draw more than one card to complete his or her frame. If a player has a Spare card in hard when the 10th frame is completed, it will count 10 point off for every Spare card in hand, as well as the face value of the number cards. The player with the highest score after penalty cards are deducted from the 10th frame is declared the winner.

The game is produced by B & B Games, Inc. of Midwest City, Oklahoma. According to a game insert, Bill Weingartner appears to be the designer and/or publisher.

name: Zhuang Yuan Chou
description:
Zhuang Yuan Chou (Chong Yuen Chow in Cantonese) is a gambling game using dice and tallies, first mentioned in Chinese texts in the late 18th century, but still played today.

'Zhuang Yuan' is the title given to the scholar who achieved the highest distinction in the imperial examinations that determined entry into the Chinese bureaucracy.

The game consists of six dice and sixty-three tallies bearing titles of ranks of achievement in the examinations and the number of points they are worth. There is only one each of the top 3 positions, of which the highest value (32 points) and the largest tally is the Zhuan Yuan.
The lower the position, the thinner/shorter the tallies and the fewer points each is worth. At the lowest rank, Xiu Cai, there are 32 tallies worth 1 point each. As with many Chinese dice games, a porcelain bowl is often used to hold and roll the dice.

To play, punters agree on a value per point (Dobree mentions 1 cent, 10 cents or 50 cents). Each player takes turns rolling all six dice. According to the roll, the player is allowed to claim tallies of equivalent worth from the center of the table where they are initially placed. Certain rolls allow one to claim tallies from other players if those tallies were previously claimed. The game is played until all tallies have been claimed.

The best roll is six of a kind, allowing the player to claim all the tallies, whether they are in the pool or with other players. Five of a kind allows the player to claim the Zhuan Yuan tally wherever it is. Red fours (on Chinese dice, the one and four spots are red) are also good to roll - four of them will also get you the Zhuan Yuan tally. Dobree and Culin have both described the game including the values of the rolls.

In the past, tallies were made of bone and hand-engraved. Modern sets have brightly colored plastic tallies and can be found for sale in Mahjong shops in Singapore (and likely elsewhere).

name: L33T Tiles
description:
L33T Tiles are a replacement tile set for Scrabble® and other word games, based on internet slang known as leetspeak. The letter distribution has been modified and extensively tested for optimal play using leet words in the add-on dictionary.

Each set of L33T Tiles comes with 103 tiles, a satin pouch and a manual with additional rules for gameplay. The tiles are colored to emulate a classic terminal window, and the manual is printed on a genuine IBM punch card.

Home Page: http://www.leettiles.com/

name: Carrot Race
description:
Collect carrots with your hare from the 'garden' and bring them back to the burrow (the starting point). Once there you receive a carrot card, but keeps it face down until the end of the game.

There are 3 kinds of carrots:

rotten (no points at the end of the game),
unripe green (1 point) and
ripe red carrots (2 points).


The player with the most points wins.

It is also possible to win and lose carrots during the game in the two next situations:

1. If a hare with a carrot and a hare without a carrot meet on the same square, they must roll the die to determine who keeps the carrot.

2. If you collect 3 lettuce cards (you get these when you are on a square with a lettuce symbol), you will win a carrot card from the player with the most cards.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Racing, Transportation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wizard Wars
description:
Maug the Wizard-King is dead. You are one of his apprentices, skilled in the dark arts and in the arts of sorcery. Summon minions to fight your battles, wield earthshaking magics. Vie for control of ancient libraries, pools of magical power, and mighty fortresses. Then, when the time is right, take the Diamond Throne for your own!

Each apprentice has a different deck of spells available. These are not only thematic, but give different sorts of abilities. Wizards going on quests can find magic items. The Regent must be deposed from the throne first, then the throne held for three full turns to win. Meanwhile, the peasants will attack whoever currently holds the throne.

Game contains a rolled up laminated color board, player mats, and cardstock counters, tent-folded figures, a spell deck for each player, and monster and item cards.

name: Football Fever
description:
Football Fever is as the title implies a football (soccer) game in which 2-6 players compete for the championship by means of football knowledge and playing matches against each other.

The game plays much like Monopoly in that, players will roll 2 dice and move around a circular playing field. However there are no properties to buy, instead players will have to answer football related questions, play matches, play set pieces (ie. penalty kick, free kick etc.) or gain bonuses in the shape of cards that'll give them an advantage in the aforementioned matches.

Football matches are played out on the middle of the board, and uses a colored die to determine the movement of the ball and subsequently the success of attempts on goal. matches are timed with a tiny hourglass.

The player to first reach 15 points on the scoreboard by answering trivia questions AND reach 3 match victories is declared winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Volley & Thunder
description:
From the games intro:-

WAR IN NAPOLEON’S TIME
Dickens & Greenwood Games are not historical simulation games, such as you may have seen. They are historically based, in that they recreate the military capacities of a given era in the history of warfare, but they are abstract. They do not restrict the player to the circumstances of a given campaign, or to the capacities of actual units, or to the style of an actual leader. Both players are equipped with units whose capacities are equivalent to those of the era in which the game is set. But their forces and situations are abstract and equal, and each player must win or lose according to his own skill and judgment, without the influence of luck or of pre-existing historical conditions. There are no dice or chance outcomes.

Chris's Comments
The game is played on a map divided into equal squares using units to represent Infantry, artillery and Cavalry. To make the game balanced the map is also symmetric about the line dividing the two sides. The game is won by either eliminating all field units, or by blocking the roads leading from the opponents city or occupying the opponent city.

name: Candy
description:
Candy is played with a bowl of candy and a deck containing twice as many cards as players. Players attempt to locate Puck (Jack of Spades) while avoiding Grandmother (Queen of Hearts). Puck allows you to eat the candy you have collected on previous turns. Grandmother allows another player to eat your candy. At the end of each turn, you must take one piece of candy from the bowl and give it to another player and also trade a single card with any player. The game ends when Puck and Grandmother are discovered in one player's hand or if anyone eats ten pieces of candy. The player who eats the most candy wins.

Candy is an elaborate descendant of The Lost Pueblo of Doctor Green. It was first published in the program book of ShoreCon 2000. It was also published in Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack.

name: V
description:
V - "Join in and relive the fantastic adventure to save the Earth"

Cheap and cheerful Spanish spin-off board game for the younger gamers, cashing in on the 1983 American TV series of the same name that had audiences across the globe glued to their TV sets.

"One day, 50 space ships appear across different earth locations, that in a matter of days are conquered, for the sole purpose of stripping the earth of its water and (human) food supplies. In order to fight them a resistance group called "V" is set up, which embarks on the obvious route of liberating all the cities dominated by the invaders. But the visitors are prepared and have set tough traps in their way.

The first player who is able to overcome all the obstacles and reach the city where one can find the ship of the extraterrestrial supreme commander, not only saves the earth but also wins the game."

It comes with a board, 1 UFO spinner, 6 cardboard figurines and 12 cards.

Publishing history: Published in Spain in 1984 as a cheap and cheerful spin off from the popular American sci-fi tv-series.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Age of Blood (Second Edition)
description: Age of Blood is a miniatures wargame where each player controls a Viking hero and his band of followers in the dark ages. In each game Vikings risk their lives raiding for loot and glory. Over a series of games the players can develop their hero's reputation and attract more and stronger followers. Meanwhile, they try to find the place to sell their loot for the best profit.

name: Brainwaves!
description: This is a word game whose object is to come up with ten words, each beginning with a specific letter, that match the category given and are not duplicated by someone else. Each player has their own copy of the clue card and an answer sheet. Game length is adjustable by the number of rounds played. There are bonuses for words that begin with less frequently used letters (like Y, V, K, etc. - they're listed in the scoring summary). There are also bonus points for getting 7, 8, 9, or 10 out of 10 words in each timed round. The game also lists several variants on play, like coming up with words that end in the chosen letter, or coming up with two words, an adjective and a noun, each beginning with the chosen letter (like "Delicious Dining" for example).

name: Slá í gegn!
description:
Slá í gegn! is a game written and published by one of Iceland’s most popular bands, Stuðmenn. It was an accessory with the first edition of the band's autobiography which was published in 1983, and both the game and the book are very much in Stuðmenn's style, humorous and flippant!

The game consists of a gameboard, two decks of cards and the rules of the game, which are rather simple, 1 page in all. Players must supply dice and pieces for each player.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Tank Vixens
description:
"The cardgame your mother should have warned you about!"

Tank Vixens is a collectible card game based on the comic book of the same name. This is not your typical CCG, it is definitely adults only.

The game consists of 106 cards which you use to assemble a play deck with a minimum of 40 cards. Each player requires their own set of cards. There are 6 types of cards: Characters, Minions, Tops, Tails, Props and Events.

Your Characters "attack" by posing, and each Character's posing value can be boosted by equipping them with clothing (Tops, such as "Wet T-Shirt", Tails, such as "PVC Stockings", and Props, such as "Cucumbers"). The sexier the outfit, the more impressive (and thus powerful) their pose. Event cards (such as "Mom Finds Your Diary") can be used to boost your own stats or penalize your opponents, and Minion cards (such as "FanBoy") can be sacrificed to prevent damage or gain bonuses.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction

name: MapTangle
description:
RECALLED 8/25/2005: The following product safety recall was conducted voluntarily by the firm in cooperation with the CPSC. Consumers should stop using recalled products immediately unless otherwise instructed. It is illegal to resell or attempt to resell a recalled consumer product.

The orange paint on the floor mat maps contains excess levels of lead. Lead poisoning is a serious hazard to children and is associated with behavioral problems, learning disabilities, hearing problems and growth retardation.

See http://www.cpsc.gov/cpscpub/prerel/prhtml05/05599.html for more details.

---

Think Twister meets world geography class.

Stretch your legs and your knowledge of world geography.

The first game in the BORDERLINE® GAMES "REACH AND TEACH" series. MAPTANGLE™ is a cooperative family game for 4 to 6 players that will provide hours of fun as you discover the man-made wonders, natural wonders, and geographical features of the world!

Cards represent different land regions and major bodies of water. Players need to find the correct location( on the 33 sq foot vinyl mat) and stand on it.

name: Bialo
description:
Age: 4+
Awards: Oppenheim Toy Portfolio Gold Seal Award 2006
Finalist - FamilyFun's T.O.Y. Awards 2005
Description:
You need a sensitive touch to get to the finish line first. Players move around the board based on which ring their animal lands in. The player who lands on the double red space wins. A fun mixture of skill and excitement. 17 play pieces plus fabric mat.

name: CMYK
description:
A four-player Chines Checkers variant that uses four-sided dice (most famous for use in some role-playing games) as pieces. The number indicated by a dice shows how far it can move or jump.

Whoever moves all of their pieces to the corner opposite to where they started wins.

RULES:

What you’ll need
• A chess board
• Each player needs ten 4-sided dice. (Preferably the kind with the numbers located at the corners so they are easily viewed when surrounded by other dice.)

Setup
The game begins with the board in the formation shown in the image in the gallery here.

Each player has their dice arranged in the corners of the game board. On your turn, you can use one piece. That piece can either MOVE or JUMP.

Moving
Move a piece either vertically or horizontally. No diagonal movement. A 4 can move four spaces, a 3 three spaces, 2 two spaces and 1 one space.

Jumping
Alternately, you can jump over an adjacent piece vertically, horizontally, or diagonally, as long as the landing space is empty.

You can jump over a number of pieces up to the digit on the jumping piece. (A 4 can jump over up to four pieces, 3 up to three pieces, 2 up to two pieces and 1 over one piece.) If you’re jumping over multiple pieces, they must be in a straight horizontal, vertical or diagonal line.

You can jump as many times as you wish in this manner as long as you don’t land on the same space twice.

Finally, a piece cannot jump over a piece of higher value. A 1 can’t jump over a 2, 3, or 4. A 2 can’t jump a 3 or 4. A 3 can’t jump a 4. However, a 4 can jump over anything.

Victory
Whoever moves all of their pieces to the 10 starting locations on the opposite corner of the board wins. They may be in any arrangement of pieces. They need not be in the exact starting arrangement from the beginning of the game.

name: Buck Rogers
description:
This vintage game was a 3-in-1 package: Cosmic Rocket Wars, Search for the Secrets of Atlantis, and Siege of Gigantica. Each was for 2 to 4 players, allowing up to 12 players to be accomodated at once. There are three colorful 16x16" game boards, one for each game. The components also include 40 cards, with black and white illustrations, and 12 wooden playing pieces. Listed as being for ages 8 to adult.

Reportedly offered as a Cream of Wheat premium in addition to being available in stores.

name: Vanessa Kay's Pin Up Mania
description:
From the publisher:
Your favorite Juggy from TV's Man Show!

From the trampoline of TV's Man Show direct to your gaming table, it's our exciting new card game featuring Vanessa Kay.

Race to be the first to complete a Pin Up of Vanessa and win the game. Collect the cards you need to win or block your opponent's play in this fast paced game.


Two to four players



Thirty to forty minute playing time



Be the first to complete a Pin Up of Vanessa and win!

name: Wild West War Pigs
description: The newest in the War PIGs (Plastic Infantry Guys) series, Wild West War PIGs pits plastic Cowboys and Injuns against each other.
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Pick -a- Penguin
description: Each player chooses to be one of four colored penguins at the South Pole: Yellow, Green, Red or Blue. There are four penguins of each color. All sixteen penguins start out in the center of a rotating iceberg, all mixed up. The penguins are trying to get back to their home igloo. On a player's turn, he rolls the large picture/number die, which will indicate how many penguins may be picked from the iceberg. The player then keeps all of his or her color penguins and returns the other penguins to the iceberg. The player may also roll the die to indicate that the iceberg should be rotated, thus mixing up the memorized order. The first player to bring all of his penguins back home is the winner!

name: Strike Force: Hunter
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

Strike Force Series

Designed to introduce a novice wargamer to conflict simulation, these games rely on familiar mechanics from other games you may have played to allow players to focus on strategy instead of learning new rules.

Strike Force: Hunter

A quick and dirty game of chasing bad guys, Strike Force: Hunter casts you in a dual role. You are trying to capture your opponent's terrorists while simultaneously attempting to infiltrate your own into his city. This game mixes "Concentration" with "Stratego" and offers several different ways to win... or lose. The entire file is 4 pages. There is a map, a set of markers to be cut & folded, and 2 pages of rules.

name: Monogramz
description:
In Monogramz, 30 lettered dice are shaken into a tray which divides them into 15 sets of two. Each player's objective is then to list names of celebrities with the same initials as each 2-letter monogram. When the hourglass timer runs out, the lists are scored and unique names earns the player points.
Special symbols on some of the faces of the dice denote the following categories that the celebrities' names must belong to: Authors & Artists; Entertainers; Athletes; and World Leaders. Although these symbols restrict the choice of category, regarding letters they act as wild cards. There is also a further symbol denoting "Wild!", meaning any letter, any category.
The game ends after a set number of rounds, or when a player reaches a set number of points.

name: Happy Birthday Party Games: Freezy Fun
description:
From the Publisher's web site:

The Ice Cube Party Game!

Freeze two ice cubes in the special molds and take one for your team. Now… try to keep it from melting. The catch? On your turn you may have to shake salt on it or maybe you’ll have to give it a shower under the faucet. It won’t take long before the ice cubes become a small puddle of their former selves. If your team can keep your cube the longest, you’re the coolest!

Instructions in English and Spanish.

For 4 or More Players in Teams

No. 6731
Ages 4 & Up

name: Babinského memoriál
description: Roll and move game in which players are escaping from prison. It seems to have some pachisi and backgammon elements. Players have a set of pieces that begin the game in different cells. Cards are drawn when landing on certain spaces on the board, and allow a player to manipulate die rolls, avoid guards etc.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bloody Picnic: Wargaming the End of Empires at Brigade and Divisional Level 1904 - 1924
description: Historical wargame, nominated for a 2005 Origins Award in the category Historical Miniature Game or Expansion.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Faith in the Game
description:
An "intellectually stimulating variation of Othello".

Abridged rules:

1. The object of the game is to get to the other side of the game board.
2. The game board is divided into squares, but you're not told how many squares wide or long it is.
3. You can only step on a square if it has a tile on it. You can step on any tile, even if it was made by another player.
4. If you step on an empty square, or the tile you're standing on breaks, then you "fall in" and have to swim back to the nearest tile.
5. Each empty square that either borders a tile or the starting edge of the game board has a question visible on it. The questions are very simple and have single answers, such as "why does water flow downhill?" or "why can light pass through glass?" or "what is heat?"
6. The only way to make new tiles is by making-up an answer to the question.
7. A tile will only float if you can verify the answer with a reproducible test.
8. A tile can only be broken by proving the answer is wrong with a reproducible test.
9. A test can't break a tile if its results can't be reproduced, a tile can't float if the verifying test's results can't be reproduced.
10. If a tile is broken, then all tiles ahead of it that cannot be connected back to the starting edge by another continuous series of tiles will be broken as well.
11. A player is defined as someone who obeys the rules. If you stop obeying the rules you cease to be a player until you start obeying the rules again.

Further explanation of the rules can be found at:
http://www.disenchanted.com/technology/game.html

name: Das Geheimnis der Sieben Raben
description: A fairy-tale themed family game. In the first phase of the game, the players try to discover the prince among the 7 ravens. In the second phase, the player who found (or thinks he found) the prince plays against the other players.

name: Caucus
description:
Caucus. The Exciting new presidential game.
Each player is a candidate for the presidency. Players roll to move around the board and collect votes from the fifty states. You can also challenge another player for his votes by rolling dice. The first player to obtain 270-electoral votes becomes president and wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Xenophon
description:
Not to be confused with the simulation game of the same title.

From the box: Lead your armies like the famous Greek military leader through enemy lines back to your fatherland. Try to avoid own losses, but fight, if unavoidable.
In fight you are supported by your trusty henchmen, who are willing to give their lives for you.

Packaged in a very small box comes another game of the short-lived "Pocket-Games" (Taschen-Spiele) series from Heyne, which is better known as a book publisher.

Though themed in Greek history, this is a variant to traditional abstract games, but with several twists. Each player has one leader playing piece, several citizens, and some henchman - he must try to get his leader and citizens to the opposite side of the board, trying to lose as few as possible. The other player tries the same with his men. Also both players have "servants" or henchmen, who are expendable for "the dirty work".
In the end each player gets points for his citizens and leader for reaching the other side - the number of remaining henchman does not matter.

The movement is determined by throwing a dice - but only one player throws it, both have then to use the same number of movement points.

In the four player variant two players control the citizens and the leader, the other two try to help their allies with the henchmen - but they are not allowed to communicate with their partners.

name: Strategic Golf
description:
According to the rules introduction:

" Strategic Golf is a lot like the real golf. Many of the rules are the same and the game is played much as it would be on a real golf course. It is also an exercise in strategy where each player must make decisions which may ultimately affect the game's outcome."

The two-sided game board illustrate a 18 holes golf course. Your golf bag contains an assortment of 5 wooden dice, each one emulating a different golf club (different distance), including the putter.

The box include:
- 1 two sided game board
- 1 special brown die (move 1 to 3 squares)
- 1 special yellow die (move 3 to 5 squares)
- 1 special blue die (move 5 to 7 squares)
- 1 special green die (for use on the putting greens)
- 4 pawns
- 4 reference cards
- 1 score pad
- 1 pencil
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Animal Pairs
description:
These adorable animals are looking for their partners. Can you help search for them?

This classic game of memory combined with Spinnerific fun is perfect for young children just learning to play games.

On your turn, spin the Spinnerific and turn over the number of cards show on the spinner. If you make an animal pair, you keep it.

Contents: 24 animal cards, Spinnerific, Game Rules.

Good for ages 3-99.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Memory

name: Lido
description:
Gambling.
The game consists in one colorful table and a can containing 19 colorful littles ball. The players betting on a series of combinations formed from the accidental exit of the littles ball from the can.

This game has similarities with Carlo Derby. Both games share the same randomizer (the can containing the 19 marbles)

name: Hex-Chex
description: Triangular, easily-kinged playing pieces are placed on a wooden board of thirteen hexagons connected by twenty-six squares. Typical checkers rules apply, except that jumps from square to square may "turn the corner" at the jumped hexagon. Examples of play and tournament scoring rules are also provided.

name: Eskimo
description:
Cooperative game for children 4 years and older.

The players are Inuit trying to catch enough fish before the sun sets, in which case they all win. Players roll a die and move their Inuit to the fishing holes, but if they roll a walrus or a polar bear, the sun moves forward towards sunset. Polar bears also try to steal fish, but other players can help.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bye-Bye Balloons
description:
Bye-Bye Balloons is a simple children's game for 2-4 players. The object of the game is to get rid of all of the cards in your hand. Each card depicts a brightly colored balloon.

The game uses the Spinnerific to determine the balloon color that players can discard. On your turn, you spin the Spinnerific and discard a balloon of the color shown on the Spinnerific.

The game is good for reinforcing colors with small children and also good for teaching basic lessons to children about taking turns and fairness.

Ages: 3+
publishers: International Playthings, Inc., Melissa & Doug, New Entertainment Ltd

name: Tenavateatteri
description: A pantomime game for kids. Smaller kids are trying to mimic pictures and for older kids there are words.

name: Grosse Fische, Kleine Fische
description:
An angling game for younger players. A field of 48 tiles is laid out, and players roll the dice to move their angler in one direction of their choice (left,right up or down). When a player lands on a tile, the player takes and looks at the tile -- if it is a card with red dots , the player keeps it, but if it's a small fish (without dots in the corner) the tile remains on the board. There are also some other items in the water that the players will keep. a football, broken umbrella, a shoe.
And there are water lilys that give you the opportunity to move a number of spaces equal or less to the number of water lilys on the card.

Great for learning to count and fun with the strange cards.

Winner of the game is whoever has the most dots.

name: Der Bär ist los
description:
Each player has to bring home his own three animals (a sheep, a pig and a goose). On every turn two dice are rolled, one to indicate the type of animal that has to be moved and one for the number of spaces the animal can move.

There is also a bear on the board that can be moved with the dice. If an animal lands on the space of the bear, it is sent back to the starting meadow.

Once an animal reaches the barn, it is given to the corresponding player (noted by the hidden color under the animal).

The first player to bring home his three animals (either himself or by the move of another player) wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pounce
description:
Pounce - A Fast Moving Battle of Words and Wits!

Contents: 56 letter cards and a tray that holds a row of 4 cards.

After an initial 4-letter word is placed in the tray, players play simultaneously. Place letter cards (one card at a time) on the tray, covering an existing letter and making a new word. First player to run out of cards wins.

name: Old MacDonald Soundtracks
description: The Listen and Match Sing-a-Long game for children 2 years old and up. Designed to develop the child's listening, concentration and matching skills.

name: Pebbles Flintstone Game
description: For ages 7 to 14. Text on the box appears "Live wire on the Bedrock exchange." Comes with spinner, money, and Fred, Wilma, and Pebbles cardboard figures. Spinner has an inner and outer circle. Match the results to the switchboard board to discover if the call went through or not.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric

name: Up N' Over
description:
The striking lime green plastic circular gameboard is about 15" in diameter. It is divided into twelve equal segments, each with a hole near the circumference. A small ball on a string is attached to the center of the board. The board has been designed with incomplete joins between each of the twelve sectors so that it is possible to flip the ball upwards by pressing down on the edge of any particular segment.

Players select an equal area of the board to patrol. If the ball is flipped into an opponent's hole, the player who achieved this is awarded a point. Each segment has three rows of holes for colored scoring pegs; a peg is placed in the top row of each segment at the start of the game. When a point is scored, any one peg from the relevant player's segments is moved down one row.

The first player to move all their score pegs from the top to the bottom row wins the game.

name: Coup de Grâce
description:
From the publisher's website ( www.rowdygames.com )...

A chopper's got your cannon pinned down and a Special Forces unit is rapidly approaching to take out your HQ. You maneuver your humvee within striking distance of the chopper and deploy an infantry unit to protect your HQ. Then you desperately wait for your tank to appear and tip the balance of power in your favor. A real battle in an on-going war? No, one of 15 realistic combat scenarios found in COUP de GRâCE, a fast-paced, two-player combat board game designed to put your gaming skills to the test, time and again.

COUP de GRâCE is a 2-player combat board game designed to simulate a modern battle between two equal forces. COUP de GRâCE pits commander versus commander, mano-a-mano, and challenges your skills at resource management, troop allocation, attacking, defending and thinking on the fly. Each player manages a force of 16 units which includes one mobile HQ, two Tank Units, two Humvee Units, two Cannon Units, two Infantry Units, two Helicopter Units and five Special Forces Units. Fifteen unique scenarios have been crafted to put your combat management skills to the ultimate test. Players can even come up with their own scenarios and submit them to Rowdy Games.

Each Game Includes:
• 15 Combat Scenarios
• 32 Combat Pieces
• 1 Combat Board
• 1 Combat Guide
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Point to Point Movement

name: Arubas Schatz
description:
A mysterious treasure of the Aruba Pirates is on the sea-bottom and may be claimed. Since a player cannot do this alone, friends must be called, i.e. collect four maps (cards) of the player's own sea inhabitant friend in four different colors. Whoever succeeds first wins.

Each player plays one of their four cards (maps) from their hand to the center of the table and compares it with the four maps which are already laid out on the table. The player may either take all maps matching the value of the player's map exactly or take all maps which add up to the number on the player's map. Maps which match the player's designated friend (sea inhabitant) and are of a missing color are added to the others displayed in front of him/her. The others are placed in the player's own discard pile. After all players have played their hand of four map cards, a new round begins. Maps in the center of the table remain.

A few specially designed cards bring additional excitement to the game. For example, with the help of these cards one can snatch away maps of the other players laid out in front of them or take all maps which are laid out in the table center. One may replace the maps that were taken by equivalent maps from their own discard pile. Therefore it is recommended that the player collect some of their own friend maps of the color he/she has already laid out. It is important for the other players to note which colors are in each discard pile as well.

In a variant the progressing values of collected friend maps play a larger role.

Arubas Treasure game did very well with our younger play testers (ages six to ten years). Luck, easy arithmetic, and some memory are part of game play. The maps are beautifully illustrated and of good quality. Thus all in all a really beautiful game for families, more fun with 3 or 4 treasure seekers.

Beate and Hans Schmidt
(Translation done in Google, with a little help from Mary Prasad - some parts skipped due to being incomprehensible.)

name: Kung Fu U
description:
John could not believe his luck. His first day at Kung Fu University, and already he was involved in a duel. He had trained all his life to be able to test his skills in the martial arts, and here he was already getting a chance.

As he stood his ground, his tiger claw held high and ready, John watched his foe. She was a little thing, all dressed up in a bright floral dress with a blue ribbon in her hair. Maybe after the duel, they could go get a glass of milk together he thought to himself.

That’s when she hit him.

Waking up on the grass, John rubbed his chin where the girl in the flower dress had hit him. She stood over him offering a hand up.

“Your Kung Fu was good, but mine was better,” she said with a smile as she walked away.

Maybe school would be a bit tougher then he thought, John mused as he chased after her, asking if she could show him how she did that kick.

This is Kung Fu U, the game of martial arts combat and fun times. Can you out fight your foes before they bring you down with a surprise attack. Can your Kung Fu out shine your foe’s skills. Find out who is the best of the best with this exciting Mini-game from Bad Baby Productions.

name: Berlin-Bummel
description:
Translated from box back:
Berlin has always been worth a journey, not only in today's time but for 750 years, because while the city was old then it is still much older today. Let yourself be captivated by the game of Berlin at the turn of the century. A stroll is worthwhile in itself as theaters, museums and much more besides lure you as you make your way into the city center seeing the sights. Enjoy again the splendor of old Berlin. An excursion into the outlying districts is worthwhile in itself as well. You will be astonished if suddenly a citizen of old Berlin emerges before you. Thus it goes as the train pulls in to platform 3 of the Goerlitzer station. “Everybody off!”, calls the station master.

Game summary:
Players travel the streets of turn of the 19th century Berlin via foot, subway and horse carriage trying to see as many sights as possible. The first player to collect advertisements from ten attractions, or find the hidden anniversary pin, and make it to the finish station wins. Along the way players may encounter citizens of Berlin which will send them off to various parts of the city.

name: Scream Inn
description: "We're Only Here For The Fear!” A fast Game Full of Fun for 2, 3 or 4 Players. The object of the game is to get your players out of ‘Scream Inn’. Beware there are ghosts under the beds and floor boards to ‘Boo!’ you at every turn. Place your ghosts in the board and spin the wheel to move them around. Try to get your marker out of the inn, without disturbing any ghosts.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Secret Unit Deployment

name: 1914: Revision Kit
description:
Revision Kit for 1914 (also designed by Jim Dunnigan). Consists of new counters (unmounted in first printings, mounted in later printings), a new CRT and revised rules. This is not a stand-alone game. Additional parts (like the mapboard) from Avalon Hill's 1914 are required to play the revised game.

(from the Designer's Notes:)

"... one of the purposes of this revision is to include the "idiocy factor" in the game. This is done by using the Plan 17 rule. The Germans are given an additional boost by use of the "Forced March" rule; a rule which was inadvertently left out of the original game.

While we were at it, we thought we might try to make 1914 more playable.... in the revision we have included all of the "playability" elements left out of the original for the sake of extreme realism."


For those who do not have the revision kit:

Forced March:
Each unit rolls on a D6 (as I recall this is limited to infantry and cavalry units)
1,2 Cannot move at all.
3-6 Gain 1 mp.

The Plan 17 rule requires the French to make 6 attacks on turns 1-3.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Ren
description:
Ren is a 2 player abstract strategic boardgame. Players alternate turns placing their stones on the board, trying to score points by forming groups (ren) of 4 or 6 stones in a row or box formation. When a group or set of groups are formed, they are immediately scored, and immediately become vulnerable to the opponent, as the stones adjacent to the scoring stone become weak and are ready for removal.
A lonely stone can be captured when totally surrounded, so there is a lot of movement on the board.

Ren is copyrighted, but anyone can freely download and share it. The pdf document contains very concise rules with examples and diagrams, as well as a Ren board and cutout pieces, so all you need is a pair of scissors, download, print and play.

download the pdf at www.mytaras.com/ren.html

name: Calady
description: Calady is a Kalah variant which is played by four players instead of just two. This adds an element of "randomness" to the game and makes planning strategy more challenging. Several versions exist, among them HYPERCalady which is a faster game.

name: Zoo Pals
description: This is basically a re-themed Memory game. It's definitely for younger children, as none of the animals in the game really exist.

name: Was siehst du?
description:
A simple children's game consisting of 60 cards (12 groups of 5) Each group consists of an object in five different environments.

Goal in each of the three provided rule variants is to collect sets of 3 or 5 matching cards.

name: Col
description:
"This game is taken from the book, On Numbers and Games, by John Conway (Academic Press, 1976) and is attributed to Colin Vout."
http://www.cs.uidaho.edu/~casey931/conway/col.html

Using any map of blank regions, players select colors (crayons) and take turns coloring any region which does not border a region they have previously colored. The winner is the last player able color a region.

This is a great use for completed Sprouts games. http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/7378

A variant named, Snort, allows bordering oneself but not opponents. http://www.cs.uidaho.edu/~casey931/conway/snort.html

name: Professor Noggin's Wildlife Safari
description:
Professor Noggin embarks on an expedition of the most colorful, exciting animals in the world, such as lions, zebras, and elephants. The diversity of wildlife is tremendous in this adventurous game of the natural world.

Card,topics,include:
African_Elephant
Cheetah
Giraffe
Zebra
Rhinoceros
Lions
Hippopotamus
Gorilla
Gemsbok
Mandrill
Ostrich
Hyena
Tasmanian Devil
Kangaroo
Koala
Panda
Tigers
Orangutan
Gibbon
Camel
Peacock
Tapir
Lemur
Anteater
Sloths
Armadillo
Toucans
Scarlet Macaw
Wildebeest
Platypus
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Chalk Talk Hockey Trivia Game
description:
This action packed Hockey Trivia Game is designed for hockey fans 8-adult. There are over 100 challenging questions on hockey rules and trivia. After landing on ChalkTalk or Locker Room Trivia and answering the question correctly, get ready to take a shot on goal! ChalkTalk's unique patented Mag-Action goal system makes a shot on the goalie a combination of luck and skill. It's an exciting race to put your hockey team together. The first team to have 6 players on their team bench is the winner!
For 2 or more players. Guaranteed Fun and No Skates Required!

name: Clone
description:
From back of box:

Clone is a challenging new game that combines skill and luck on a unique battlefield. The objective is to attack and eliminate your opponent's forces and prevent them from cloning lost pieces by destroying their cloning stations. Whether advancing your forces across the board into enemy territories or beaming them directory into any territory via transport stations, you'll find 'Clone' to be a game that will bring hours of fun for family and friends.

Owner's description:

A six sided board with locations for cloning stations on the outside and transportation portals on the inside with hex spaces between. Each player plays one (or more) color and has 6 cloning stations and 6 playing pieces. Playing pieces have different values (2 each of one, two and three) and can only capture those of like value or below (a la Stratego).

Three different six-sided dice control your possible choices for action each turn. The 'Movement' die is numbered 1-2-3-1-2-3 and controls how far you can move and how large a piece you may clone each turn. The 'Clone' die with 5 blank sides and 'Clone' printed on the remaining side determines whether you can bring a captured piece back and also allows you to roll again. The remaining 'Control' die determines what combination of actions you may take: Attack, Teleport, enter or exit a Cloning Station.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Little Golden Book Circle of Friends Game
description:
Spin the spinner and move your Golden Book Token clockwise around the spiraling gameboard. Each time you land on a Saggy Baggy Elephant FACE Square, turn over a card from the stack. If you turn over a Saggy Baggy Elephant card, move forward on the game board to the next Saggy Baggy Elephant Square and turn over another card. If the card you turn over is not Saggy, move forward to the nearest square that matches that character card. Your turn is over. If you land on a BIG Saggy Baggy Elephant and his trunk points to another square, follow his trunk (up or down) to that square.

The first player to reach the CIRCLE OF FRIENDS, land on the Final Saggy Baggy Elephant FACE Square and turn over a matching Elephant card, enters the Circle and wins the game!

name: Rage! Game
description:
The Rage! Game is very similar to the better known game Aggravation.

The board game is a cross made of two plastic halves, and when put together it forms a track of many dimples along the perimeter. Each player has 4 marbles that they move along the track from their starting position, trying to get them into home, after traversing the board. There are 5 dimples in the middle of the board that you can use as a short cut, but you need to roll specific numbers to use it.

If you land on another player's marble by exact count, you move it back to its starting position.

name: El Salvador
description: Solitaire wargame of the Salvadoran Revolution.

name: Menu for Murder
description:
The game package includes four scripted murder mystery scenarios, all set in England between 1900 and 1920. Scenario titles are "A Death in Devon", "Death of a Train Spotter", "Return of the Flower Hunter", and "The American Cousin".

Three of the cases have speaking parts for 7 or 8 characters, and allow an additional person to act as the narrator. The design is typical of this type of game, with plenty of opportunities for discussion, speculation and dramatic accusations.

The second case (Death of a Train Spotter) has no speaking parts, and is therefore playable by any number of guests. It is written as a meeting of the "Greater London Detective Club", during which the natural progress of a murder investigation is reconstructed.

name: LifeCards
description:
A card game designed to teach children about the environment. It consists of 81 Life cards in 9 suits (Health, Peace, Heritage, Wildlife, Plantlife, Produce, Air, Water & Earth); 13 Pollutant cards; 13 Clean-up cards.

The object of the game is to collect sets of identical Life cards (in a similar fashion to Rummy), which will earn points for the player at the end of the game. However these sets can be 'polluted' by other players using Pollution cards. If you are lucky you'll be able to clear up the polluted set using a Clean-up card, which also doubles the score of that set.

The game ends when one player plays their last card, and the winner is the one with the highest score.

name: Survival
description:
An official Scout endorsed game.

From the box:

The lives of nine people are in your hands. Do you have the resourcefulness, the ability to remain calm and take swift, effective action in the face of a crisis?

Find out how many of the nine would survive if you were their guide in a battle of wits, through five action packed zones: jungle, desert, marine, arctic and disaster.
Some challenges will ask for a verbal solution - others will ask you to demonstrate with actions.
It's exhilarating, it's fun, it's adventure. Best of all it's informative, because it pits you against real life obstacles.
Learn it, love it...one day you may have to live it.

name: Megaquiz
description:
Megaquiz is a Trivial Pursuit clone for 2-4 players. If there are more than 4 players, groups can be formed.

By answering questions from 3 periods (65-75, 75-85 and 85-95) the players gain points. He who reaches the finish first is the winner.

name: Steps: Step by Step Game
description: A game based around the UK pop group Steps. Players control one of the 5 members, and must go through a number of phases (steps), collecting tokens and money. Phases include spinning a spinner; answering questions on Steps; singing Steps lyrics and performing Steps dances,(with other players voting on performance). At the end of the game the player with the highest value of tokens has the highest chart hit and wins the game. In the event of a draw the one with the most money wins.

name: MazeMakers
description:
In this game players compete to find magical artifacts from an ancient maze. The maze is enchanted and players can change its layout using only their minds. This way they can help themselves in their search or hinder their opponents. Coins placed number up on the maze represent either monsters (stronger the bigger the number on the coin) or artifacts (if the suit, revealed only to the player that lands there, matches the player's suit). First player to find 3 artifacts and exit the maze wins.

This game was designed to be played with a piecepack set and a pentominoes set (e.g. Quintillions). The pentomino pieces are the walls for the maze. It gives a nice 3D feel to the game (each square section of the pentomino pieces has to be of the same approximate size as the small squares from the piecepack tiles). If you don't have a pentominos set, there's an alternative mechanic, although it changes the game a bit.
mechanics: Memory, Modular Board, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Interstellar Warfare
description:
Sir... Shields down, taking internal damage, we must withdraw.
That's enough Ensign! Hold Position! We must hold the line until the cruisers arrive...
Engineering get those shields up now!, or we wont see tomorrow.

Interstellar Warfare brings the simplicity and flexibility of cards to the realm of tactical space combat games allowing players to easily design ships, manage power, record damage and more without ever putting pen to paper or using complicated math. Players simply select ship hull panels and add ship system cards to design new warships. Construct warships to fill various roles within your fleet and send them into battle to devastate your enemies.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Heroes in Space
description: The third expansion to the Fuzzy Heroes universe in fact takes the game off Terra Firma and into the universe beyond. After a medieval/fantasy theme, a supper hero and a secret agent game, Inner City now tackles SciFi for fuzzy heroes and plastic foes. Rules for ship-to-ship combat using plastic models and vehicles are added, these are independent of the existing Fuzzy Heroes rules.
categories: Animals, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Sky High
description:
In this dexterity game, players build a tower out of variously shaped wooden blocks based upon dice rolls. The results of a roll table indicate whether you must try to use all the blocks left in the kitty, or only one block. Often, the result of the roll indicates the shape of a block that you must place on top of the tower. Completing the tower grants you 15 points, causing the tower to collapse on your turn grants all the other players points equal to the number of blocks left in the kitty. There is an exception: if you fail in your attempt to place the very last block atop the tower, each other player gets 15 points. The game is played to a 50 point total.

The year, 1972, is a guess, as the game is unmarked. However the box is very similar to "Penta-Logics," which did come out in 1972, hence the guess.

name: Sea Hunt Underwater Adventure Game
description: Sea Hunt Underwater Adventure Game is based on an old TV show from the late 1950's and early 1960's called "Sea Hunt" that starred Lloyd Bridges as Mike Nelson a skin diver. This game was made by Lowell Toy MFG. Corp., New York 56, N.Y. The copyright is listed as 1961 Ziv-United Artists, Inc. This is a spin and move game. The object of the game is to search areas of the sea for gold treasure.

name: Gorram Reavers!
description: Players are parts of Reaver packs from Joss Whedon's "Firefly" universe. The goal is to raid planets and moons for victims. Winner is the first player to a 1000 body count. The board is a variable lay out of planets and moons with chits on them representing populations to ravage. Players move their ships from location to location and trying to over power what they find. Players use cards to increase their crew "packs" and give them bonuses as well as cards that effect the 'verse and other players. Players can upgrade ships to carry bigger crews.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: BWAH!
description:
A fan-made re-theme of BANG!, based on Joss Whedon's "Firefly" TV show. Instead of Sheriff, Deputy, Outlaw and Renegade, it's Captain, Crew, Local Color and The Merc. Characters are from the TV show, such as Wash, Mal, Book, Zoe, River, etc. Weapons and everything else is also based on the show; i.e. Vera (Weapon) and the Mule (Vehicle instead of Mount). And instead of Beer, you get Mudder's Milk.

Expanded by:


BWAH!: Gorram Plans
BWAH!: This Land
BWAH!: Local Color
BWAH! Can't Stop the Signal (Also plays as separate base game)
BWAH!: Those Left Behind


Currently Active Download Links:


http://www.fireflyfans.net/mthread.aspx?bid=13&;tid=36208&mid=664346#664346
http://jonathan.kc8onw.net/TCM%20Firefly%20Games/
