After a player has moved, look at the new tile. If it has a letter in the center, refer to the lettered paragraphs at the end of the rules. If the tile has a door, it must be opened. If the tile has no letter, then a roll must be made for Wandering Monsters."

Basically, you explore the crypt (looking for the Scepter), fighting monsters and picking up magical items when you can. The tiles in my copy are missing the identifying text on the tiles that are not supposed to be blank; however, you can figure it out without them.

You must complete your quest - to return alive with the Pharaoh's Scepter - within 40 turns. For more of a challenge, reduce the number of turns allowed.

name: Bakto
description: According to an article from 1984, Bakto is a "re-creation" of Sixteen Soldiers, a game in which two players, each with sixteen pieces, attempt to remove their opponent's pieces by jumping and capturing. The game is played with glass stones on an Alquerque board with four triangular extensions on each side. It is unclear from the article whether there are any differences between Bakto and the traditional game, however, since the article (perhaps mistakenly) mentions three colors of stones.

name: Critical Point Fallujah, Iraq 1941
description:
From the Firefight Games website:

With Baghdad the target and the road network limited, the easiest and most practicable plan was to seize the Iron Bridge over the Euphrates River at Falluja. An elaborate plan was created and carried out without a loss. Iraqi resistance was non-existent. With the town in British hands, the attacking force was dispersed elsewhere. The British did not think the Iraqis would counterattack. On May 22, in the early morning, the Iraqi 6th Brigade\3rd Division (800 men) with CV33 tankettes attacked. Iraqi artillery pulverized the two British companies holding the town in their trenches surrounding it. They were forced to pull back into the town. The three Iraqi battalions with tanks were as good as the British by accounts in combat but for one thing: steady morale. From 3 a.m. to 10 a.m., the two British companies held but were nearing their end in this urban type combat. Luckily, the Luftwaffe had failed to support this attack (although they did the following day!). At 10 a.m., the tables began to turn when two additional British companies arrived. The battle did not stop but raged onward until the Iraqis gave up at 6 p.m. The road to Baghdad was now open. It had been a near thing!

Game components:
1 11x17 inch map
160 counters,
Player aids

Scale:
company\platoon
1 hex = 100 yds
1 turn = 1.5 hours for a total of 11 turns.

name: Letter of Marque and Reprisal
description:
'Letter of Marque and Reprisal' is a set of rules allowing you to wargame small-scale naval engagements in the 'Age of Sail', or thereabouts.It was written to recreate engagements between the likes of Francois l'Ollonois, Edward "Blackbeard" Teach and their opponents.

'Small-scale' means that usually, a player will captain a single vessel, not a squadron or fleet. It works fine for engagements of up to four vessels a side (thus allowing 8 players to participate), beyond that things tend to drag a bit.
'Small-scale' at the moment also implies that the ships captained are smallish merchants, pirates and navy ships. The rules will be expanded to include line-of-battle ships later on.
The game is not tied to a particular line of models or a scale. You can play with anything from 1/1.200th to 1/300th scale ship models.
The rules sport a fair amount of complexity in order to keep managing a single ship a tactical challenge. Still, the rules essentially aim at gaming, not simulation.

Lastly, 'LoMaR' is a hobby project which its author would like to share.
That is to say: any feedback on the game or new input is welcome, be that criticism of the rules, adding new ship sheets, expanding the rules to different periods or styles of naval warfare (the galleys of Lepanto) or writing scenarios.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bad Blood: Horror Rules Mini-Game #2
description:
From the publisher:

The vampires have always been, lurking quietly in the darkened streets, killing only when they had to, their existence a carefully guarded secret. Then something happened... no one knows exactly what, but now the bloodsuckers have lost control and unleashed their wrath on the defenseless and terrified city. So grab your stakes and holy water and get ready for some good old-fashioned vampire-hunting... Horror Rules style!
Horror Rules Mini-Games provide all the fun and mayhem of Horror Rules without the rule crunching! Included in this Mini-Game is everything you need to play, including Paper Forge Minis, maps, weapons and item counters and more - just print and go! Use the more than 60 Horror Markers to simulate the challenges, dangers, perils and scares of the vampire-infested urban jungle, and change the mix to make a different game every time. You pick the size, scope, number of pieces and even the goal of each game. The Horror Rules Mini-Game system is flexible and fully customizable, great for veteran gamers, kids, families, parties or as a way to introduce new players to the wonders of gaming. Play it solo or with others in cooperative or head-to-head play. Games take as little as 5 minutes and can easily be played during a coffee break or lunch time. With endless variations and Styles of Play, you can create whatever gaming environment you like, from a simple tabletop boardgame to a full-blown RPG!

name: Opposite Pairs
description:
In this game, you are trying to match puzzle like pieces. The only thing about them is that they are opposites. Wet/Dry and Day/Night are some of the opposites that are used in the game. There is really no winner/loser, since matching is not the main mechanic in the game.

Previously released as Kontrast.

name: Kampfgruppe Eins
description:
Tabletop Miniature Wargaming (ideal scale 20-25mm).
Whilst many rulesets (out of necessity) scale down companies and platoons to a mere shadow of their actual establishment, this game is based on the concept that each model on the tabletop represents a single combatant. As a result, basic tactical units such as squads or sections, or even individual fighters, can be given their own unique character.

This title includes a comprehensive background and further ideas for introductory scenarios based on actual events. It also incorporates comb binding which allows the book to be laid flat during games to allow easy access to the two 'ready reference' pages and consequently assist the flow of play.

Expanded by:


Kampfgruppe Zwei
Kampfgruppe Drei
Kampfgruppe Vier

name: Napoleon in Sunset, 1814
description:
Original game published in Command Magazine Japan #52 in 2003, together with Dynamo: Dunkirk, 1940.
Designed by Shigeru Hirano.

name: True Record of Nobunaga
description:
Oda Nobunaga continues to take administrative reform one after another in order to put an end to the civil war. On the other hand, Shogun Yoshiaki dreaming of the rebirth of the Ashikaga shogunate's power, planned the mobilization of anti-Nobunaga forces. Nobunaga was hit by a surprise attack led by Asai Nagamasa but succeeded in escaping to Kyoto. In 1570

True Record of Nobunaga is a simulation game that reproduces the conflict between Nobunaga Oda and the anti-Oda forces.
It is a revised version of "Nobunaga Kenji" which was published in the second issue of Double Charge magazine.


First edition: supplement of Japanese Wargame Magazine Double Charge #2.
Second edition republished in Command Magazine Japan #69 in 2006 (along with Hideyoshi's Greatest Defeat).

Second edition components:

A2 format map
70 counters
8 page rulebook

name: Kentucky Jones
description: This game is based on a television show from the period which starred Dennis Weaver (Chester of Gunsmoke fame). It is a spin the spinner and move game.

name: Straightaway
description: Players race die-cast 5 laps around an oval track. A standard D6 is used to determine for far your car moves. The game includes marbles that are used to mark off the lap count of the lead car.

name: The Detectives
description: Deduction game based on the ABC TV show "The Detectives" starring Robert Taylor. Players race around the board collecting clue's. A spinner determines the location of the various clues.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Money Maker
description: Money Maker, A game of free enterprise. Is a very monopoly like game that is used to market local businesses. It consists of a gameboard, 2 dice, 4 pawns, a rules booklet, money in four denominations, a pad of Business Ownership and Expansion Record sheets, and a set of risk cards. Rather than using houses and such to show ownership and improvement (as monopoly does) Branches are noted on the sheets. On the gameboard all of the businesses are representations of local businesses.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hell & Uncivil Disorder
description:
Hell & Uncivil Disorder is a set of miniature wargame rules for Brushfire Wars and "Magic" in the 20th Century (there is also a Science Fiction option because Jim Webster is "happily confident our descendants will be as incompetent as we are").
The rules are suitable for use with a variety of figure scales (including a 1/300 variant) with a ground scale of approximately 20 yards to the inch.
The rules are intended for conflicts where first world forces are fighting third world forces and hence treats technology as magic (as per the well know Arthur C Clarke quotation) but may be used for any modern conflict.
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Fortaleses
description:
Fortaleses (Fortress) is a push-your-luck dice game, for 2-5 players.

The players try to build the strongest fortress, using dice towers, and they can, also, attack the fortress of the rest of players.

This game wins the 5th Creation Game Contest in the Fira JocJoc in Tona, Catalonia, Spain in 2006.

name: Diamino Chinois
description:
Word game similar to Diamino, by the same publisher, except that it uses hexagonal tiles instead of square ones. Unlike Diamino, tiles do not have point values
Like Diamino, it has some tiles with a red logo or design on it.

name: The Threshold of Democracy: Athens in 403 B.C.
description:
The Threshold of Democracy: Athens in 403 B.C. is one of the first games in the Reacting to the Past game series originally created by Mark Carnes, history professor at Barnard College/Columbia University. These games are intended for undergraduate or graduate students led by an instructor (facilitator)

Participants are assigned roles with secret role sheets and secret victory objectives. The object of the game is to achieve the stated objective for each player.

The game is set in Athens soon after the tyrants installed by Sparta were overthrown. The game focuses upon the future of democracy in Athens. Participants are given a variety of roles: moderate democrats, radical democrats, oligarchs, Socratics and more.

Participants need read and refer to Plato's Republic (not included) and excerpts (included) from Thucydides, Xenophon, and other primary sources.

The game requires substantial reading, writing, and verbal debate.

Awards:
The Reacting to the Past series won the 2004 Hesburgh Award for innovative undergraduate education using gaming.

The American Historical Association awarded the 2006 William Gilbert Award to Mark C. Carnes for the best article on teaching history--focusing upon the Reacting to the Past games.

name: Robinetto
description:
A board game for children (6+ years).

From the publisher:

"Game of observation and speed.
Quick, hurry Mr. Plumber! Who will be the fastest to get the water working again ?"

name: Mimomirko
description:
A board game for children (5+ years).

From the publisher:

"It is unhelpful to bark when asking the way to the Mirko doghouse. It is better to be skillful in miming a roundabout, a slide, a baker or even Mirko flea... The most talented players to mime and guess will win."

name: Spitting Fire
description:
Spitting Fire is a pseudo-historical game of aerial combat, set during the turbulent years of World War II.

Between 1939 and 1945, nearly the entire globe became entangled in the most expansive and destructive conflict ever seen. Although responsible for unimaginable terror and tragedy, the war also gave birth to innovation and invention on an unprecedented scale.

With Spitting Fire, players can take control of the aircraft forged in this crucible of conflict, and battle each other in skies the world over! We should state at the outset that those who are aching for a historically-accurate, painstakingly-researched, richly-detailed simulation of World War II dogfights should probably look elsewhere. While such games can be exciting, they aren’t what we had in mind. However, if you want a fast-playing, fun game that gives a nod to history without getting bogged down in historical minutiae, then Spitting Fire is for you.

Spitting Fire is designed to be used with any scale from 1:700 to 1:72 (although larger scales will require a substantial playing area). The rulebook includes data cards for 25 of the most famous fighters from World War II, with others to be released soon!
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Cliff Hanger
description:
Cliff Hanger was one of Airfix's "Carry Case" games, intended to be portable fun!

In this game, players place protruding pegs through a wall set between them, and then hang their men from the pegs, so they cannot see each others pieces.

They then take turns to remove a peg, hoping to dislodge their opponent's men, while retaining theirs. The player with the most men still hanging when there is only one peg remaining wins!

name: Zing! Gift Card Edition
description:
Let the stories begin…..Zing! gives you a delicious set of words (with three difficulty levels). With those and a few of your own, you develop a sentence. You’ll score points for every Zing! word you use. Players take turns adding to your sentence until you have a story!

Can’t write? You’ll be surprised… Zing! brings you in and gets you creating, writing and laughing in a flash! Discover new ways of thinking. The outcome is, well, ZING!

And when the stories have been told (after a few twists and turns) the player with the most points wins!

This version is in a small travel tin.

name: Googolplex Junior
description:
Googolplex Junior plays the same way the Original Googolplex game does, but hand crafted for small players. The play is a bit quicker and more colorful. Measuring only 10 x 10 inches, a great "Take-a-long" game for hours of play.

Each player chooses a color game pawn and places that on "their" starting position on the outside corner. The colorful mix of tiles gets randomly placed back into the 4x4 matrix of the game board, and off we go! First player that gets their game pawn across the game board wins.

name: Short Chess
description:
Short Chess "The easy way for children to learn the game of Chess"

"A stimulating game for bright 4-12 year olds, and also a challenge for any adult who wants a quick game of chess."

Ray Keene OBE Chess Grandmaster, former British Champion and Chess Correspondent of The Times

name: Tower of Power
description: Tower of Power is an early stacking game which was invented in England. Today it is also known in France (called "Tours"; ie. "Towers"), Spain, the Netherlands ("Rupsenoorlog"; ie. "caterpillar war") and Germany. The second part of the move reminds of mancala.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: Domenica Sprint
description: Italian game box that featured combination games. It appeared in the late 1970's. The sports games included in the box (complete games, not simplified once) included a boxing, soccer cycling and car rally cross game. The racing games featured a spinner device instead of dice.

name: Hold to the Rod: Book of Mormon Edition
description:
Description from the box:

"No more humdrum Family Home Evenings or Sunday afternoons. Hold to the Rod is mind-boggling fun that brings families, friends, and youth groups together.
Players hum, draw, spell, unscramble, and even perform to advance their team to the "Tree of Life".
Every player gets a chance to showcase talent and knowledge. It may be a race to the "Tree of Life", but the fun is in the journey."

"Increase your gospel knowledge with topics like:
Book of Mormon Trivia
Hum a Hymn
Wild card
Draw or Drama
Word of Wisdom"

This game is a simple cross between "Celestial Pursuit" and "Cranium".
categories: Party Game, Puzzle, Religious, Trivia, Word Game

name: Time Blocks
description:
From the Publisher:

Time Blocks is a block stacking game that will surely challenge the whole family. It is fast paced and will summon your powers of shape and color recognition, not to mention building skills. Flip over a card, find the correct blocks and replicate the structure shown. But hurry... you only have a minute and some of the configurations are devilishly difficult to build. Younger children can play the game by duplication the pattern on the card flat on the table top. Game includes 28 hardwood colored blocks, 1 sand timer and a deck of 100 game cards."

Ages 7 to adult

Box has sticker on it stating "excellence in family issues - child's best toys - Child Magazine. (no year given)
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Paragon's New Twentieth Century Skirmish Rules
description:
A precis of the rule’s introduction.

These rules are intended for use with one infantry section (usually 10 men), in 54mm scale, per player, which attacks a small objective such as a machine gun bunker or defended house (Airfix Strongpoint). Start with the basic rules, and when you have mastered these add some or all of the more realistic advanced rules. You can use any scale, of course - half all distances for 25mm scale, and if you insist on fighting Stalingrad in a matchbox an the 10.30 from Paddington, divide distances by 10 and use 5mm figures! As is inevitable, this has escalated to whole platoons (often still with one player per section) with some support such as a medium machine gun team or man-pack flamethrower team per side. We've never bothered very much about a points system, though one is included in the appendices to these rules, except that men defending a strong position such as a farmhouse should be attacked by about twice their number. Favourite games include two units of 10 partisans each, ambushing a German staff car with escort of two motorcycle combinations and a section in a half track, and a British Recce unit consisting of a turret less Stuart tank, a Dingo scout car and a half-track with infantry section running into a German advanced defence unit in slit trenches with MMG's and Panzerfausts. The possibilities are enormous, and great variety can be achieved quite cheaply, using Britain’s or Airfix figures and vehicles, which are less prone to damage than Tamiya and other plastic models, though we use these too!

Each soldier must have the correct rank, weapons and equipment, a limited supply of ammunition (so that he can run out!) and is identified by a number on his base. This number ensures that each man stays with his correct unit - if he's more than 20cm. from it, he has deserted! Wounds are NOT bullet wounds - you don’t go anywhere with a bullet, in you, no matter WHAT John Wayne gets up to! Wounds restrict a man's fighting ability, and may eventually prevent him from fighting, though he may recover in time for a later round if you are fighting a campaign.

name: The Alamo
description:
Card game. Simulates the siege of the Alamo in 1836.

Players will have to make their own sets of cards.
The Texans and Mexicans have their own unique decks.

Instructions are included to be able to play solitaire.
categories: American West, Card Game, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Radio TMG: the music game
description:
A music trivia game with 2 CDs and an electronic gizmo to record who buzzes in first. There are also action rounds (mime playing the drums or sing a Paul Simon song) as well as "improvised trivia" - category plus first letter e.g. name a "band" starting with "S".

From the back of the box:

This exciting game has heaps of music on 2 CD's and provides hours of fun with electronic buzzers that you hit when you recognize the songs or the artist. The disc jockey on the CD's will play music cuts from the 60's to the 90's, pop hits, rock and roll or themes from movies and TV shows. When you think you know the name of the song or who the artist is, hit your buzzer and the electronic umpire will decide who got in first. Even if your trivial knowledge is not up to scratch, playing an action card gives you a chance to gain points by putting on a mini-performance for your friends to enjoy. When using the TMG Quiz cards you create thousands of questions and hours of fun calling for fast action on the buzzers and another chance to be a superstar.
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Real-time, Trivia

name: New World Disorder: Urban Combat in a Dark Future
description:
FIRST EDITION

Gangs of urban warriors battle each other, corporate mercenaries, mob hit-men, cannibals, and who-knows-what-else in this game of the fight for survival on the streets of the very near, very dystopian future.

New World Disorder has all the rules you'll need to play out character-driven scenarios in a world gone wrong, including: character creation and advancement, an extensive list of modern and near-future weapons and gear, several ready-to-play scenarios, and much more. Also contained in this 57-page document are 3 pages of character rosters, tokens, and templates.

Survival is no game, especially on the mean streets of the near future.
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction

name: Passion Throw
description: Passion throw is a sex game for two consenting adults. It uses a sheet with spaces printed on it. Each space has a foreplay command to follow. Players take turns tossing the foam die and moving their playing piece (a satin pillow) around the board. The player who reaches the last space on the board chooses the first lovemaking position for the two to engage in.

name: Super Deformed Gundam World
description:
This obscure Korean game is published by Jolly Game. Notice that Jolly Game is not related to Jolly Games of Wiz-war, at all.

The game is one of multiple series of games that was sold for 1,000 KRW, which is about one USD.

The game contained a few plastic SD Gundam figures, with very simplified typical war game rules.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Balance Cup Game
description:
The Balance Cup Game (Wing Tat Hang Kee Co. Ltd.) is a simple dexterity game using plastic cups shaped like martini glasses. 20 plastic cups in four colors (including one white cup) are arranged in a pyramid with the white cup at the top. Players roll a special six-sided die that has three sides showing a black cup, and the other three sides showing a dot that is either red, green or yellow. If it shows a colored dot, the player has to remove a cup of the corresponding color. If it shows a black cup, the player can remove a cup of any color. The player who causes the white cup to fall loses, and has to rebuild the pyramid for the next game.

The Glass Tower Game (Daiso) is a similar game with the same sort of components but the opposite objective - players roll the die and then stack cups according to the die roll. On a roll of 1 to 4, the player has to stack a cup of the corresponding colour - no action if there are no more cups of that colour. On a roll of 5, the player can stack a cup of any colour, and on a six, the player does not need to stack any cup). The player who puts the last cup on top of the stack wins. Four different structures can be made with the cups, to play the game.
publishers: Daiso (ダイソー), Wing Tat Hang Kee Co. Ltd.

name: Veja o Brasil
description: Brazil's weekly magazine "Veja" contains news of Brazil and the world. Veja o Brasil ("See Brazil") is a trivia game compiled from facts found in the magazine. Move your pieces around the board and answer questions from six categories. Contains 1800 questions on 300 cards. Game is in Portuguese.

name: Italia 90
description:
This game was born to simulate the 1990's Soccer World Championship in Italy.
It's a card management game in which you've to play against fictional teams or teams belonging to other players.
The team is composed by 3 cards (of the 6 everyone receive at the start of the game) representing the defensive zone, midfield and attack zone.
The game simulate the teams groups, semifinal and final match of the championship with event cards, money management, players management and so on.

name: Goods from Cape to Cairo
description:
Players are the proprietors of long distance haulage companies in Africa, competing for goods delivery contracts in a tough economic environment. The player with the most money after 6 turns wins the game.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack or a playing cards expansion (and 3 markers for each player).

name: It's a Weird, Weird Galaxy!
description:
It’s a Weird, Weird Galaxy! is a space race and resource management game. Each player, starting from their home world, flies their starship about the galaxy engaging in interstellar trade in order to earn enough Space Bucks to build a string of space stations stretching from their home world to the center of the galaxy. The first player to complete their seventh space station wins. However, nothing is that easy! Each space station cost more than the last one to build. Each space station also impedes the path of opposing starships. Finally, there is this weird space alien, affectionately known as “Phredd”, and looking vaguely like a camel the size of a small moon that randomly flies around spitting on stuff and generally balling up the works. But, hey! It’s a weird, weird galaxy!

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, designed for a standard piecepack and one expansion (plus 12 counters for each player).

name: Sheep
description:
The object of the game is to move all your sheep to their shepherd. A number of sheep-dogs on the board may block the sheep, making the shepherd's job much more difficult.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the playing card expansion.

name: Stacked Deck War
description:
For years Spades, Hearts, Diamonds and Clubs had the exclusive claim to the game commonly known as `War'. In the world of playing cards, all was well. One day Suns, along with Moons, Crowns and Arms decided they wanted to take the game of `War' for their own. The playing card clan grew angry at the piecepackian army. With all rational reasoning and compromises ignored, the two rivals soon decided to stack their decks and play the ultimate game of war, for rights of the game of `War'.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the playing cards expansion.

name: Wer War's?
description:
Use your skills of deduction to identify the person represented by your opponent. By excluding attributes of outward appearance using yes/no-questions you successively get an idea who the other player must be.

Whoever guesses the opponent's name correctly first, wins the game.

Includes the rules, two nearly indestructible plastic playing boards with 24 turnable face cards (so you don't have to remember the attributes already excluded), and a deck of 24 person cards.

Age: 6+

name: Word-O-Matic
description:
Word-O-Matic "The Competitive Word Building Game"

From the Box-

"Race Against Time...Develop More Words Than Your Opponents."

"Challenge Yourself...Challenge Others."

"Different Letter Combination With Every Spin of WORD-O-MATIC."

You pull the handle on the word-o-matic machine (requires 1 "C" battery) and the wheels start moving. You then hit the 5 buttons on the front of the word-o-matic to stop the wheels. You have until the sand timer runs out to make as many 4 - 7 letter words as you can.

name: Agilidade
description:
Agilidade ... a 3-in-row game.

Material: glass game board, black and white wood playing pieces - 7 per player.

White starts and, in turn, pieces are placed on any one of 5 spaces, including on other pieces.
The object is to get 3 same-color pieces in a row - horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

name: 21E
description: 21E is co-operative game of following the clues and finding the jewels. The game is played by deciphering the clues sent from Dr. Iverson. The E21 code uses symbols to represent syllables. Once the clue is decoded you are on to the next city and clue. As the game progresses variants are added to the 21E code to make harder for you and the thieves to decipher the clues. The game includes a Code Cracker card, a deck of Code Cards, one set of city clue cards, paper and pen, and a Mission Pack.

name: Zoom
description:
Your goal: Place four of your tokens in a perfect square at any position in the 6x6 inner board area.

Your tools: The aforementioned tokens and the movement of same.

In Zoom, each player has a number of tokens that start on the perimeter of a 6×6 playing area. On a turn, you can move one of your tokens along free positions of the perimeter area (not jumping over any tokens) from any reachable edge position of the board horizontally or vertically and you must continue movement in straight line inward, stopping whenever you choose; alternatively you move an own token along a straight line from inside the 6x6 playing area to another inner 6x6 board position; you may not jump over previously placed tokens, whether yours or the opponent's. The first player to create a perfect square of his own tokens wins.

name: Gods & Minions
description:
Welcome to Gods & Minions – the customizable card game of fantasy warfare

First of all: Gods & Minions is a card based tactical combat game, so one game represents one battle. You and your opponent each represent generals who command their troops. The troops are displayed using cards. Compared to a full wargame (like Warhammer), Gods & Minions is much lighter on the rules and compared to a customizable card game (like Legend of the five Rings), Gods & Minions focus is 100% on the battles (instead of kingdom building, diplomacy or intrigue).

Join the godswar in this action loaded, customizable and collectible card game. Assemble your army from a huge variety of nations and factions available. Collect and play gods, minions, enhance your troops with artefacts & equipment and unleash powerful spells, command mighty beasts, towering war-machines and unique personalities. Fight for dominance over a fantasy world broken by age old war of nations. Be part of a universe where almighty gods are pulling the strings behind from the scenes and decide between life and death as they see fit. Be prepared when this brand new fantasy wargame hits the shelves!

Files removed from BGG.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection

name: Baseball Tivitz
description:
Educational Math board game that uses checkers type movement. The playing pieces called a "Tivit" are 6 sided dice with each side having a symbol and numerical value.

The 2 players compete by moving their tivitz across a baseball diamond towards 16 ending locations. 7 ending locations are reserved for each player and 2 are available to both.

Each ending location has a mathematical operation(addition, subtraction, multiplication or division). A players score is the value of their tivit adjusted for the math operation for each tivit that finishes the game on an ending location.

The game includes 30 different paper boards with varying degrees of difficulty along with 6 different tivitz values allowing for 180 different game setups.

For ages 8 and up.

name: 1455: L'elefante e l'aquila
description:
In the year 1455, five lords are struggling for power in the middle of the Italian peninsula, and precisely in the area of the Adriatic coast:


Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta, Condottiero and Lord of Rimini and Fano
Federico II da Montefeltro, Condottiero and Lord of Urbino
Domenico Malatesta, brother of Sigismondo. Condottiero and Lord of Cesena
Alessandro Sforza (brother of Francesco Sforza), Lord of Pesaro
Giacomo Piccinino, Condottiero subsidized by Alfonso d’Aragona King of Naples (who hates Sigismondo), he is trying to achieve a state for himself at the expense of Sigismondo


This ziplock-bag wargame contains:

A 60*84 cm map, divided in areas (and not in hexagons)
16 objectives cards
Five counter sheets
Two sheets of coins
A rulebook
Five red and five blue dice


At the third turn of the game, every player randomly pick an objective card. The first player to reach the objective written on his/her card is the winner.

L’elefante e l’aquila means “the elephant and the eagle”. The elephant was a secondary banner of the Malatesta family, and the eagle was the banner of Montefeltro family.

Rules and cards are only in Italian.

name: Pharmacy
description:
From the publisher:

Pharmacy, the edgy board game that offers players a fun-filled "trip" around the game board with questions on legal and illegal drugs, alcohol and pop culture. When "Pharmacy" is played according to the directions, the objective is to earn points by answering the Trivia Card questions correctly and to be lucky enough to have good karma and earn extra points with Karma Cards. Also included in Pharmacy are ten different characters, with a male and female version of each. Choose your character wisely because you will experience the karma of your character. Characters include a guru with questionable ethics, a nicotine-addicted and sexually adventurous yuppie, a gambler, an actor, a crooked Politician, a farmer and, of course, a hippie.

name: Shuffles
description: Shuffles is a Table Top Shuffleboard game that was produced by Aurora. The game comes with a little man with a spring loaded arm that pushes shuffleboard disks on the game board in an attempt to score points exactly as one would in Real Shuffleboard.

name: Jackpot
description:
From the Press Release:

Jackpot! is a game of sequencing, logic and luck. The Jackpot game board features 9 squares covered by 8 bright fruit tiles -- leaving one blank space. Each player is dealt 6 cards showing fruit patterns. The object is to turn over one of your cards and create the pattern in as few moves as possible. A roll of the die determines the number of moves that you can make before going over “par” and having to add cards to your hand. Can you beat the odds? Create the pattern in fewer moves and discard cards. Be careful because your move may cause your opponent to spot a winning combination first and call out Jackpot! The first player to get rid of all his or her cards wins!

Jackpot! requires no reading skills and is a perfect multi-generational game for grandparents and parents to enjoy with the youngest members of the family. A complete set of rules and examples are enclosed.

name: I Spy Seeing Double
description:
From the Press Release:

With two card game levels to play, youngsters can See Doubles (Ages 5+) or enjoy Matching Fun (Ages 3+). Both challenges allow children of all ages to use their eyes to spot objects in the blink of an eye – or at least before the other players. For 2-4 players. No reading required. Game includes 48 cards, 1 action die, 4 picture dice.

name: A Guerra do Anel O Wargame
description:
This game simulates the famous battle of Minias Thirith in the 3rd Book of Lord of The Rings, by JRR Tolkien.
This is a FREE wargame available in Portuguese.

The sequence of the game will be divided into turns, with at total of 15 turns. Each turn corresponds to one day of real time. The events of this wargame take place from March 07 through March 21 of the Third Age.
Each turn will be divided in two stages and each stage corresponds with a single action of one of the armies.
The first stage is always the player who controls the Western Alliance. The Western Alliance consists of Gondor, Rohan, Dol Amroth, Dunedain, Lebennim, and Laledon. For the sake of simplicity, this player will be called GONDOR. The opposing player controls the forces of Sauron consisting of the armies from Mordor, Harad, and the men of the east called Easterlings. This player will be called MORDOR.

Each stage is divided in 3 sequential phases, representing the grouping of similar actions. The Preparation Phase, the Movement Phase, and the Combat Phase.

After 15 turns the player with the most points wins the game.

name: Operation Goodwood
description:
After the initial success in “Day”, weeks of hard combats in Normandy had been fought. The region was ideal for the defense, with bocages, forests and rough land. The great allied advantages was the aerial supremacy and the great mobility of their units, had been almost annulled for closed combats far from the short and in difficult land.
The weather also did not help, with rain being a constant aspect of the campaign. Despite of this, the allies had kept the pressure and, with great difficulty, they had expanded the head-of-beach. The vital port of Cherbourg was conquered on 29/06/44, but the important city of Caen, entrance of the French plain was still in enemy hands. The Germans, recognizing its importance, had positioned their best troops there. In end of July, the commander of 1º American Army, General Omar N. Bradley, conceived the “Operation Snake”, aiming to break the front of Normandy. However, to be a success, the German tanks would have that to be kept where they were - in the English sector. It felt on the English to keep them there, through a strong attack. General Montgomery, the commander ally, the British infantry that was depleted after weeks of constant combat. It had suffered the majority of the 40,000 decreases registered in 2º British Army until July middle. It needed to attack, but he would have that to make it with its armored divisions. However, the land of Normandy was total inadequate to maneuver such mass of tank, not to be in the opened land more in the east of the head-of-beach, between Caen and Vimont. There, such action promised better chances. In function of this, the biggest operation of tank of the front occidental person was planned: the “Goodwood Operation”.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: McDonald's Shake, Shake, Shake! Game
description:
This game is clearly advertising McDonalds.

The box and instructions are in English and French.

Components

Five dice with one color per side (blue, green, brown, yellow, orange, pink).

Six color shake cards (blue, green, brown, yellow, orange, pink).

Cardboard insert in box bottom with a recess for rolling and five numbered dice sized spaces.

4 straw markers

Game Play

One of the color cards is placed in the recess in the box bottom. Each player rolls three times to trying to get dice of the chosen color. As the chosen color is rolled those dice are are removed. The player who gets the most of a color gets the card. when all the cards are used the player with the most cards wins.

name: "I Spy" Mini-Board Card Game
description:
"I Spy" Mini Board Card Game by Ideal Toy Group, 1966, based on the NBC television series starring Robert Culp and Bill Cosby.

Object of the game is to be the first "Spy" to accomplish his mission by skillfully playing his cards.

The game is played in rounds. In a round each player plays a card. First card played in a round establishes the color suit for that round. Players must follow suit (if they have no card of that suit they must throw another but cannot win that round). Highest card of first suit played in a round wins that round.

Here is the order of cards from highest to lowest:

Ahead 4
Ahead 3
Ahead 2
Back 2
Ahead 1
Back 1

The joker always wins the round in which it is played but can only move 1 hole forward even if peg is on a target hole.

Game is won by the first player to move his peg from "Start" to "Finish".
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: All Star NBPA Basketball
description:
Players use figures with a manual lever to shoot or pass a Styrofoam ball with two colored magnets. Metallic board has 1960s-vintage all stars, each with a controlled area where they get the ball.

Players depicted are Jerry West, Lenny Wilkins, Bill Bridges, Elgin Baylor and Nate Thurmond for the West and Dave Bing, Oscar Robertson, Willis Reed, John Havlicek and Wilt Chamberlain for the East.

In addition to regular basketball, has rules for other shooting games such as Around the World.

name: Galaxy-D
description: This is the second print-and-play game by Big Little Games. The players take control of an alien race and battle the other players for control of an unexplored region of space. The board get build up from planet/empty tiles randomly drawn as the players explore it. Players own 3 alien technology cards each that give them special powers and that are replaced by new ones once used. The players own a limited amount of population units that are permanently removed as result of combats. Players attack each other by simply moving more population units onto a planet. The rules are very simple and fit on two small pages.
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame

name: The Holiday Game
description:
The Holiday Game is a Print and Play board game and is completely free for you to enjoy.

I should point out that I am from the UK where the word ‘Holiday’ refers to a vacation – this is not a game about Christmas or Thanks giving, it is a game about swimming pools, bungee jumps, cabaret bars, nightclubs, water sports and lots more…

Home Page: http://theholidaygame.mysite.orange.co.uk

name: Sip 'N Go Naked
description:
From the back of the box:

Sip 'n Go Naked is the wildest and most unpredictable party game ever invented! Fill your drink and bundle up. The winner in this game is the last person to remove all of their clothes! Roll the dice and make your way around the board. Do you Sip? Do you give out Sips? "Go Naked" cards help you avoid doing exactly that, but once you run out, the clothes come off! The longer you play, the more exciting this game gets!

name: The Captain America Game
description:
This is the rare 1966 version released by Milton Bradley. Players took the role of Captain American and Bucky trying to be the first to reach the secret hideout and thwart the evil plans of the Sky Spider! (Who was he???)

The game is simple spin and move. The only additional point in the mechanics of the game is that players could land on locations with friends of Cap's (Thor, Spider-Man, Marvel Girl, Wasp, Giant-Man and Iron Man) and get 'help' - (extra spaces). But if you landed on a villain's space, you lost spaces, or full turns.

The villains included some of the lesser characters of Marvel Comics of the day - and ironically, only one is a Captain America villain!

Characters drawn on the board game in full color include: Captain America, Bucky, The Mandarin and the Destroyer.

The villains are an eclectic lot: The Mandarin, Titanium Man, and The General (from Iron Man's story lines); Loki and the Destroyer (from Thor's pages of Journey into Mystery); Lucifer (who barely made an appearance in X-Men comics - issue 9?); the Molten Man (from Spider-Man); and then the only Captain America foe, Zemo. Of course, by this time in the comics, Zemo had already caused Bucky's death, and had in turn died in a battle with Cap! (It was an early Avenger's storyline.) But we were kids! What did we care!!!

This game is redeemed by the great art work on the board and the box. (Looks like the villains on the board might be by Don Heck working from Jack Kirby layouts, though the larger Cap and Bucky item might be vintage 1940's Kirby. The box cover certainly looks like 1960's Kirby. Since this came out at the same time as the first Marvel animated series, which were limited animations of actual comic panels, it is also likely these are art pieces simply lifted from existing art. (The Mandarin's piece is from the cover of one of his earliest appearances). This would explain the Heck artwork, since he was currently doing duty on most of the titles featuring these characters.)

The game originally came with a comic - one of the few early efforts at cross-over collectibles.

name: Ajax: The Game
description:
This game is about the dutch soccer club Ajax.

The board has the form of a soccer field and the players take control of two opposing soccer teams.
Both teams are made up of 1 keeper, 3 defenders, 4 mid-fielders and 3 attackers.

Duels between two soccer players are fought with cards. The winner of a duel advances the ball one line forward (for instance from a midfielder to an attacker).
First player to score 6 goals wins the game.

Two versions have been made. The first version dates from 1996, the second one from 2003. Both are out of print.

name: Maze of the Red Mage: A Solitaire Dungeon Adventure!
description:
…You awaken in a small shadowy chamber lit only by a fiery brazier…a deep voice from a shimmering red figure intones “You will plague me no longer! You have interfered in my plans for far too long. You claim to be a hero? Well then… let’s put you to the test! I have entombed you inside my maze…can you escape and prove yourself worthy of the title hero? If you can escape my maze before sunrise I shall leave your lands forever…

Maze of the Red Mage is a solitaire dungeon adventure game. Your goal is to defeat the Red Mage by escaping before the sunrises! If the Sun rises or you die in the maze, the Red Mage will rule your lands forever!

The dungeon is set up randomly face down using tiles. A blend of the classic PC games Minesweeper and Rogue Maze of the Red Mage includes: variable creatures, treasures, dungeon design and characters making every game different! It includes rules to level up your character as well, all in a quick re-playable lunchtime escape!
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Maze, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Aqua Tivitz
description:
Educational Math board game that uses checkers type movement. The playing pieces called a "Tivit" are 6 sided dice with each side having a symbol and numerical value.

The 2 players race to reach the 9 ending positions. Each position has a mathematical operation(addition, subtraction, multiplication or division, fractions, square roots, and percentages). A players score is the value of their tivit adjusted for the math operation.

The most advanced of the Tivitz series of games, this version adds square roots, fractions, decimals, and percentages.
The game includes 30 different paper boards with varying degrees of difficulty. For ages 8 and up.

name: Reading Between the Lines
description:
Publisher:
"The object of the game is to be the first player to reach the castle. That player must use the Magic Arrow to cross the castle moat. Each player must answer Reading Between the Lines questions along the way."

name: The Very Jelly Belly Game
description:
From the manufacturer:

The Very Jelly Belly Game is a deliciously fun game for children ages 4 and older. Players use the Jelly Belly character spinner to collect Jelly Belly cards in an attempt to be the first to fill their own collection board with beans of the same color. If they do, they win! It includes 4 Jelly Belly collecting boards, 20 big bean cards, 56 small bean cards and the Jelly belly Spinner.

For Ages 4 and up

name: McNaughty Trivia
description: This is an adult-themed game to taste the sexual knowledge of the participants. It is a fast, fun game with mainly esoteric questions; for example: "How many dating agencies were there in Britain at the start of 1994?" and "Who invented the contraceptive pill?". Players attempt to answer questions correctly from 3 possible answers to move around a scoreboard ahead of their opponents.
publishers: McNaughty Games, Napier Games, Paul Lamond Games Ltd

name: Word Wrangles
description:
The ideal family game for 2 to 4 players and also playable solo for hours and hours of fun.

A contest of both word and strategy where the object of the game is to create words and word structures before other players.

Suitable for players Ages 7 and up.

It allows players of varying abilities to be suitably challenged whilst playing the same game.

Usually played between 2 to 4 players, Word Wrangles can also be played solo. A game can take 10 minutes or go on for several hours.

name: Monopoly: Los Angeles
description: Monopoly edition using Los Angeles attractions in place of the normal street names. (Dodger Stadium and the Memorial Colisseum are Park Place and Boardwalk, for example)
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dial N Spell
description:
Made by Milton Bradley in 1961 for Ages 4 - 8.

Have fun. Dial each word letter by letter, arrow points to matching letter. Learn to spell 99 words!

Contents are: cardboard insert, spinner/dialer and extra cards (5 double sided).
publishers: Milton Bradley, Nathan, Otto Maier Verlag

name: Capture
description:
A magnetic travel game.

Made by Pressman in 1990 for 2 players Ages 7 and up.

OBJECT: Capture your opponents’ pieces or occupy one of his red circles to win.

Contents include: game board, 14 magnetic pieces, and the instructions.

name: Terminus V: The Armageddon Vortex
description:
From the publisher's website

Terminus V is an elaborate combination of actual and purely imaginary elements. It’s particularly hard to define where the “real” ends and the “fictional” begins. For those of you who follow military and scientific matters, you’re likely to spot where reality meets fiction-although in some cases, you may not be able to clearly distinguish between these boundaries. However, it really isn't important where the lines blur a bit. The fuzzy area where reality and fiction intermix is intentional. The real fun is in the game itself and what you can (or can’t) make of it to be successful in your mission and/or goals!

You can play T5 strictly as a miniatures game, a roleplaying game, or both simultaneously. As you will see, the Character Profile Log sheets can be filled out and set up to use either way, depending upon the amount of information you want to know, or need to have, about a character. The game can easily be converted into a dual miniatures/roleplaying game simply by choosing to play one character as yourself while the rest of your team (Strike Cell) is played normally as miniatures would be.

T5 is excellent for present-day combat simulation gaming too! The unique and versatile Com20 game system mechanics give you everything you need to game battles taking place today--with no modifications necessary! See the T5 Action! page for additional details.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Warhammer (Fifth Edition): Perilous Quest
description:
A campaign pack for 5th edition Warhammer: The Mass Combat Fantasy Roleplaying Game (1st Edition), Perilous Quest introduces a linked series of scenarios featuring the Bretonnian and Wood Elf armies.

Extra rules and special characters are introduced in the campaign pack. Box contents consist of the campaign rulebook; 4 battle scrolls for each player and card buildings used in the scenarios. The card buildings consist of tents and a tourney area plus a wagon for which four plastic wheels are included.
Also a Roster Pad for Warhammer is included.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: I Doubt It
description: The game is played with 5 dice that are marked like playing cards. They have values: 9, 10, J, Q, K, A. One player puts the dice in the box and shakes to randomize. The player then looks at the dice without revealing their value to the other players. The player who "rolled" states a value for the dice which may be true or false. The other players must decide if they want to believe or doubt the value of the dice.

name: In Other Words...
description:
"In Other Words...
is a fun-filled mix of recall, deduction, strategy and wit. Players advance around the board by solving paraphrased clues to well-known titles, common terms, and popular sayings."

This game bills itself as the "Original Game of Paraphrases".

In this game, players move around the board and solve puzzles in one of five categories
-Movies and Television
-Terms
-Quotes & Sayings
-Literature
-Cliches & Expressions
-Music

The puzzles are in the form of phrases that have to be translated into the actual saying on the card. For example, the movie "Away With the Breeze" is "Gone With the Wind", and the book "The Victor's Ring" is "The Winner's Circle".

name: 11 Kings
description:
A civilization game for 6+ players. The game is intended to be played with big groups and generally lasts around 7 hours.

This game was intended to be both flexible and streamlined. It's a civilization game with a modular hex board, a small number of technologies and relatively simple rules. Diplomacy is an important aspect of the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Star Fleet Cards
description:
This is non-collectible card game of spaceship combat set in the Star Trek universe. It is heavily inspired by the hex-and-counter game Star Fleet Battles. It is limited to a duel between two ships.

Each player gets a unique deck of cards that represents actions that their type of ship can make. Each turn players play cards based on how much energy their ship can still produce. At the point in the game when one players ship can no longer produce energy and therefore not play cards, that ship is considered defeated/destroyed and is considered the loser.

name: Fishy Business!
description:
From the box:
"A fabulously funny game of tropical fish trading!
Mr Plankton runs a crazy shop called Fishy Business. You've got to help him sell his weird and wonderful tropical fish, in particular the Outer Mongolian Mackerel, the Fantastic Finnish Flounder, the Brazilian Balloon Bloater and the Poisonous Tiger Trout.
Don't forget your fishing net!"

The winner is the player to get rid of all their cards first. Game play shares similarities with Uno, in that players play one card at a time from their hands, which must match either the same species as the previous card, or the same number. In addition, there are a selection of special cards which cause an opponent to pick up more fish from the pool, or which can be used to change species.

name: Off the Hook
description:
Off The Hook is a fun-filled, action-packed poker game that combines calculated chance with thought-provoking strategy.

Each player gets ten white chips, two colored dice, one green marker, and one blue marker. The starting player takes five "community" dice, and one green die in the closed Off the Hook box. The player then shakes the box, and opens it to look inside, and announce a poker hand based on what they see. The box is then passed to the next player, who can either call their bluff, accept the call by looking in the box an making a new (higher) call, or give up an "Off the Hook" marker to pass the box without penalty.

If a player gets caught bluffing, they lose the number of chips to the challenger equal to the number showing on the green die in the box. Otherwise, the challenger pays.

The person with the most chips wins (usually the last one left in the game).

Home Page: http://www.offthehookpoker.com/

name: Ma non i coperchi
description:
A Italian party games introduced from a famous showman of TV.
Better if played with many people.

name: Gunfight at Tombstone (Legends of the Far West)
description:
"Gunfight at Tombstone" uses 8 high quality, huge miniatures (54 mm) to recreate the famous wild west shooting, so its high cost.

Each player controls one side (lawmen or outlaw in an 8 player game) with four cowboys each.
Each gunmen has his own and unique stats (drawing, movement, health, and hidden dice=shooting skill) and special abilities (re-rolls, cancel other abilities, improved shooting ranges...). The game uses some of the liars dice poker mechanics, you have to make the best hand possible to win your opponent and to pass a minimum hand depending on distance and covers, otherwise the shoot is lost. Unlike poker you don´t bet money but the bullets of your revolver or rifle. Depending on the bullets bet you make more or less damage. Movement and covers, ranges, team play, wise special ability using, and bullet administration-reload are crucial tactics to win the game.

A fast game and very easy to learn if you can play poker. A very original and unusual playable diorama.
categories: American West, Bluffing, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: In the Name of Glory
description:
In The Name Of Glory (ITNOG) is a grand tactical rules set designed for players seeking a game of moderate complexity. The basic unit is a brigade, comprised of four stands. It uses a card activation system, with a few twists (see below). But players always has fewer cards than units (ain’t that always the way?). The game focuses more on morale than raw strength, and in fact units and combat effects are measured in morale points, rather than strength points. While units pretty much obey the player’s wishes, the card system makes for a very dynamic and unpredictable turn sequence.

List Of Ingredients

ITNOG comes as a 94 page book with a spiral binding and two player aid cards on card stock (despite what the back cover says, these are not laminated). There is a dash of color on the inside, with small pictures of beautifully painted 28 mm figures through out. The rules run 56 pages, followed by seven of optional rules. Also included are:

Counters to be copied onto card stock and cut out.
A chronology of the Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars
A list of the battles between 1792 and 1815
Army Lists with commander ratings
A small scenario the Battle of Arroyo de Molinos.
Players will need to make a variety of counters or markers to play the game, or else develop paper rosters if they prefer.

name: Marenko: The Phrase Game
description:
To accumulate the highest amount of Marenko Points by composing meaningful and correct sentences with the available cards.

520 special cards to compose sentences, together with 72 x sold vinyl "chips". Everybody rewards you whenever you form a good sentence. You also get rewards any time you expand somebody else's phrase.

name: Farm-opoly
description:
from the publishers:

Here's a property tradin' game for farmers or those who just think farmin' is cool! It's life down on the farm where players increase their profit by collecting Acres and trading them in for Big Red Barns. Full of country humor and fun farm facts, Farm-opoly is a celebration of an All-American way of life!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dien Bien Phu: Trenches in the Tropics
description: Dien Bien Phu: Trenches in the Tropics is a simple simulation of the battle of Dien Bien Phu (March 13 – May 7 1954). This decisive battle saw French elite troops (paratroopers of Bigeard and the Légion étrangère) defeated by the Vietminh led by General Vo Nguyen Giap. It put an end to the French domination over Indochina and was a great victory for the Vietnamese Communist party who would be seen, after this event, as the party who gave freedom to its own people. Dien Bien Phu: Trenches in the Tropics is a two-player war game. One player commands the Vietminh, while the other commands the French forces.

name: Globe Trotting
description: Very similar to Twister but with an educational slant. A spinner is used and children must put left or right hand, or left or right foot on the continent or ocean specified. Last player standing is the winner.

name: Whigs & Scalps
description:
Whigs & Scalps is a two-player grand strategic conflict simulation of the French & Indian War. The map represents an area stretching from the Gulf of Mexico to Northern Québec and from the Mississippi Valley to the Atlantic. The period covered goes from 1755 to 1760, each game turn representing a full year of real time.
Historically, despite some initial French victories, the British and Americans managed to conquer Nouvelle-France and effectively end French presence in Northern America.

name: Thermopylae
description:
This is a cardgame for 2 players set during the Thermopylae battle (480 BC).
One player represent Spartans and the other one Persians.
Each palyer has a dedicated deck with specific cards.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
If you chose to be the Spartans... draw cards and defend yourself because Persians are the only one who can attack.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play

name: Ships of the Line
description:
This is a cardgame for 2 player.
It's a war between ships of the period XV-XVII sec.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Every ship has values for: Ship, Ropes, Equipment.
Move your ship fast and be the first to hit down enemy ship.
To win you have to reduce one of the characteristic of opponent ship to 0.
categories: Card Game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Caribé
description:
Set in the Caribbean in 1590, Caribé is a game of pure strategy, permitting players to hide certain information in the form of stowaways on their ships, while striving to use their limited settlers with as much efficacy as possible. Each imperial power specializes in a different type of unit, each unit having different uses on the islands. Caribé allows the players to manipulate the turn order in order to take advantage of the transit times of their ships. To add yet more variety to the game, each island is of different worth to the different players.

Design Awards


Special Prize - Best Full-Length Game 2007 Hippodice Spieleautorenwettbewerb
Finalist 2006 Concours International de Créateurs de Jeux de Société
Finalist 2006 Premio Archimede

name: Take Off, Eh!
description:
Increase your political prestige (score points) by funding pork barrel projects, paying bribes and pushing your own agenda, especially in areas where the people will most appreciate what you're trying to do.

This game is a port of El Grande, and was an entry to the Good Portsmanship piecepack design contest in March 2007.

name: Barbie Miss Lively Livin
description:
In this game, players can play either Barbie or one of her 3 friends.

As they travel around the board, players collect charms for their bracelets. Once a player has collected 2 of each type of charm (there are 5 types), that player may enter the "Miss Lively Livin" pageant. The first to be crowned "Miss Lively Livin" is the winner.

Ages 8 - 12.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cazaurio (CCG)
description:
In this TCG, humans fight to capture the Dinosaurs that awoke of his millenarian lethargy and are putting the city in danger.

You must capture 4 Dinosaurs to be declared the winner. The exciting thing of Cazaurio is that no game is equal to the previous one. A game of Cazaurio, represents the fight of the man to survive against the powerful dinosaurs that have returned to populate the Earth. You control a group of dinosaur hunters called Cazaurios, which compete with the team of your opponent to demonstrate that they are the best ones hunting the old reptiles.

A deck of Cazaurio is composed with 30 card. You also have 5 dinosaur cards that are not mixed with the deck

There are 4 card types:
1. – Saurio (dinosaurs)
2. – Cazaurio (hunters)
3. – Equipment
4. - Adventure
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Collectible Components, Prehistoric
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jerusalem 70AD
description:
This is a cardgame for 2 players.
It's set during the Hebrew revolt in the Roman province of Judea.
Every player has a dedicated card set.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Draw, Reinforce, Fight and Retreat.
Be the smartest and most powerful in order to achieve victory during 8 different assaults.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Javelin
description:
This is a cardgame for 2+ players.
As you can imagine by the name of the game... you compete to throw the javelin as far as you can.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
Draw and play your cards. (every card has a value on it).
You can combine cards from different types (1 for each type)
- start
- run
- run in pose
- pose
- throw
you decide the sequence and the number of throws.
The winner is the one with the higher throw-total.

name: Grand Tour
description:
This is a cardgame for 2+ players.
The winner is the first to visit all 10 cities on the table.
Available for free download (http://www.webalice.it/alecrespi/html/warpspawn.html) or in the files section.
All you have to do is connect the cities with connection chits.
You can travel on every connection with a specific vehicle.
Play the relative vehicle card to travel on that connection.
Be the first to complete all the travel!
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Bees
description:
This is a board/dice game for 2 players.
Players use Bees (on a board of 13x13 squares) to catch more and more honey.
The good thing is that you can also steal honey from your opponent!
A lot of fun for children.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Jack the Ripper: The game you play before the game
description:
Jack the Ripper is an Engle Matrix Game about hunting down London's most famous mass murderer. The players each champion one of six characters: Jack the Ripper, The Inspector, Lady Coverup, Lord Brutal, Mr. Revenge and Pretty Nell (everyone's victim). Each character has conflicting goals which lead them to try to pin the murders on one another or try to capture or protect Jack. The game plays in a whirl wind of back stabbing.

Each turn players pick a question from the game board to answer. Another player judges how likely it is to happen. A roll is made and the action happens or doesn't. If it happens it becomes a fact. Facts add up to tell the story. Players can interrupt answers with counter-arguments that are resolved with a dice rolling contest. This is a beginner game that can be played by anyone. It is about a murderer though so there is plenty of violence.

The game consists of a 16x21 color laminated sheet that folds up into a 8x10.5 folio for storage. There is a separate laminated rules sheet that stores in the folio. The back side of the sheet has the front and back of the folio and an example of play. The game board side of the sheet has a game opening narrative, a cast of six characters (each with a picture and short written description) and a large picture with plot driving questions listed on it. The rules sheet includes all the rules needed to play including the "Argument Strength Table" that is used to judge how strong argument are.

The game is available in a PDF and paper version.

Chris Engle
Hamster Press = Engle Matrix Games
3-15-07

name: Dracula: The game to play before the game
description:
3-15-07

Dracula is an Engle Matrix Game about the salvation or destruction of Mina Harker. Six players champion Dracula, Renfield, the vampire Lucy, Jonathan Harker, Mina or Van Helsing. Each turn they pick a question from the game board and answer it. Another player judges how likely the answer is to happen and a die is rolled. Successful actions/arguments become fact. Facts build up to tell the story. Players can interrupt one another with counter arguments that are resolved by dice rolling contests. This is a beginner game that can be played by anyone. It is about vampires though so there is plenty of violence.

The game consists of a 16x21 color laminated sheet. It folds into an 8x10.5 folio for storage. There is a separate laminated rules sheet. The back side of the board has the front and back cover and an example of play. The game side of the board has a game opening blurb, a cast of six characters (each with a picture and short written description) and a large picture with plot driving questions listed on it. One question is the final question - which ends the game. The rules sheet includes all the rules of play including the "argument strength table" that players use to judge arguments with.

The game is available in a PDF and paper version.

Chris Engle
Hamster Press = Engle Matrix Games

7-21-09

This game now comes as a boxed board game with the map being a hard board that is varnished rather than laminated. It also comes with plastic tokens which are used to buy the right to make up the next action. It includes a single die so it can be played right out of the box (though extra dice are useful to have around). It is the same game just with better production qualities but I have to say that this is a hand crafted item so it is not slick like a game from China. It is more of an art product but is quite durable.

Chris Engle
hamsterpress.net

name: The Ogaden War: Ethiopia versus Somalia 1977-78
description:
The Ogaden war is one of the bloodiest wars ever fought in East Africa. This war starts on July 23, 1977 with an invasion of the Ogaden province of Ethiopia by Somalia. The Somalians quickly captured most of the Ogaden province but was defeated and thrown back to Somalia by a massive Soviet airlift of men and equipment and intervention by thousands of Cuban mechanized troops and large numbers of Soviet aircraft.

The war was important as not only did it show Soviet airlift and power projection capabilities but also proved dire for Somalia as it never recovered militarily from the war and led to the collapse of Somalia in the 90s which had consequences for the U.S.(Blackhawk Down) and Ethiopia(the current 2007 invasion) later.

The game uses a heavily modified Iraq 2003 system (by Tetsuya Nakamura)laced with random events, a simple but detailed and effective air system, chit pull for Ethiopian reinforcement(to show the chaotic Ethiopian military system at the time), Somali supply situation and air interdiction etc. etc.etc.

The game is 18 turns long(two weeks per turn). Battalion level for both sides, Squadrons for air units(F-5s, Mig-21s, Canberras etc.). 270 counters total...

name: Magic Treasure and Sunshine Game
description:
The Magic Treasure and Sunshine Game are, in fact, two games using the same colorful tiles.

In Magic Treasure, each player picks up one of the tiles that spirals toward the treasure. Depending on what the player takes, she may take more tiles, or possibly even lose tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end wins.

The Sunshine Game offers the players some choices: In turn, each player draws from her personal supply of face-down tiles, and then adds it to one of the eight rays of the sun. In doing so, she also narrates how that particular picture ties into the story so far. In this game, the first player to place all her tiles wins.

Selecta Spielzeug 3547

Ages 4 and up

name: Factors of Spice
description:
Factors of Spice is a Euro-hybrid game. Similar in theme to Goa with mechanics like Puerto Rico and El Grande but with a map, limited combat, some secret movement elements.

The time is the late 1500s and the domination of the Spice Trade is in the balance. Far from playing colonial powers, the initial countries sent Factors, or professional trader-agents, to live with native peoples, and manage their trade interests while the fleet returned home. These factors lead dangerous lives, and the success of the next fleets’ mission usually lay in their hands. The factors built warehouses, or factories, to house goods collected while fleets were gone, and they were under constant surveillance form the un-trusting locals. Whether you use brutally repressive means against locals like the Portuguese or Dutch, or more congenial methods like the English you must develop a strategy that lets you maximize your profit while minimizing your losses. Factors of Spice allows player the flavor of the spice race managing fleets, trading with natives, and vying for political influence in these far away tropical islands that changed the course of world history.

Players act as Portugal, Spain, Holland or England.

Each turn is simple:
1. Take 3 cards from Tier I Deck containing simple ships, crews, and characters.
2. Take 2 cards from Tier II containing advanced ships and characters
3. Buy a Special Card
4. Increase income
5. Buy an Influence Card (worth 2-4 VP at games end) but 1 is lost per attack!

3 Years-8 seasons (turns)-and the game is over!

Interesting Mechanics:
Players can have up to 5 distinct fleets on the board and may fission and fusion at will.
1. Players build a hand and "launch" a fleet of as many ships as they have. Fleets are secret until they land in the East Indies or are moved into by a separate fleet.
2. Resources "bloom" and then rot a few turns later, creating interesting timing problems.
3. Types of resources: harvest, mine, or delivered-different mechanism for each.
4. Value increases the longer a good has not been returned to Europe!
5. Diplomat Characters used in East Indies area control for VP at end of game. Seizing goods erases all diplomatic good will!
6. Interesting and simple interaction with natives
7. Variable event card played each turn changes weather and conditions in the East Indies.
8. Special bonus cards that add flavor and strategic options to the game.
9. Simple but interesting combat mechanism between fleets.
categories: Adventure, Bluffing, Economic, Nautical, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Quiz Game
description:
An easy to play quiz game which covers subjects in line with the National Curriculum.

Subjects are Maths, Science, English, Arts & Crafts, Geography & History.

Children compete by answering questions & performing forfeits to get to the end of the board.

A fun educational game with forfeits !
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wordplay
description: Wordplay consists of four different crossword puzzle blocks. Each player attempts to score the greater total of points by using a limited number of letters to fill the different blocks. Players alternate forming words in one puzzle block at a time, using the letters printed beneath that block and the available letters in reserve. As a letter is used, it is crossed out and cannot be used again.

name: The World Almanac for Kids Game
description: Challenge your brain power and knowledge with The World Almanac for Kids Game. The multiple choice questions are specifically written for kids, so they can learn while having fun! The questions span a wide range of topics, from animals to world history and everything in between. Contains 395 Question Cards. For 2 to 6 players. Ages 8 and up.

name: Invasão da Polônia
description:
Invasão da Polônia is an original introductory board-wargame, released in early 80´s in Brazil, from a small company called JOG. The games was quite simple, last just with 5 turns< The game had a small map and eighteen counters. The main idea of JOG was to introduce the hobby in Brazil, but by 1982, the company was broke and the JOG remains only in the memories of veteran wargamers. Polonia (or Invasion of Poland) was the first of a game series which included other wargames (France 1940, Barbarossa, Ardennes, etc), but there were errors in order of battle, etc.

But JOG with their wargames contributed to create the first generation of wargamers in Brazil, and now many of them recognize the great importance of this initiative.

name: GOAL Fussball-Schach
description:
Issued in Switzerland by Tip Verlag Basel (publisher of the Swiss sports magazine "Tip") on the occasion of the 1958 Soccer World Cup in Sweden.

The two teams consist each of 1 goalkeeper, 2 defenders and 8 normal players.

The game's name "Fussball-Schach" (= soccer chess) is not very adequate, although no dice are used in this game. Unlike chess, all 11 players move the same way. However, the goal keeper must stay in his goal and the 2 defenders cannot leave their own half of the field.

Movements can be done as far as wanted and movements with 2 players in one turn are also possible. There are some rules included, which preclude having the ball totally surrounded by players. The most unusual (and surprisingly simple) of these rules is the rule that the ball always moves 1 space further than a player.

name: MIG Alley Ace
description:
Early Jet Air Combat.

MiG Alley Ace is a quick and easy jet air combat game, it is meant to cover air combat from 1945 to the start of the missile age. The game is based on Avalon Hill’s Mustangs game. MiG Alley Ace was created with a hex-mat and miniatures in mind, but could be played a regular hex-map with counters. A hex-map and counter-sheet have been included with these rules. You will have to mount and cut out the counters yourself.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Rek
description: Rek is a traditional game of Cambodia played on an 8x8 board. Each side has a king and 15 men, each of which moves as the rook in international chess. The object of the game is to capture the opposing king. There are two ways to capture: 1) move so as to immobilize one or more enemy men; 2) move between two enemy men that are on an orthogonal line and are separated from each other by a single square.

name: Picco Camillo
description:
Camillo and his 11 friends love parties and are keen to take part in whatever is going on.

But they never come without invitation: the coloured faces on the spinning top show which friend may come. But watch out: some symbols on the top bring unexpected surprises with them, making the game exciting to the very end! Let Camillo and his friends bring a real party mood into your playroom.

—description from the publisher

name: Political Capital: The Economist board game
description:
A pull-out game from the Christmas 1998 issue of The Economist magazine.

Each player represents the leader of a country. Every leader wants to stay in power for longer than any of his peers--that's what it takes to win. To achieve this you need to manage your political-capital points.
