The to and fro of normal political life will eat into your capital--but good judgment, good luck and well timed elections can replenish it.

name: Sport Dice: Cricket
description:
Simple dice game simulating a cricket match.
The game comes with two dice, a sand timer, counters, a pencil and a score pad.
Other games in the series: Golf, Tennis and Soccer

name: Eye-Cons
description:
From the bottom of the box:

Don't let your "eyes be conned"!

Match the most "icon" tiles by removing them from the tray in 60 seconds...and win!

Each player takes turns matching the tiles. Set the 60-second timer and GO! Pull exact matching tiles from the specially designed box tray using your "magic" suction wand as fast as you can. But be careful--only exact matches count!

Players count their tiles--the most matches win.

EYE-CONS is also designed for solitaire or team play, and is always great for the whole family.

name: The Time Machine
description:
Travel through time in the Time Machine exciting Action Game. Move your pawns through four different tracks representing the 18th, 19th, 20th, and 21st centuries. Land on green spaces to collect Time Boost, Achievement, Great Leaders, Invention, Peace, and Science cards while avoid red spaces, which give Disaster, War, and Time Reversal cards. The game utilizes a (30 Day guaranteed) Action Spinner, allowing you to move from 1-5 spaces in each of the different century tracks on the game board. In order to win, you need to be the first player to collect three I.E. Cards from three different decks.

Ages 7 and up

Listed in American Games, #4227a. 1963, Board game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Field of Honour
description:
This is a simple two player card game that is an abstract depiction of two armies facing each other on the battlefield. It can either be played as a simple two player card game, or as a sub-game to a more complex wargame – say a campaign where you wish to resolve minor battles without resorting to setting
out model soldiers.

Each game takes a couple of minutes, and only requires a standard pack of playing cards (with jokers).

name: Spacey Gamey
description:
From the box:

Spacey Game is a revolutionary new game that puts simplicity back into miniatures gaming. The fast paced action game lets you create your own ship and then battle with other ships designed by friends. To the Victor Go the Spoils and if your ship wins it will grow stronger to play again.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: Hello!
description:
Based on the UK gossip mag "Hello!"

The greater your celebrity IQ the better chance you have of winning - the multiple choice answers give everyone an opportunity to score. Each player gets the chance to answer every question so there's no waiting around for your turn. Guess when events happened to get bonus points to fast track your victory. Easy scoring system means there's no need to keep note of the scores. Over 1500 questions for hours of game play with new questions every time.

Based totally on celebrity news from HELLO! magazine.

name: Zixiz
description:
From the back of the box:

Six stacks of tokens, six to a stack. Six Dice. Zixiz

Roll the dice to capture opponents' tokens. But be careful, the tokens aren't the only things at risk in Zixiz. If your attack goes badly, precious dice could fall into enemy hands.

Every turn, a new decision. Will you dare a bold attack, or lie back, hoping to outlast? Will you attempt to end the Zixiz round while you hold a small advantage, or will you take chances to grab lasting power?

Dominance comes quickly in Zixiz, and just as quickly slips away. The game is truly never over until the last die is cast.

Zixiz is one great game. But that doesn't mean it has to be the same great game every time. Included are suggestions for "house rules." Tweak play to make the game faster, riskier, longer, more strategic, higher scoring...the possibilities are nearly endless.

Add more sets to add more players.

name: Nassauer
description:
Players are one of four people living in "Buddlbrunn". The beer bottles are empty and you walk through the village to exchange them against full ones in the taverns or directly at the brewery.

If you meet one of your opponents, you have a drink, so both players lose one of their full bottles.

There are also two neutral "Nassauer", (German expression for a "scrounger"), and if a player meets one of him, he has to have a drink with that, too.

Aim is, to get as many full bottles at home as possible, which is easier late in the game, when you can just slip through empty taverns (=no full bottles anymore) and shorten your ways.

The board representing "Buddlbrunn" has some similarities to the "Petri-Netz", as do the other games of Helmut Dressler, "Play Net" and "Glebdo".

Some people shall have played this with real bottles and real drinking ...

Although it´s quite an old game and very rare, it`s still available directly from the designer (April 2007)
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Outwit
description:
From Box Back:

"Two players can take part in the game the object of which is to be the first to complete the puzzle. Outwit is a fast, challenging game where the perception, imagination and intelligence of each player is tested.

"The box contains 2 plastic boards, 16 big plastic pieces of various geometrical shapes, 4 rectangular pieces and 12 small square pieces.

"Each player attempts to solve the puzzle by trying to fit a chosen set of geometrical shapes on to his/her board without moving any of the existing pieces placed by their opponent.

"The winner is the first person to correctly fill all the gaps with the geometrical shapes."

name: Curling Knock Out
description: This is a curling game which you can play on any flat surface, and it takes just seconds to set up. It's a dexterity game that needs a very good feel so you don't push the stones too far. A sociable and entertaining game which includes competitive elements.

name: Hector Heathcote
description: This children's game for Ages 7 - 12 was based upon a Saturday morning NBC cartoon show. The game includes four Hector playing pieces and a Cannon-type bowling device.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lancer
description:
This game is based upon the 1968-1970 CBS western television series named Lancer, a darker version of the more successful television show Bonanza.

Some of the accessories include a game board, dice, four cardboard playing figures with plastic bases, a plastic "bad man" figure, a deck of reward cards, and a pack of reward money.
categories: American West, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ppolf
description: This is an adaptation of the game disc golf as a tabletop coin Flicking Game for the piecepack. It provides for a randomly set up course and does not require a library of pre-designed holes. It also allows for solitaire play. This game plays best on a smooth seamless surface table that allows flicked coins to easily slide the length of the table. The game requires a table of at least 8 square feet in area, but the shape of the table doesn't matter.

name: Kampen om Riket
description:
This is a game of political intrigue during medieval times in Sweden. The goal is to become crowned king of the realm.

The players take on the role of a nobleman who wants to become king.

Assassinations, crusades, black death, war, espionage and resource management is all part of this game.

Home Page: http://www.kampenomriket.se
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Simulation, Trading, Variable Phase Order, Voting

name: Quizzical Questions by Professor Quiz
description:
Extrapolated from a HSHGHP description:

This game (used as a promotional tool by Noxema) is based on a radio show of the time (Professor Quiz). The game features a large booklet with 600 questions and answers. A drab green outside box hid a beautiful gameboard inside, featuring a large wheel which would turn to reveal new questions and answers. At least two editions were produced.
Included with any purchase of a fifty cent jar of Noxzema was a promotion for this Jaymar box game.

name: The Thief Of Bagdad
description: Actually a spin and move game. Simple game from the 1940's. Game includes spinner with numbers 1 thru 6, 4 colored markers and 4 protection squares which could be used by your piece to avoid going to jail.

name: Body Talk
description:
Body Talk is a charades game. A phrase to be guessed is drawn from one of over 700 difficulty rated cards. One player attempts to describe this phrase by pointing to icons on a board. The main twist here, and the reason the game is called Body Talk, is that both the game board with the icons and the pointer used are worn by the players. The gameboard is in the form of an icon-covered apron and the pointer is a bib with a pipe-cleaner protruding from it.

Small plastic clothespins indicate the scores or positions of the players and also indicate by color the difficulty rating of the phrase to be guessed.

name: Ten Pins
description: Table top bowling game. Game comes with 10 wooden pins that measure approximately 4 1/2" tall & 3 wooden balls. The pins are vividly colored. Object of course is to knock down the most pins.

name: Tally Hi
description: Object of this game is to reach a target sum exactly or to force an opponent over. Two dice are rolled and then 20 is added to that sum. That total becomes the target score. The game has a sheet with numbers on them. (1,2,3,4 repeated 4 times) Object is, on your turn to cover a number in an attempt to reach the Target score exactly. Players alternate covering numbers until either you cover a number that exactly hits the target score or you cover a number that forces your opponent go over the total because all he has left are number higher than what is needed. He then is forced to go over and you win.

name: War Cry
description:
These miniatures rules for the Ancient and Medieval periods were first published in 1978 as "War Cry and Battle Lust." The Second edition in 1981 (now called simply "War Cry") featured poster-sized wall charts printed with the combat tables and terrain effects charts.

Second edition War Cry seems to have been the only product ever published in the Judges Guild's "Emperor Series."

name: Bewitched Card Game
description:
This is a fast paced 'print and play' card game based around the hit classic TV show Bewitched. Samantha the witch married mortal Darrin much to the dismay of her family. You must try to make their marriage succeed and stop Samantha’s family from interfering and transforming Darrin in to all manner of things including a chimp, a little boy and even a fish!

Bewitched is a copyrighted property. This is an unauthorized, unofficial game produced merely for the entertainment of fans and is non-profit making.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play

name: Amigos
description: Playing Amigos helps you to get to know your friends even better. During each round a player takes a card from one of the three piles (Action, Fantasy or Psycho pile) and reads the question on the card to one of the other players who has to answer this question. The other players have to judge the answer. You don't have to tell the truth when you give the answer, the only thing that matters is that the others believe it. He who scores best in this part of the game will end up as the winner.

name: Tracks: The Unique Railroad Quiz Game
description:
A trivia game about railroads. Players roll a die marked with the letters T, R, A, C, K, and S and answer questions in the corresponding categories: T=Early Railroad History, R=Lingo, A=Famous Names and Places, C=Technical Data and Reporting Marks, K=Passenger Trains and Logos, S=Pot-Pourri (sic).

Correct answers are worth 5 points. Whether a correct answer is made or not, a player's turn is over after they answer.
The game can end one of two ways. First, if a player can roll the letters in the same sequence as the title on their turns (and successfully answer the corresponding questions), they win the game upon the completion of answering the last question. Since this will prove to be rather rare, the first player to reach 50 points wins.

The game questions can also be used with Trivial Pursuit or other trivia games.

The game's box includes the aforementioned die, 500 cards with 3,000 questions (500 from each category), rules, a category summary sheet and a surprisingly large amount of information on the cover artist (in spite of the game including no information on the actual designer of the game).

name: ESPN 21st Century Trivia
description:
"Trifecta…you betcha'!" ESPN 21st Century Trivia brings your favorite sports indoors with 21st Century sports trivia questions and fast-action game play including Chalk Talk and Instant Replay challenges to get your head thinking and your heart pumping.

"He shoots…he scores!" Beat the shot clock as you battle your opponents, race around the board and win the game. "You…could…go…all…the…way" by answering 1,000 questions about your favorite sports like football, skateboarding, BMX racing, baseball, college and more!

Get your adrenaline rush by picking a "Chalk Talk" card and sketch sports terms like "Kiss the glass", "Snow cone" or "Half pipe"; or pick an "Instant Replay" card and act out "Hail Mary", "No look pass" or "SportsCenter". This game's "got more flavor than Kool-Aid and cocoa!" "Boo-yah!"

Game includes 1,000 trivia questions, 150 "Talk Chalk" and "Instant Replay" challenges, stopwatch, game board and 4 movers.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports, Trivia

name: Sic Bo
description:
Sic bo, also known as tai sai, dai siu, big and small or hi-lo, is an unequal game of chance played with three dice, and of ancient Chinese origin. Grand hazard and chuck-a-luck are variants, and of English origin. The literal meanings of sic bo, tai sai and dai siu are dice pair or dice bowl, lucky dice and big small respectively.

Sic bo is a casino game, popular in Asia and widely played (as dai siu) in casinos in Macau. It is played in the Philippines as hi-lo. It was introduced into the USA by Chinese immigrants in the early 20th century, and can now be found in most American casinos. Since 13 May 2002, it can be played legally in licensed casinos in the United Kingdom.

name: Ngau
description:
The name means 'Ox' in Cantonese. It is a card game originating in Malaysia, played both casually and as a gambling game. The game uses a standard deck of 52 cards.

Players are dealt 5 cards each, and players try to get the better hand. A hand is constructed when 3 cards form points that is a multiple of 10. This constitutes an 'Ox'. The remaining 2 cards show how powerful is the 'Ox'. The power is determined as the remainder of the sum of the 2 cards, divided by ten.

When a player is not able to form an 'Ox' with any 3 cards, then he is not eligible to score any points in the round.

name: Generationen
description:
"Generations" premiered at Essen 2000. A party game, its publisher describes it as follows:

Are eating breakfast for hours, wearing large earrings, constant noshing, brown from the tanning booths, hanging out at taverns, or sex in the dark typical of golden oldies, cool teens or busy midlifers?

Over 200 statements, situations and behaviors about the generations demand your vote. What do the generations dream about? Who are their models and idols? Over 100 possible life-styles, desires and trends are available for your personal selection.

name: Super Model
description:
A Brazilian Game designed to Top Models wanna be. Translation from the box:

"Super Model: The Top Models Game
The life of a Top Model is full of glamour, dreams and fantasy... sometimes, it even resembles a fairytale. The Super Model game shows a little of the backstage of this very exclusive world, in a very god way, relaxed, super-fun and with a lot of charm. You will feel how is to be a real top and make lots, lots of money and will discover some hints that can help you to "Get It" in the real life! Besides all of this, the game is recommended by Ana Hickmann, one of the Brazil and World's most famous Top Models."

It shows a model life in three stages, each different from the previous, and the objective is to be the richest model after a month being a Top Model.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Role Playing

name: Twisted Pairs
description:
* The letter-acting pair spin the spinner to select a phrase category, and select a card from either the pre-1990s or post-1990s card set.
* The two letter actors move their bodies together to shape each letter individually to spell out the entire phrase.
* All other players secretly guess each letter being acted, and write the letters on their word sheets.
* When the first player in the audience correctly guesses the entire phrase being spelled, he or she yells it out.
* The first player to guess the phrase correctly wins a point; the two letter-acting players win points.
* Bonus points are earned for being the first player to yell out the bonus answer on the back of the card:
o the name of the actor who played the famous character
o the name of the character who said the famous quote
o the artist of the song title
o the title of the song the song lyric is from
* The first player to score 10 points wins .
* The Trivia Question category has a little twist - the letter-acting players must spell out the answer to the trivia question without discussing what the answer is! There is no bonus point for the Trivia Question category.

name: Renaissance Raiders
description: Card driven, hex based miniatures rules for Border Reivers and the Wars of Religion. The rules area event cards and combat is resolved either by traditional six sided dice or by using the sticker templates provided to create a set of special dice.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Dynamiki
description:
Two states have declared war against each other. You are appointed the Supreme Commander of one of the states. Your forces: two armored, two mechanized, two airborne and five infantry divisions. How will you save your country?

Age-old strategy and the principles and weapons of modern warfare are brought together in the exciting game of Dynamiki. Based on the ancient Chinese game of Hsiangchi, Dynamiki reflects the concepts of some of history's most brilliant strategists. Match your wits against your opponent's but be prepared: tricks, twists and surprises await you at every turn.

Dynamiki is a modernized version of the age-old Chinese game of Hsiangchi whose original form is believed to be the world's earliest precursor of chess. Historical documents showed that it existed in China as early as 2400 years ago.

The pieces are: the Headquarters (building), the Capital Garrison (guard shack), Periphral Garrison (pillbox), Armored Force (tank), Motorized Infantry (gun jeep), the Airborne (helicopter), and the Infantry (soldier on foot).

Dynamiki also contains two other fast-paced, amusing Chinese games: Anki and Dakitzi, offering you a wide variety of game playing pleasure.

Anki - Combines skill and chance in an exciting and unpredictable contest of elimination.

Dakitzi - Somewhat like poker, but is more flexible and tricky, and moves much more faster.

name: Gemüsereis
description:
"Gemüsereis" (vegetable rice) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these figures: 1 tomato, 1 onion, 1 paprika, 1 mushroom and 1 corncob. The first 4 are the normal fruit figures, while the corncob is used to determine the movements.

The board has 4 fruit spaces, 6 cooking pot spaces and 10 movement spaces. Each of the 6 cooking pot spaces shows 4 fields, 2 empty ones and 2 showing one of the 4 normal fruit figures.

Winner of the game is the player who can fill one of the 6 cooking spot with the missing 2 fruits.

name: Kochtopf-Spiel
description:
The "Kochtopf-Spiel" (=cooking pot game) was included as "Spiel im Heft" (game in the zine) in Spielbox 6/87, where 3 games were published, that could be played with special miniature fruit figures.

This game needs 5 of these fruit figures: 1 tomato, 1 paprika, 1 onion, 1 mushroom and as special figure 1 corncob.

The board shows 5x5 spaces, where five 3x3 areas are specially marked. Each area is reserved for one playing figure, that is each figure can only move within its area.
The four 3x3 areas in the corners are reserved for the 4 normal playing figures, the area in the middle is the corncob's one.

Each player has a set of 8 cards: 4 showing a fruit figure and 4 are numbered from 1-4. These cards are used to move the playing pieces, but a move is always put together from 2 cards from 2 different players!

Object of the game is to move 3 of the 4 normal figures in the centre area and get the corncob to one of the corners of his area. The player who sits nearest to that corner is the winner of the game.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Critical Acclaim: The Acting Game
description:
Critical Acclaim - The Acting Game is essentially a game of fun designed to allow you to lose your inhibitions while revealing those acting talents that have been lying dormant perhaps for years.

The aim of the game is to be the first to collect a predetermined number of points. These are collected as players move around the board performing tasks that are rated for acting excellence by the other players. The highest rating that can be given to the performance is worthy of "Critical Acclaim".
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing, Voting

name: Sports Yesteryear
description:
The object of Sports Yesteryear is to accumulate 100 points to your credit and have no cards left in your hand.
Players roll dice and move around a board answering trivia questions in the following categories: Baseball, Football, Mixed bag and Terminology. Each card has a point value and each correct answer adds that amount to your over all score. Each incorrect answer deducts that amount from your overall score.

From the box: "The Number One Sports Trivia Game In America"

name: Traverse
description: Traverse is a word-finding puzzle game played on a 4x4 grid, similar to Boggle, but it uses 16 Scrabble-like tiles instead of d6 lettered dice.

name: Jungle!
description:
Get into the heart of the adventure, clearing a path through the dense vegetation with our machetes, in search of lost trails that lead us to the legendary temple.
Choose one of the 6 explorers, each with his own peculiarities, and challenge the dangers of the wild jungle and the dark conspiratorial plot of the most fearsome secret criminal organization in the world: the G.H.O.S.T.!
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Globe-Trotters
description: Object of the game is be the first player to visit three sites on each continent selected for the game, then return home free of debt. Players roll to determine the mode of travel they must use for their turn, then use a range finder to tell how much it will cost to travel to a destination served by that mode of travel. Players must travel if possible (unless they are on a Point of Entry space trying for a reward), and may go into debt while traveling. Reward spaces are scattered on the board to help players gain back money, and thus get out of debt.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Educational, Nautical, Trains, Travel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Race, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Take That, Variable Set-up
publishers: P. M. Mills Co., Selchow & Righter

name: Bowlem
description:
Bowlem The parlor bowling game. The scoring for this game is exactly the same as regular bowling. (Although given the rules, the game is actually more like CANDLEPIN Bowling, a form of bowling prevalent in the North East portion of the country - especially in Massachusetts and New Hampshire and Maine - In Candlepin Bowling the ball is much smaller (ball has no holes and fits in the palm of your hand) and you get 3 tries to knock all the pins down. The pins that are knocked down but remain on the deck stay there during the remainder of the frame. (Those pins are called deadwood and can be used to deflect the ball to help knock down the remaining pins to help you make spares.)

There are ten dice representing the pins, each having a spot on some sides of the dice. Each player has three shakes. Rolling 10 spots with one roll is a strike. You put aside dice that have spots on them and then re-roll the rest. if you get spots on the rest of the dice you make a spare. You then have a third roll if you make all ten spots with the third roll you score a 10.

name: Take the Cake
description:
From the box: Collect the most slices to form scrumptious layer cakes. A game for 2-4 players : Ages 5 & Up.

Contents: 52 Unique triangular shaped "cake slice" cards and 8 missing slice cards. Rules for two games Take the Cake and Piece of Cake.

French and English Rule booklet

Players play cake slice cards from their hand to start and/or complete full cakes (6 slices). The player with the most complete cakes at the end of the game wins.

name: Longstreet's Disaster
description:
Longstreet's Disaster is a simple, solitaire game depicting Pickett's Charge during the Battle of Gettysburg on July 3, 1863. The player controls the Confederate (CSA) side, while the game system plays the Union (US) side.

Published in Panzer Digest #1. Longstreet's Disaster is a DTP game.

name: Words
description:
In this game, players place bets on whether the current player is able to find a word in the specific topic using all of the given letters. Each player may bet between one and three chips on either yes or no. (The current player bets last and must bet yes).

The spinner is used to determine how many letters is picked each time.

The first player to acquire all chips in his or her color wins.

Contents:

Game board
110 topic cards
44 letter cards
Six yes cards
Six no cards
144 chips in six colors
One spinner
One hour glass

name: Art Lotto
description: The game contains five unique collection boards (each with nine reproduced artworks from the National Gallery's collection) and forty-five picture cards- one match for each image from the collection boards. The backs of each card are identically labeled. The game is played like memory- but the objective is to be the first person to collect all the images from your own collection board.

name: The Millionaire Game
description:
From the rules: America's industrial might and business world have produced large numbers of successful people - people, who, through their creative genius and ability to plan, have amassed vast fortunes.

As you play the Millionaire (TM) game you will find that the same strategies and decision-making skills that created real life economic empires will work for you in your quest to reach that magic level of success - to become a MILLIONAIRE (TM).

Those who have been succesful in real life are not afraid to be bold and decisive. They have let their money work for them rather than hiding dollars in dark corners. Expansion of existing operations and acquiring still futher interests at every opportunity are typical of the economic giants today.

The creators of the MILLIONAIRE (TM) game invite you to the world of risk and big loss - to the world of empire building and fantastic profits as you seek to become today's MILLIONAIRE (TM).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Brain Quest Around the World Game
description:
From the publisher:

Do you know the World? Learning about the world is fun with Brain Quest World Game. Have fun and test your smarts answering questions about the people, geography and history of the world. Players race around the world answering questions about different cities, countries and continents. Children can reference the map (game board) for clues to answer many of their questions. With questions designed by grade level, children from 3rd grade - 7th grade can all play this game together on a level playing field. When they answer a question correctly, they'll earn a token for that continent. The first player to collect a token for each of the seven continents wins the game. Comes with 660 Questions, Map Game Board, Continent Tokens, 4 Pawns, Spinner Card and Game Instructions. For 2 or more players, Ages 8 and up.

name: Pesca Polar
description:
From the box:

"Become a Eskimo and go to fish in the open ice. Run to your igloo when you have you food, if you are the first you won. But beware the blizzard and the polar bear, it's very hungry and if catch you they'll eat all your fishes."

Each player in turns takes the dice and roll it and move his token the number of spaces showed in the dice. But if the die show a bear icon, you roll the bear dice and apply it's effects

And kids games from Educa Borras.

name: Snowball Fighting
description:
Designed specifically for play by mail, this is an un-copyrighted multi-player game of snowball fighting.

Players write orders for simultaneous resolution using a simple action point system. Options include moving, collecting snow, several types of throws and a number of specific actions with the board features (conifers, snowmen and a shed).

name: EL
description: A pencil and paper game in which the first player to form an EL(six different numbers in a line with no more than one right angle turn) wins. A quick playing game that still contains a good deal of strategy.
